column2:
Beautiful acting, beautiful directing, not so great story
I had to open an account just to review this movie. This is a beautiful work of art.
column3:
Eré ṣíṣe tó fakọyọ, ìdarí tó fi òye hàn ṣùgbọ́n ìtàn yìí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ wúni lórí. 
Mo ní láti sí a sì àkáǹtì kí n lè ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wô eré yìí. Iṣẹ́ yìí rẹwà púpọ̀.
column4:
Iṣẹ iṣe ti o lẹwa, itọsọna ẹlẹwa, kii ṣe itan nla pupọ
Mo ni lati ṣii akọọlẹ kan lati ṣe atunyẹwo fiimu yii. Eyi jẹ iṣẹ ọna ti o lẹwa.

column2: Good movie, would love to see a continuation of this movie.
column3: Eré gidi tí màá fẹ́ láti rí ìtẹ̀síwájú rẹ̀ ni eré yìí jẹ́.
column4: Fiimu ti o dara, yoo nifẹ lati rii itesiwaju fiimu yii.

column2: One thing I like about the movie is the way the story was told and the ways the actors interpreted it. The writers, directors and cinematographers deserve an applaud for this effort.
column3: Nǹkan kan tí ó mo fẹ́ràn nínú eré yìí ni bí a ṣe sọ ìtàn rẹ̀ àti bí àwọn òṣèré ṣe túmọ̀ rẹ̀. Ó yẹ kí a gbé oríyìn fún àwọn òǹkọ̀tàn, olùdarí, àti àwọn a yàwòrán fún làálàá wọn lórí iṣẹ́ yìí.
column4: Ohun kan ti Mo nifẹ si fiimu naa ni ọna ti itan naa ṣe sọ ati awọn ọna ti awọn oṣere ṣe tumọ rẹ. Awọn onkọwe, awọn oludari ati awọn oniṣere sinima tọsi iyìn fun akitiyan yii.

column2: If you enjoyed the Godfather then you'll enjoy this. The storyline was beautiful and the plot twist at the end was incredible but there was some very unrealistic scenes that prove to be plot holes. But all in all the plot is very solid.
column3: Tí o bá gbádùn "Godfather", a jẹ́ pé wà á gbádùn èyí. Ìtàn eré náà rẹwà bẹẹni ẹ̀hun rẹ̀ pàápàá lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀yìn wúni lórí jọjọ ṣùgbọ́n àwọn abala kan wà tí kò lè ṣẹlẹ̀ lójú ayé. Èyí sì ni àléébù tí eré yìí ni. Àmọ́ ju gbogbo rẹ̀ lọ àhunpọ̀ itan yìí fakíki.
column4: Ti o ba gbadun Baba Ọlọrun lẹhinna o yoo gbadun eyi. Itan-akọọlẹ naa lẹwa ati pe idite ni ipari jẹ iyalẹnu ṣugbọn awọn iwoye ti ko daju pupọ wa ti o jẹri pe o jẹ awọn iho Idite. Ṣugbọn gbogbo ni gbogbo awọn Idite jẹ gidigidi ri to.

column2: On a Nollywood scale I'll give this movie an 9 because of it's unique storyline and excellent production which sets it aside from other Nigerian movies
column3: Màá fún ere yìí ni ẹẹ́sàn an lórí òṣùwọ̀n Nollywood nítorí ìtàn ere náà jẹ àrà ọ̀tọ, bẹ́ẹni àgbéjáde rẹ̀ tó jẹ́ kó yàtọ̀ sí gbogbo àwọn eré àgbéléwò yòókù ni ilẹ̀ Nàìjíríà

column2:
Still one of the Best Nigerian films of 2017
Isoken is a great film showcasing the culture of the area of the country. The layout, filming, colors and dressing tell much of the tradition quite well. The film has quite a good inject of laughter and great acting.
column3: Ọ̀kan lára fíìmù tí a ṣe tó dára jù ni ọdún 2017 ni “Isoken”. Ere yìí sàfihàn àṣà tó wà ní agbègbè orílè-èdè tí a ti se é jáde. Àlàkalẹ̀ eré naa ati, ìgbàwòran jáde, àti àwọ̀ àti aṣọ ló se àfihàn àṣà ìbílẹ̀ ni. Ère yìí tún ní ọ̀kan ò jọ̀kan abala ti tó lè pa ènìyàn lẹrin ín.
column4:
Ṣi ọkan ninu awọn fiimu Naijiria to dara julọ ti ọdun 2017
Isoken jẹ fiimu nla kan ti o nfihan aṣa ti agbegbe ti orilẹ-ede naa. Ifilelẹ, yiyaworan, awọn awọ ati imura sọ pupọ ti aṣa naa daradara. Awọn fiimu ni o ni oyimbo kan ti o dara abẹrẹ ti ẹrín ati nla osere.

column2: Great movie, great acting. would be nice to see a part 2 of it.

column4: Fiimu nla, iṣere nla. yoo jẹ dara lati ri apa kan 2 ti o.

column2: Hardly was there a period of 5 minute in this movie with nothing to smile, chuckle or laugh about. I don't think there is a Nigerian movie that beats this in it's genre (Fictional Comedy). The movie effects were as well commendable.
column3: Tipátipá ni a fi lè rí ojú ìṣẹ́jú márùn-ún tí kò pa ènìyàn lẹ́rìn-ín. N kò rò pé ere àgbéléwò kankan wà ní Nàìjíríà tó lè borí fíìmù yìí. Iṣẹ́ eré yìí kúnjú òṣùwọ̀n.
column4: O fee wa nibẹ akoko kan ti iṣẹju 5 ni fiimu yii laisi nkankan lati rẹrin musẹ, chuckle tabi rẹrin nipa. Mi o ro pe fiimu Naijiria kan wa ti o lu eyi ni oriṣi rẹ (Fictional Comedy). Awọn ipa fiimu naa jẹ iyìn daradara.

column2: I deeply appreciated seeing a movie with an emotional bond between two sisters who were connected in so many ways, but disconnected by romance and political views. The movie actors were superb and each character was perfectly cast for their roles.

column2: Audiences will be pleasantly entertained with Nigerian director Kemi Adetiba's The Wedding Party, a charming, romantic comedy with a unique international flavor.
column3: Láìsí àníàní, àwọn òǹwòran yóò gbádùn ere "The Wedding Party" tí Kemi Adetiba ṣe. Ere lọ́kọláya apanilẹ́rìn tó ní èròjà ilẹ̀ òkèèrè nínú.
column4: Awọn olugbo yoo jẹ igbadun pẹlu adari Naijiria Kemi Adetiba The Wedding Party, ẹlẹwa, awada romantic pẹlu adun alailẹgbẹ agbaye.

column2: Overall, it's a fascinating slice of modern history that may be unfamiliar to some, which can also give us an insight into the making of contemporary Nigeria.
column3: Lákòótán, ó jẹ́ ìtàn ayé òde-òní tó fanimọ́ra ṣùgbọ́n tó sàjèjì sí àwọn mìíràn. Ere yìí fún wa ní ìmọ̀ nípa Nàìjíríà òde òní.
column4: Lapapọ, o jẹ ege itan aye ode oni ti o fani mọra ti o le jẹ aimọ si awọn kan, eyiti o tun le fun wa ni oye si ṣiṣe ti Nigeria imusin.

column2: A well-acted, finely wrought epic that nevertheless struggles to balance the requirements of melodrama with its drive to capture a historical moment.
column3: Ere tí àgbékalẹ̀ rẹ dára ṣùgbọ́n tí ó tiraka láti sàfihàn àmúyẹ ere apanilẹ́rìín àti dírámà pẹ̀lú èrò láti ni ipa mọ́nigbàgbé.
column4: Aṣeṣe ti o dara, apọju ti a ṣe daradara ti o tiraka lati dọgbadọgba awọn ibeere ti melodrama pẹlu awakọ rẹ lati mu akoko itan kan.

column2: These people deserve a whole fucking lot of credit for this movie. The writing is eh. Performances are eh. But so, so hard, and they did it. You have to appreciate that. Also, this is not the Nigerian movie. This is a one-shot rom-com about twenty-something white people.
column3: Ó yẹ kí á lu àwọn ènìyàn yìí lọ́gọ ẹnu fún ere yìí. Bí ṣíṣe ere náà tilẹ̀ lágbára síbẹ̀ síbẹ̀ wọ́n ṣe é. Ó yẹ kí a gbóríyìn fún èyí. Bákan náà, kì í ṣe eré àgbéléwò Nàìjíríà nìyí. Ere olólùfẹ́ apanilẹ́rìn-ín tó ní ogún òyìnbó aláwọ̀ funfun ni fíìmù yìí.
column4: Awọn eniyan wọnyi yẹ fun kirẹditi pupọ fun fiimu yii. Awọn kikọ jẹ eh. Awọn iṣẹ ṣiṣe jẹ eh. Ṣugbọn bẹ, lile, nwọn si ṣe. O ni lati mọriri iyẹn. Bakannaa, eyi kii ṣe fiimu Naijiria. Eleyi jẹ a ọkan-shot rom-com nipa ogun-nkankan funfun eniyan.

column2: Farming may not be the best-executed story, but with a captivating performance by Damson Idris, nevertheless, it is still a story worth telling.
column3: Àlàyé lè má jẹ́ ọ̀nà tó dára láti sàgbékalẹ̀ ìtàn, àmọ́ sá Desmond Idris sàgbékalẹ̀ ere yìí dáadáa bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ó jẹ́ ìtàn àsọtúnsọ.
column4: Ogbin le ma jẹ itan-ṣiṣe ti o dara julọ, ṣugbọn pẹlu iṣẹ iyanilẹnu nipasẹ Damson Idris, sibẹsibẹ, o tun jẹ itan ti o tọ lati sọ.

column2: The tone of the film is also unexpectedly lyrical -- like a fairytale, albeit grimmer than Grimm. Unrelieved horror and violence can be enervating, but this film has the benefit of truth, and a message of survival.
column3: Ohùn orin tí a kò retí rárá ni fíìmù yìí lò, àfi bí i ìtàn àròsọ. Ìtàn aṣẹ̀rùbani tó lágbára ni bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni jàgídíjàgan pọ̀ nínú rẹ̀. Àmọ́ sá, ere sọ pàtàkì òótọ́ àti ìfaradà.
column4: Ohun orin ti fiimu naa tun jẹ orin lairotẹlẹ lairotẹlẹ - bi itan-akọọlẹ kan, botilẹjẹpe grimmer ju Grimm lọ. Ibanujẹ ti ko ni idasilẹ ati iwa-ipa le jẹ iwuri, ṣugbọn fiimu yii ni anfani ti otitọ, ati ifiranṣẹ ti iwalaaye.

Something new

Nǹkan tuntun 
 
Pẹ̀lúpẹ̀lú u bí a kò ṣe gba ti ere yìí, mo lérò pé gbogbo wàhálà Namaste yẹ ní wíwò bí kò tilẹ̀ ju iṣẹ̀jú kan lọ fún ṣíṣe nǹkan tuntun tó yàtọ̀.

Ohun titun

column4: Itan India-Afrika, tuntun ati onitura, laanu itan buburu ati iṣere.

column2: Impressive & funny how they portrayed both cultures. I was entertained all through! Clean cut production.

column4: Iwunilori & funny bi wọn ṣe ṣe afihan awọn aṣa mejeeji. Mo ti a ti entertained gbogbo nipasẹ! Mọ ge gbóògì.

Eré àgbéléwò ìfé tó lárindin lè yìí
column4:
Nice agbelebu-orilẹ-ede movie

Ohun kan ṣoṣo ti mi ko fẹran si fiimu yii ni ọna ti ko kere tabi ko si ibaraenisepo pẹlu agbegbe Naijiria tabi India.

Lẹwa romantic movie.

column2: It's a good movie and everyone need to know what's really going on, what our government is allowing to go on around the world.
column3: Eré àgbéléwò to dára púpò nii , àti pé  gbogbo ènìyàn níi láti mò ní pa àwọn oun  ti àwọn ìjọba ń fi àyè gbà ká ka kiri àgbáyé
column4: O jẹ fiimu ti o dara ati pe gbogbo eniyan nilo lati mọ ohun ti n ṣẹlẹ gaan, kini ijọba wa n gba laaye lati lọ kaakiri agbaye.

column2: Arie and Chuko Esiri’s film is understated in its attunement to the challenges of trying to escape a stagnant existence
column3: Fíìmù Arie ati Chuko Esiri  yénii nípa àfojúsí àtúnṣe sí àwọn ìdíwó  tó wà  láti ṣe àṣeyọrí.
column4: Fiimu Arie ati Chuko Esiri jẹ aibikita ni ibamu si awọn italaya ti igbiyanju lati sa fun aye ti o duro.

column2: I've never before seen a Nollywood film, so I was intrigued as to what director Biyi Bandele's 'Fifty' would be like. As it turns out, it was pretty much an African version of 'Dynasty'!
column3: Mi ò ti wo fíìmù Nollywood ríi , tó fi jẹ́ pé ìgbà àkókó ti ma wò ó , ìwárìrì  nípaeré àgbéléwò láti ọwó  oolùdarí Biyi Bandele tí ń jẹ́ “Fifty" mú mi káká. Nígbà ti mo wò ó dópin , ko féré yàtò si eré àgbéléwò ti ń je “Dynasty" tí a wá ṣe ni ìṣe ti àwọn adúláwò.
column4: Mi o tii ri fiimu Nollywood kan ri, bee lo je mi loju nipa bawo ni oludari Biyi Bandele ti ‘Aadọta’ yoo se ri. Bi o ti wa ni jade, o jẹ lẹwa Elo ẹya African version of 'Iba Oba'!

column2: Not your everyday dilemma, but as depicted in this lushly detailed and passionately performed melodrama, the mores and traditions of this sequestered, seldom depicted group take on a broader relevance.
column3: Atayán yán eléyìí ṣò wọ́n , ṣùgbọ́n bí  ati ríi nínú eré àgbéléwò aládùn tí a ṣètò  dáradára tí ó si fani móra yìí, àṣà ati ìṣe  àwọn ènìyàn ti a korira yii sèfárahàn ti o ye .
column4: Kii ṣe atayanyan lojoojumọ rẹ, ṣugbọn gẹgẹ bi a ti ṣe afihan ninu alaye ti o ni itara ati itara ti o ṣe melodrama, awọn ilana ati aṣa ti atẹle yii, ẹgbẹ ti a fihan ni alaiwa-afihan gba ibaramu ti o gbooro.

column2: The result is a work in which style and story unite to create a singularly mesmerizing look at a culture within a culture.
column3: Èsì isé na je ki  àsà ati ìṣe parapò lati gbé àsà ati ìṣe won jade lọ́nà to dara.
column4: Abajade jẹ iṣẹ kan ninu eyiti ara ati itan ṣe ṣọkan lati ṣẹda wiwo alarinrin kan ni aṣa kan laarin aṣa kan.

column2:
Was glued!!!!

column2: One salutary feature of this sharply observed film is that it does not eel compelled to make Seyi in any way magical: he cannot transcend the sump of addiction and corruption in which he allows himself to sink.
column3: Ę̀yà – ara gbòógì nípa eré àgbéléwò dáradára yìí ni pé , kò wẹ̀ Seyi mó  rárá : kò le wẹ ara ẹ̀ mó nínú àfésódì àti ìbàjé tó kó ra ẹ̀ sí
column4: Ẹya salutary kan ti fiimu ti a ṣe akiyesi ni wiwọ ni pe ko fi agbara mu eel lati ṣe Seyi ni ọna eyikeyi ti o jẹ idan: ko le kọja apejọ afẹsodi ati ibajẹ ninu eyiti o gba ararẹ laaye lati rì.

column2: "Narradores de Javé" is a funny and dramatic simple story supported by a good and original screenplay, great direction and excellent performances of the cast formed by actors, actresses and amateurish simple persons.
column3: “ Narradores de jave" Jẹ́ eré tó ń  pánilérìn pẹ̀lú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ pérétè  tí a tì léyìn pelu  àwòrán gidi , ìpele sí ìpele tó dára tó sì kún fún àwọn  òṣèré  lókùrin ati lóbìnrin.
column4: "Narradores de Javé" jẹ itan ti o rọrun ati iyalẹnu ti o ni atilẹyin nipasẹ iboju ti o dara ati atilẹba, itọsọna nla ati awọn iṣere ti o dara julọ ti simẹnti ti o ṣẹda nipasẹ awọn oṣere, awọn oṣere ati awọn eniyan ti o rọrun amateurish.

column2: "Narradores de Javé", a generally hidden treasure even here in Brazil, is a very good Brazilian film with a simple, but good story.
column3: “Narradores de jave" eré àgbéléwò ti àwọn ènìyàn ò ti mò nípa púpò kódà ni ìlú Brazil ti wón tí ń ṣe é , jẹ́ eré àgbéléwò Brazil tó dára tó sì jẹ́ pàtóo.
column4: "Narradores de Javé", ohun-ini ti o farapamọ ni gbogbogbo paapaa nibi ni Ilu Brazil, jẹ fiimu Brazil ti o dara pupọ pẹlu irọrun, ṣugbọn itan ti o dara.

Ogun tí ó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ ní orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà yìí jẹ́ rògbòdìyàn tí kò dára, eré yìí fi ìhà búburú orílè-èdè yìí hàn. Erè tó ní ìjà ni.
column4:
Fiimu Naijiria to dara

Ogun ni Nigeria jẹ rogbodiyan abamọ pupọ ati pe fiimu yii fihan wa ni ẹgbẹ dudu ti orilẹ-ede naa; o jẹ fiimu ere iṣe ti o dara.

column2: Juju stories is a three short stories in a 1 hr 20 mins movie. The first story 'Love Portion' is where the juice is, the second story is 'Yam' is a woeful failure and 'Suffer The Witch' is eerily good. It is a win, 2 out of 3 were good.
column3: Ìtàn nípa ògùn pín sí oríṣi mẹ́ta nínú eré àgbéléwò tó pàdé sí wákàtí kan lé ogún ìṣéjú. Ìtàn  àkókó “love portion" lódùn ju . Elékejì “yam" burú jáì àti elékeèta ‘suffer the witch' dùn díẹ̀. Eré méjì nínu méta dára, wọ́n gbìyànjú.
column4: Awọn itan Juju jẹ itan kukuru mẹta ni fiimu 1 wakati 20 iṣẹju kan. Itan akọkọ 'Ipin Ifẹ' ni ibi ti oje naa wa, itan keji jẹ 'Yam' jẹ ikuna ti o buruju ati 'Jijiya Ajẹ' dara pupọ. O ti wa ni a win, 2 ti 3 wà ti o dara.

column2:
It's good if you enjoy the subject

If this is a subject you like then it's a decent movie.

But it is extremely subdued and slow. The movie makes it worse and often is as loud as the speaking.
column3:

Àmọ́ bí fíìmù náà ti ń lọ ti fàà jù. Níṣe ló dà bíi eni wípé wọ́n fẹ́ tẹlè múyé.

Ṣugbọn o ti tẹriba pupọ ati o lọra. Fiimu naa jẹ ki o buru si ati nigbagbogbo n pariwo bi sisọ.”

column2:
I'd say: worth watching!

Well made, well played, good actors, even though it might seem a bit slow at times (and over 2 hrs altogether), I still think it is worth watching anytime. Of course, it is not the brightest and happiest movie to watch during these corona and pandemic times...

but I liked it.
column3:
Mo maa sọpé: Ó tó bẹ, ó ju be lo!
 
Eré àgbéléwò náà dára ,ó kún fún àwọn  òshèré tó mọ  isé. Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó n fáà lẹ́kọ̀ọ̀kan (bíi wákàtí méjì lápapò) . Lọ́kàn mi eeré náà tó bẹ́ẹ̀ . Eré àgbéléwò yìí kò sí lára àwọn fíìmù  tó dára jù, tí ó yẹ kí ènìyàn wò ni àsìkò kòrónà yìí……
 
Àmọ́ mo fẹ́ràn rẹẹ̀.
column4:
Emi yoo sọ: tọ lati wo!

Ti a ṣe daradara, dun daradara, awọn oṣere ti o dara, botilẹjẹpe o le dabi pe o lọra diẹ ni awọn akoko (ati ju awọn wakati 2 lapapọ), Mo tun ro pe o tọ lati wo nigbakugba. Nitoribẹẹ, kii ṣe fiimu didan julọ ati idunnu julọ lati wo lakoko awọn akoko corona ati awọn akoko ajakaye-arun…

sugbon mo feran re.

column2:
Realistic but slow pacing and very melodramatic.

Good acting, based on true events and a decent story. The pacing was a little too slow for my liking and some scenes feel like a made-for-tv movie (the cheese music and the over dramatization).

Overall watchable if you know what you are getting into ahead of time.
column3:
Eré- aládùn tó ní ìrírí  tó sì ń lo létòlétò.
 
Eré  tó dára, tó sì dá lóríi  ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tó ń lọ káàkàkiri,  ìtàn náà sì  jágere, àmọ́  wọ́n o ṣe kíá kíá , ṣe ló fáà , àti pé  irúfé  orin tí wọ́n lò àti bí wọn ti gbàkókò ènìyàn kò yẹ fún irú eré àgbéléwò báyìí .
Àmọ́  ó dára ní wíwò fún ẹni  tó bá ní àkòkò púpò lọ́wọ́.

Ohun kan ṣoṣo ti mi ko fẹran si fiimu yii ni ọna ti ko kere tabi ko si ibaraenisepo pẹlu agbegbe Naijiria tabi India.

Lẹwa romantic movie."

column2: Arie and Chuko Esiri’s film is understated in its attunement to the challenges of trying to escape a stagnant existence
column3: Fíìmù Arie ati Chuko Esiri  yénii nípa àfojúsí àtúnṣe sí àwọn ìdíwó  tó wà  láti ṣe àṣeyọrí.
column4: Fiimu Arie ati Chuko Esiri jẹ aibikita ni ibamu si awọn italaya ti igbiyanju lati sa fun aye ti o duro.

column2: "Narradores de Javé" is a funny and dramatic simple story supported by a good and original screenplay, great direction and excellent performances of the cast formed by actors, actresses and amateurish simple persons.
column3: “ Narradores de jave" Jẹ́ eré tó ń  pánilérìn pẹ̀lú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ to dára àti eré ṣíṣe to kún ojú òsùnwọ̀n, ìdarí náà dára púpọ̀, eré náà sì kún fún àwọn  òṣèré lókùrin ati lóbìnrin tí wón ṣe iṣé wọn dájú.
column4: "Narradores de Javé" jẹ itan ti o rọrun ati iyalẹnu ti o ni atilẹyin nipasẹ iboju ti o dara ati atilẹba, itọsọna nla ati awọn iṣere ti o dara julọ ti simẹnti ti o ṣẹda nipasẹ awọn oṣere, awọn oṣere ati awọn eniyan ti o rọrun amateurish.

column2: Juju stories is a three short stories in a 1 hr 20 mins movie. The first story 'Love Portion' is where the juice is, the second story is 'Yam' is a woeful failure and 'Suffer The Witch' is eerily good. It is a win, 2 out of 3 were good.
column3: Ìtàn nípa ògùn pín sí oríṣi mẹ́ta nínú eré àgbéléwò tó pàdé sí wákàtí kan lé ogún ìṣéjú. Ìtàn àkọ́kọ́ “love portion" lódùn ju . Elékejì “yam" burú jáì àti elékeèta ‘suffer the witch' dùn díẹ̀. Eré méjì nínu méta dára, wọ́n gbìyànjú.
column4: Awọn itan Juju jẹ itan kukuru mẹta ni fiimu 1 wakati 20 iṣẹju kan. Itan akọkọ 'Ipin Ifẹ' ni ibi ti oje naa wa, itan keji jẹ 'Yam' jẹ ikuna ti o buruju ati 'Jijiya Ajẹ' dara pupọ. O ti wa ni a win, 2 ti 3 wà ti o dara.

column2:
I'd say: worth watching!

Well made, well played, good actors, even though it might seem a bit slow at times (and over 2 hrs altogether), I still think it is worth watching anytime. Of course, it is not the brightest and happiest movie to watch during these corona and pandemic times...

but I liked it.
column3:
Mo maa sọpé: Ó tó bẹ, ó ju be lo!
 
Eré àgbéléwò náà dára ,ó kún fún àwọn  òshèré tó mọ  isé. Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó n fáà lẹ́kọ̀ọ̀kan ( bíi wákàtí méjì lápapò) . Lọ́kàn mi eeré náà tó bẹ́ẹ̀ . Eré àgbéléwò yìí kò sí lára àwọn fíìmù  tó dára jù, tí ó yẹ kí ènìyàn wò ni àsìkò kòrónà yìí……
 
Àmọ́ mo fẹ́ràn rẹẹ̀.
column4:
Emi yoo sọ: tọ lati wo!

Ti a ṣe daradara, dun daradara, awọn oṣere ti o dara, botilẹjẹpe o le dabi pe o lọra diẹ ni awọn akoko (ati ju awọn wakati 2 lapapọ), Mo tun ro pe o tọ lati wo nigbakugba. Nitoribẹẹ, kii ṣe fiimu didan julọ ati idunnu julọ lati wo lakoko awọn akoko corona ati awọn akoko ajakaye-arun…

sugbon mo feran re.

column2:
Nice cross-country movie

The only thing that I don't like about this movie is the way there was little or no interaction with the Nigerian or Indian environment.

Beautiful romantic movie.
column3:
Eré àgbéléwò dìdára lórí jákèjádò- orílè-èdè 
 
Oun kan pàtó tí mi ò  féràn nípa fíìmù yìí ni pé ko si ibásepò pẹlu ágbègbè orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà ati india bó ti  wu ó kéré mọ. 
 
Eré àgbéléwò ìfé tó lárindin lè yìí

Lẹwa romantic movie.

column2:
Was glued!!!!

I enjoyed it. It was brilliant coming from the stables of Hollywood movies. Not a wasted time spent
column3:
Ó mu mí  mólè !!!
 
Mo gbádùn rẹ. Èyí jẹ́ eré àgbéléwò tó dára púpò to jáde wá lá́ti inú àwọn fíìmù Hollywood . Mi ò fi àkókò mi ṣòfò rara.
column4:
"A ti fọwọ kan !!!!

Mo gbadun re. O wu ni wiwa lati awọn ibùso ti Hollywood sinima. Ko si akoko ti o padanu"

column2: This story was a beautiful picture of the balance of joy and sorrow during the time of the Nigerian Civil War. I loved it and I would recommend it.
column3: Eréym yìí jẹ́ àwòrán dídára tí ó sá fihàn iwọntún-wọnsì láàrin ayo àti ìbànújẹ́ nígbà ìjà ogún abẹlẹ ni Nàìjíríà. Mo feran rẹ mọ sì tún ro awon eniyan lati wo.
column4: Itan yii jẹ aworan ẹlẹwa ti iwọntunwọnsi ayọ ati ibanujẹ ni akoko Ogun Abele Naijiria. Mo nifẹ rẹ ati pe Emi yoo ṣeduro rẹ.

column2: No words to describe the power of this movie and its reminder of how fortunate it is to have never lived through a civil war. Extraordinary story telling of tragic, recent Nigerian history and the humanity within it all.
column3: Kò sí ọ̀rọ̀ kánkán tí ó le júwe irú agbára tí ère yìí ni ati wípé ó ṣe ìrántí oriire tí ó jé láti là ìjà abéle kọjá. Ìtàn àgbàyanu tí ó sọ nípa ìtàn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ni burúkú tí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti nípa àwọn ènìyàn inú rẹ.
column4: Ko si awọn ọrọ lati ṣapejuwe agbara ti fiimu yii ati olurannileti rẹ ti bi o ṣe ni orire to lati ko tii gbe ninu ogun abele rara. Itan iyalẹnu ti o buruju, itan-akọọlẹ Naijiria aipẹ ati ẹda eniyan laarin gbogbo rẹ.

column2: Fantastic lead acting. Left emotionally devastated. Story is powerful.
column3: Ise Òṣeré tí ó pè dé gé tí ó sì ní ìmọ̀lára gidigidi. Ìtàn na lágbára.
column4: Ikọja asiwaju osere. Osi taratara devastated. Itan lagbara.

column2: This film is is a true story and is absolutely brilliant and moving.
column3: Ere yìí jé ìtàn tòótọ́ tí ó sì jẹ ìṣe ọpọlọ
column4: Fiimu yii jẹ itan otitọ ati pe o wuyi ati gbigbe.

column2: I  just watched this at The Newport Beach Film Festival, and this has got to be one of the best movies I have ever seen. The movie had a good pace with excellent writing & production.
column3: MO ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ wo ère yìí ni The Newport Beach Film Festival, o si je ará àwọn ère tí ó dára púpọ̀ tí mo ti wò. Ère náà ni ìwọ̀n tí ó dára pẹ̀lú kiko àti ìgbèjà de tí ó dára.
column4: Mo kan wo eyi ni The Newport Beach Film Festival, ati pe eyi ni lati jẹ ọkan ninu awọn fiimu ti o dara julọ ti Mo ti rii tẹlẹ. Fiimu naa ni iyara to dara pẹlu kikọ ati iṣelọpọ to dara julọ.

column2: I have read the book and i thought that the film was brilliant with very strong performances by the main actors. One of the best films I have seen this year with old news footage interwoven with the main story
column3: MO ti ká ìwé náà, mo sì rọ wípé èrè náà dára pẹlu iṣẹ́ tó lágbára nípasẹ̀ àwọn Òṣeré pàtàkì. Ó jé ọkàn lára àwọn ère tó dára tí mo ti wò nínú ọdún yìí pẹlu ìròyìn àtijó tó wepọ mọ ìtàn náà.
column4: Mo ti ka iwe naa ati pe Mo ro pe fiimu naa jẹ didan pẹlu awọn iṣẹ ṣiṣe ti o lagbara pupọ nipasẹ awọn oṣere akọkọ. Ọkan ninu awọn fiimu ti o dara julọ ti Mo ti rii ni ọdun yii pẹlu awọn aworan iroyin atijọ ti o ni ajọṣepọ pẹlu itan akọkọ

column2: Great ending. This movie kept me interested until the end, which is not easy to find in movies these days. A little predictable but still has suspense.
column3: Ìparí tí ó dára. Ère yìí mú kí nifẹ si títí dé ìparí tí ó sì ní ra láti rí nínú àwọn ère láyé òde yìí. Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé èèyàn lè sọ nkan ti o ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú eré náà sibesibe ó ti fi èèyàn sínú òkùnkùn.
column4: Ipari nla. Fiimu yii jẹ ki n nifẹ si titi di opin, eyiti ko rọrun lati wa ninu awọn fiimu ni awọn ọjọ wọnyi. Asọtẹlẹ diẹ ṣugbọn tun ni ifura.

column2: Destiny Ekaragha's "Gone Too Far" is so London, so Naijia, so Jamaica, and just so hilarious to boot. It had me in stitches, laughing so hard until those stitches opened. Loved the movie's fast paced story-line, catchy sound tracks, brilliant cast, and talented actors
column3: Ise Destiny Ekaragha "Gone too far" jọ londonu, Naijiria ati Jamaica, ó sì pani lè rìn púpò. ó mú mi sínú aranpo, mo sì rẹ́rìn-ín kárakára títí tí aranpọ náà fi ja. Mo feran ìtàn ère náà tí ó ní ìwọ̀n tí ó yára, pelu orin rẹ tó peni mọ́ra.
column4: Destiny Ekaragha's "Ti lọ Ju jina" jẹ bẹ London, bẹ Naijia, bẹ Jamaica, ati ki o kan ki panilerin lati bata. O ni mi ni awọn aranpo, n rẹrin pupọ titi ti awọn aranpo yẹn yoo ṣii. O nifẹ si laini itan ti o yara ti fiimu naa, awọn orin ohun mimu, simẹnti didan, ati awọn oṣere alamọdaju

column2: fantastic movie
column3: Eré tí o dára .
column4: ikọja movie

column2:
One of the greatest artistic pieces of all time

This film is undeniably one of the greatest movies of our generations. This film plays with the viewers emotions through its entirety and did a fantastic job mixing the different genres the film industry has to offer. Another way to describe this film is that it is a landmark in the industry and offers nothing but innovation. The future is nothing but bright for Nollywood with this films release
column3:
Ọkàn lára àwọn ère tí ó ní ìṣe ṣíṣe tí ó dára ní àkókò yìí. 
Eré yìí jé ọkàn nínú àwọn eré tí ó dára tí ó sì tayọ ni ìran yìí. Ère fi imolara àwọn olùwò hàn nínú gbogbo ère náà, eré náà sise dáradára nípa mímú onírúurú ọ̀nà eré sise papọ. Ona mìíràn láti ṣàpèjúwe eré yìí ni wípé ó jé àlà ilé titun nínú ilé ìṣe tí ó sì jẹ wípé yóò mú kí ìṣe atinuda wá. Ọjọ́ iwájú Nollywood dára púpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìgbèjà dé fíìmù yìí.
column4:
Ọkan ninu awọn ege iṣẹ ọna ti o tobi julọ ni gbogbo akoko

Fiimu yii jẹ laiseaniani ọkan ninu awọn fiimu nla julọ ti awọn iran wa. Fiimu yii ṣere pẹlu awọn ẹdun awọn oluwo nipasẹ gbogbo rẹ ati pe o ṣe iṣẹ ikọja kan ti o dapọ awọn oriṣi oriṣiriṣi ti ile-iṣẹ fiimu ni lati funni. Ọnà miiran lati ṣe apejuwe fiimu yii ni pe o jẹ ami-ilẹ ni ile-iṣẹ naa ati pe o funni ni nkankan bikoṣe ĭdàsĭlẹ. Ojo iwaju kii ṣe nkankan bikoṣe imọlẹ fun Nollywood pẹlu itusilẹ fiimu yii.

column2:
Well written and superbly directed!

Nigeria is really peculiar, from the demographics and its diversity, Doctor Lanre touches every part our realities and everyday living. Doctor Lanre is a must watch!
column3:
Eré ti wọn kọ dára tí wọn sì dárí dáadáa pelu. 
Nàìjíríà je orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó yàtọ̀ pelu ilẹ̀, iye ènìyàn àti onírúurú tí ó wà nínú rẹ. Eré Doctor Lanre fọwọ́ bà gbògbò èka ìgbé ayé ènìyàn lójoojúmọ́. Eré dókítà Lanre je dandan láti wò.
column4:
Ti kọ daradara ati itọsọna ti o dara julọ!

Nàìjíríà ṣe pàtàkì gan-an, láti inú ẹ̀ka ìjìnlẹ̀ ẹ̀dá ènìyàn àti oríṣiríṣi rẹ̀, Dókítà Lanre fọwọ́ kan gbogbo apá òtítọ́ wa àti ìgbé ayé ojoojúmọ́. Dokita Lanre jẹ dandan lati wo! ”

column2:
A great watch
Doctor Lanre is a well written movie, captures our different characters and kept me glued to my screen until the last minute. I great watch for everyone, young or old, married or single. I will be looking out for other reviews.
column3:
Eré nla fún wíwò.
Dokita Lanre jẹ eré ti won kọ dáadáa, ti o ṣàfihàn onírúurú iwa ti o sí wo titi dé òpin. Eré tó yẹ fún wíwò gbogbo ènìyàn bóyá ọmọ kékeré tabi arúgbó, eni to ti gbeyawo ni tabi eni ti ko ti gbeyawo. Ma má fojusona fún àgbéyẹwò mìíràn.
column4:
Agogo nla kan
Dokita Lanre jẹ fiimu ti a kọ daradara, o ya awọn kikọ oriṣiriṣi wa o si jẹ ki n lẹ pọ si iboju mi titi di iṣẹju to kẹhin. Mo wo nla fun gbogbo eniyan, ọdọ tabi agbalagba, iyawo tabi apọn. Emi yoo wa awọn atunyẹwo miiran. ”

column2:
Doctor Lanre' is an Interesting Shift

I am glad to be one of the first on the train of this movie. This is an interesting shift. The story has a rich plot that is carried effortlessly by the superb performances of the cast. 
This is a must-see.
column3:
Dokita Lanre jẹ ìyípadà tó dùn moní.
Inu mi dun wipe mo wà lára àwọn ti o kọkọ wá nínú reluwe eré yii. Ìyípadà ti o dun mo ni ni o jẹ. Ìtàn na ni ìpìlẹ ti o dára tí wọn sì gbé jade dáadáa nipasẹ ìkópa awọn òṣèré ti o kún oju oṣuwọn.
Eré tó yẹ fún wíwò.
column4:
"Dokita Lanre" jẹ iyipada ti o wuni

Inu mi dun lati jẹ ọkan ninu akọkọ lori ọkọ oju irin ti fiimu yii. Eleyi jẹ ẹya awon naficula. Itan naa ni igbero ọlọrọ ti o jẹ lainidi nipasẹ awọn iṣẹ ṣiṣe to dara julọ ti simẹnti naa.
Eyi jẹ ohun ti a gbọdọ rii. ”

column2:
Great Piece

This is a well-crafted, mind blowing work. The fact that I couldn't guess or know how it was going to end, blew my mind. The suspense is top notch. No unnecessary clip to prolong the movie but straight to the point. This is changing the narrative of Nollywood movies. Cheers to the Writer and Director. Highly recommended.
column3:
Eré nla.
 
Iṣẹ atinuda ti o yanilenu. Nítorípé mi o le ṣọtẹlẹ nkan ti yóò ṣẹlẹ nipari yamilenu gidigidi. Ifẹnisokunkun náà lagbara. Kò sí asẹsẹ ti ma fi àkókò ẹni ṣofo, niiṣe ni eré náà lọ tààrà síbi kókó eré náà.  Eléyìí sì yii ìtàn sísọ àwọn Nollywood pada, koriya fún olukowẹ ati oludari. Mo ro awon eniyan lati wo.
column4:
Nkan nla

Eyi jẹ iṣẹ-ṣiṣe ti o dara, iṣẹ fifun ọkan. Otitọ ti Emi ko le gboju tabi mọ bi yoo ṣe pari, fẹ ọkan mi. Awọn ifura ni oke ogbontarigi. Ko si agekuru ti ko wulo lati fa fiimu naa gun ṣugbọn taara si aaye. Eyi n yi itan-akọọlẹ ti awọn fiimu Nollywood pada. Ẹ ku fun onkọwe ati oludari. Ni iṣeduro ga julọ.

column2:
Such wonderful writing

Doctor Lanre is a wonderful movie. Had so much fun watching this one. It captures the everyday life, demographic, region, it is diverse and a joy to watch.
column3:
Ikọwẹ ti o yanilenu
Dokita Lanre jẹ eré tó yanilenu. Mo gbádùn arami nigbati mo wo. O ṣàfihàn igbe-aye ojojumọ awon eniyan, iye-eniyan ati ẹkùn, o yàtọ o sí dun fún wíwò.
column4:
Iru kikọ iyanu bẹ

Dokita Lanre jẹ fiimu iyanu. Ni igbadun pupọ lati wo eyi. O mu igbesi aye lojoojumọ, agbegbe, agbegbe, o yatọ ati ayọ lati wo. ”

column2:
One of the Best movie from Nigeria so far

A Better family is a movie that I'm very proud of when it comes to Nigerian Nollywood movies. This is a movie that you got to enjoy every bit of it from beginning to the end. It's strong lesson on relationship for both married and singles always blow me away. This movie is a must watch for both married and singles.
column3:
Ọkan lára àwọn eré tó dára jùlọ ní Naijiria.
Eré 'a better family jẹ eré ti mo gbé ìwúrí fún nigbati a n ba sọrọ awọn eré Nollywood Naijiria. Eré yii jẹ eré ti o gbádùn gbogbo rẹ lati ibere titi dé òpin. Ẹkọ rẹ lórí ibaṣepọ fún àwọn tó ti gbeyawo ati awọn ti won ko ti gbeyawo yamilenu gidigidi. Eré yii jẹ agbọdọ wo fún àwọn tó ti gbeyawo ati awon odo ọsọro.
column4:
Ọkan ninu fiimu to dara julọ lati Naijiria titi di isisiyi

Ìdílé Dara jùlọ jẹ́ fíìmù tí inú mi dùn gan-an nígbà tí ó bá ń ṣe fíìmù Nollywood ti Nàìjíríà. Eyi jẹ fiimu ti o ni lati gbadun gbogbo diẹ ninu rẹ lati ibẹrẹ si ipari. O ni lagbara ẹkọ lori ibasepo fun awọn mejeeji iyawo ati awọn kekeke nigbagbogbo fẹ mi kuro. Fiimu yii jẹ dandan lati wo fun awọn mejeeji ti o ni iyawo ati awọn apọn. ”

column2: Brilliant film. a really good watch
column3: Eré ọpọlọ, ti o dára fún wíwò.
column4: Fiimu ti o wuyi. a gan ti o dara aago

column2: This is an incredibly tasteful movie. Great acting by the leading lady.
column3: Eré iyalẹnu gidigidi. Ìkópa òṣèré didara nipasẹ òṣèré pakiti obìnrin.
column4: Eleyi jẹ ẹya ti iyalẹnu tasteful movie. Nla osere nipa awọn asiwaju iyaafin.

column2: Good to see a Nollywood movie that unites tribes and promote gender equality in an interesting way.
column3: O dára láti rí eré Nollywood ti sọ ẹyà papọ ti o polongo dọgbadọgba laarin ọkunrin ati obinrin ni ona ti yanilenu.
column4: O dara lati rii fiimu Nollywood kan ti o so awọn ẹya kan pọ ati ṣe agbega imudogba akọ ni ọna ti o nifẹ.

column2: A feel-good movie with the right cultural mix. A lot to be learnt from a super woman who fights hard to keep her place in a male dominated world. Warm and awesome movie!
column3: Eré tó dára pẹlú idapọ asa ni ona tó dára. Ẹkọ pọ lati kọ latara obìnrin akínkanjú to gbìyànjú láti já ipo re ninu Aye tó awọn ọkunrin joba le lori. Eré tó dára gidigidi.
column4: A rilara-dara movie pẹlu awọn ọtun asa illa. Pupọ lati kọ ẹkọ lati ọdọ obinrin nla kan ti o ja lile lati tọju aaye rẹ ni agbaye ti o jẹ gaba lori ọkunrin. Fiimu ti o gbona ati oniyi!

column2: great movie, sending love from Naija
column3: Eré nla, mo fi ìfẹ ranṣẹ láti naija.
column4: movie nla, fifiranṣẹ ife lati Naija

column2: Beautiful story that portrays Nigerian culture. The story is so unique and unpredictable unlike an average Nigerian movie. A must watch
column3: Ìtàn to lewa ti o ṣàfihàn àṣà ilẹ Nàìjíríà. Ìtàn náà yàtọ ti o sí nira lati lè mọ ìparí rẹ gẹgẹ bi awọn eré Naijiria miiran. Agbọdọ wo ni eré náà
column4: Itan lẹwa ti o ṣe afihan aṣa Naijiria. Itan naa jẹ alailẹgbẹ ati aisọtẹlẹ ko dabi apapọ fiimu Naijiria. A gbọdọ wo

column2: Genevieve Nnaji stamps her foot concretely in the pantheon of genuis directors. She doesn't disappoint in her debut, Lion Heart. It's a must watch, as it announces the birth of an international Nollywood.
column3: Genevieve Nnaji kan ẹsẹ mọlẹ ninu awọn.oludari olóyè. Kò já kulẹ nínú iṣẹ àkọkọ rẹ. Eré lion heart je agbọdọ wo, bi o se polongo ibi Nollywood káàkiri àgbáyé.
column4: Genevieve Nnaji fi ontẹ ẹsẹ rẹ ni pato ni pantheon ti awọn oludari onigbagbo. O ko ni ibanujẹ ninu iṣafihan akọkọ rẹ, Lion Heart. O jẹ dandan lati wo, bi o ṣe n kede ibimọ Nollywood agbaye kan.

column2: Film showcases a dynamic look at Nigeria from the lenses of a progressive female protagonist navigating her way through a male dominated business culture. The characters particularly the Uncle are funny and engaging.
column3: Eré náà ṣàfihàn ti o yàtọ ti a gba wo Naijiria nipasẹ òṣèré pataki obinrin ti o sakitiyan lati duro lori ẹsẹ rẹ laarin aṣa owo ti awọn ọkunrin joba le lori. Awọn òṣèré papa julọ 'Uncle' panilerin gidigidi.
column4: Fiimu ṣe afihan iwo ti o ni agbara ni Naijiria lati awọn iwo ti akọrin obinrin ti o ni ilọsiwaju ti nlọ kiri ni ọna rẹ nipasẹ aṣa iṣowo ti o jẹ olori akọ. Awọn ohun kikọ paapaa Arakunrin jẹ ẹrin ati ifaramọ.

column2: It was completely refreshing to watch from start to finish. An intresting deviation from the typical Nollywood movie. Veteran actors Pete Edochie and Nkem Owoh effortlessly show us why they are the best in Nollywood. Genevieve definitely sets a standard for local Nollywood movies with Lions Heart and as for her Directorial debut, someone give her an award!
column3: O jẹ igba otun lati wo lati ibere titi dé opin. Iyapa ti o dára láti iru àwọn eré Nollywood tele. Òṣèré àgbà Peter Edochie ati Nkem Owoh ṣàfihàn bi won je awon osere to kún oju oṣuwọn ni Nollywood. Genevieve fi gbendeke sílẹ fún àwọn òṣèré abẹle pẹlu Lion heart ati pẹlu isẹ àkọkọ rẹ gẹgẹ bi oludari. Ẹnikan fún ni àmì ẹyẹ.
column4: O jẹ onitura patapata lati wo lati ibẹrẹ si ipari. Iyapa iyanilẹnu lati fiimu Nollywood aṣoju. Gbajugbaja osere tiata Pete Edochie ati Nkem Owoh fi akitiyan han wa idi ti won fi gbajugbaja ni Nollywood. Ni pato Genevieve ṣeto idiwọn kan fun awọn fiimu Nollywood agbegbe pẹlu Lions Heart ati fun Uncomfortable Directorial, ẹnikan fun ni ẹbun kan!

column2:
Greetings, the movie the figurine reminds me a lesson from the English text book read during or probably school days, namely The Bottle Imp. The crux of the movie plot/story is identical equal to the bottle imp. Please no controversies, just my opinion, that is all. 
Thanking you...
column3: Ìkíni. Eré náà ran mi leti ẹkọ kan lati inu iwe geesi kan ti mo ka nígbàtí mo wa níleewe, ti a akọle re je The bottle Imp. Ìtàn eré yii jọmọ ìtàn The bottle imp. Ẹ jo kó sì àríyànjiyàn o, ẹrọ témi nìyẹn. Ẹsẹ.
column4: "Ẹ kí, fiimu figurine leti mi ẹkọ kan lati inu iwe ọrọ Gẹẹsi ti a ka lakoko tabi boya awọn ọjọ ile-iwe, eyun The Bottle Imp. The crux of the movie plot/ story is identical dogba si igo imp. Jọwọ ko si controversies, just my ero, ti o jẹ gbogbo.O ṣeun… ”…

column2: How does a movie with this subject matter wind up being this slow and boring? Where is the urgency? Where is the suspense and tension? The editing and the pacing drove me nuts and there's just no way this thing needed to be nearly two and half hours long. And that's really a shame because it highlights a really big and important problem, I just wish it did so without putting the audience to sleep.
column3: Bo ni o ṣe jẹ wípé eré tó ní irú akole yii se di wipe o lọrá ti o sí danilagara. Nibo ni ìkánjú wa? Nibi ni ifẹni sokunkun ati aibalẹ ọkan wa pẹlu? Isatunkọ ati iwọn rẹ bi mi nínú ti o sí ònà ti o fi je kí eré náà tó wakati meji at'abo. Nkan to dojutì ni ni wípé eré náà ṣàfihàn ìṣòro tó ṣe kókó, emi kan ro wipe won le eré náà lai mu kí àwọn oluworan ma sun.
column4: Bawo ni fiimu kan ti o ni koko-ọrọ yii ṣe afẹfẹ soke jije yi lọra ati alaidun? Nibo ni iyara naa wa? Nibo ni ifura ati ẹdọfu wa? Ṣiṣatunṣe ati pacing naa jẹ ki mi pẹ ati pe ko si ọna nkan yii nilo lati fẹrẹ to wakati meji ati idaji. Ati pe iyẹn jẹ itiju gaan nitori pe o ṣe afihan iṣoro nla kan ati pataki, Mo kan fẹ ki o ṣe bẹ laisi fifi awọn olugbo si sun.

Fiimu ti o dara gaan
Boya eleyi ni fiimu Naijiria to dara julọ ti Mo ti rii tẹlẹ. Ni pato kilasi kan loke awọn nkan Nollywood ina rẹ deede. Awọn kikọ ati Idite ti ni idagbasoke daradara ati ojulowo. Noah ati Dominic jẹ nla gaan ni iṣe wọn. ”

column2:
Plot seems boring at first but brilliant movie overall

I would say Road to yesterday is your typical 'Genevieve' movie. Slow- paced, good acting and drama filled. The movie starts out with an obvious quarrel between a couple (played by Genevieve Nnaji & Oris Erhuero) which seemed normal at first, but however dragged on for the better part of the movie (boring at some points). You are left in the dark curious about the cause of the quarrel but this is revealed bit by bit through constant flashbacks, eventually all is left bare and the plot kicks in. Recommended if you are not going to the theater expecting an endless action plot, but rather mature drama. Suitable characters, good plot and overall an interesting movie.
column3: Àgbékalẹ̀ eré náà kò mú adùn wálâkọ́kọ́, ṣùgbọ́n eré àgbéléwò tí ó wuyìni lâkójọpọ̀. Èmi ìbá sọ wípé ‘Road To Yesterday’ ló ṣe àpẹẹrẹ eré Genevieve. Ó fi àpẹ̀lẹ́ tẹ̀síwájú, ó ní eré ṣíṣe tí ó dára, ó sì kún fún idán. Ere náà bèrè pẹ̀lú èdè-àìyedè tí ó hàn sí gbangba láàrin lókoláya (tí Genevieve Nnaji àti Oris Erhuero ṣe) tí ó dàbí wí pé kò faàkíyèsí pàtàkì lâkọ́kọ́, ṣùgbọ́n ó tàn títí dé èyí tí ó pọ̀ jù nínú Fíìmù  náà (ó súni ní àwọn ibìkan). Ó fini sílẹ̀ nínú òkùnkùn ìwádìí òkùnfà èdè-àìyedè náà ṣùgbọ́n wón ṣe àfihàn rẹ̀ díẹ̀-díẹ̀ pẹ̀lú títan ìmọ́lẹ̀ sí àtẹ̀yìnwá ọ̀rọ̀, lẹ́yìn o rẹyìn gbogbo rẹ̀ ni ó hàn kedere, tí àgbékalẹ̀ eré náà ṣe rẹ́gí. Mo gba àwọn ènìyàn ní iyànjú láti wo eré yìí tí èròmgbà wọn ò bá jẹ́ látì lọsí tiata fún àgbékalẹ̀ eré tí ó kún fún ìṣe.
column4:
“Idite dabi alaidun ni akọkọ ṣugbọn fiimu ti o wuyi lapapọ

Emi yoo sọ opopona si lana jẹ aṣoju fiimu 'Genevieve' aṣoju rẹ. O lọra, iṣe iṣe ti o dara ati ere ti o kun. Fiimu naa bẹrẹ pẹlu ariyanjiyan ti o han gbangba laarin tọkọtaya kan (ti o ṣe nipasẹ Genevieve Nnaji & Oris Erhuero) eyiti o dabi ẹnipe o ṣe deede ni akọkọ, ṣugbọn sibẹsibẹ fa lori fun apakan ti o dara julọ ti fiimu naa (alaidun ni awọn aaye kan). O ti wa ni osi ni dudu iyanilenu nipa awọn fa ti awọn ìja sugbon yi ti wa ni fi han bit nipa bit nipasẹ ibakan flashbacks, bajẹ gbogbo awọn ti wa ni osi igboro ati awọn Idite bere ni. Niyanju ti o ba ti o ko ba wa ni lilọ si itage nreti ohun ailopin igbese Idite, sugbon dipo ogbo eré. Awọn ohun kikọ ti o yẹ, igbero ti o dara ati gbogbogbo fiimu ti o nifẹ. ”

column2:
Searching for a soundtrack & review

There'se a soundtrack at the end of the movie. On the background. It contains no words, it's more a melody. I'm trying to find the name of it.

Beside that, great movie, really slow paced. Acting is realistic. No absurb emotions or anything like that. The conversations, the choosen words, the evens, the chemistry. It looks natural like you're watching a real situation. There's alot of silent moments and stuff like that. So you either like this type of movies, or you don't
column3:
Mo ń wá ohùn orin àti àgbéyẹ̀wò
 
Ohùn orin kan wà ní ìparí Fíìmù  náà. Ní abẹ́lẹ̀, kò ní ọ̀rọ̀, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ohùn aládùn ni ó jẹ́. Mo ń gbìyànjú láti wá orúkọ rẹ̀.
 
Lẹ́yìn ìyẹn, Fíìmù  ńlá ni, ó fi àpẹ̀lẹ́ púpò tẹ̀síwájú. Ìṣọwọ́ṣeré rẹ̀ bòjúmu. Kò sí ìmọ̀sílára tàbí ohunkóhun bíirẹ̀ tí kò bòjúmu. Àwọn ìbánisọ̀rọ̀, ọ̀rọ̀ tí wọ́n yàn láti sọ, àwọn ìbádọ́gba, ìfanimọ́ra ní ọ̀tún àti òsì. Gbogbo wọn ló bá ìwà ẹ̀dá mu bí ẹni ń wo ohun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ lójú ayé. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àsìkò ìdákẹ́rọ́rọ́ àti ohun bíirẹ̀ wà. Nítorínâ, o ní láti fẹ́ràn irú Fíìmù  yìí àbí kí o mâ fẹràn rẹ̀; kò sí wíwà ní àárín méjì.
column4:
Ṣawari fun ohun orin & atunyẹwo

Ohun orin kan wa ni ipari fiimu naa. Lori abẹlẹ. Ko si awọn ọrọ ninu, o jẹ orin aladun diẹ sii. Mo n gbiyanju lati wa orukọ rẹ.

Ni egbe ti, nla movie, gan o lọra rìn. Ṣiṣe iṣe jẹ ojulowo. Ko si awọn ẹdun asan tabi ohunkohun bii iyẹn. Awọn ibaraẹnisọrọ, awọn ọrọ yiyan, awọn iṣẹlẹ, kemistri. O dabi adayeba bi o ṣe n wo ipo gidi kan. Awọn akoko ipalọlọ pupọ wa ati nkan bii iyẹn. Nitorinaa o fẹran iru awọn fiimu yii, tabi o ko fẹ

column2: Told with raw emotion and lurid violence, it transforms elements of his life story into a disturbing, eye-opening coming of age drama
column3: Wọ́n sọ pẹlú ògidì ìmọ̀sílára àti ìwà-ipá tí ó banilẹ́rú, ó yí àwọn òkan-òjọ̀kan ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ayé rẹ̀ padà sí eré ìtàgé tí ó sínilóju, tí ó sì bágbà mu.
column4: Ti a sọ pẹlu ẹdun aise ati iwa-ipa lurid, o yi awọn eroja ti itan igbesi aye rẹ pada si idamu kan, ṣiṣi oju ti ere ere ọjọ-ori

column2:
What a disturbing but engaging story

This is a really disturbing story. I feel so sad for Enitan, I cannot possibly imagine what he went through in his childhood. His transformation is remarkable. In the final ending it reveals who Enitan is, and I'm shocked by the revelation. It brings the film to another level of emotional climax.
column3:
Irú ìtàn tí ó ń dani láàmú ṣùgbọ́n tí ó ń kóni ní papá móra wo ni èyí!
 
Ìtàn yìí ń po ẹni nínú pọ̀ gan-an ni. Inú mi gan-an fún Eniìtàn, mi ò lè ṣàdédé fi ojú inú wo ohun tí ó làkọjá ní ìgbà èwe rẹ̀. Àyípadà rẹ̀ jọnilójú. Ìparí rẹ̀ fi eni tí Eniìtàn jẹ́ hàn, ìfihàn náà síì ṣe mí ní kàyéfì. Ó mú Fíìmù  náà wá sí ìmọ̀sílára tí ó lé téńté ní ipele mìíràn.
column4:
Kini o jẹ idamu ṣugbọn itan ifarabalẹ

Eyi jẹ itan idamu gaan. Ibanujẹ mi dun pupọ fun Enitan, Emi ko ṣee ṣe fojuinu ohun ti o ṣẹlẹ ni igba ewe rẹ. Iyipada rẹ jẹ iyalẹnu. Ni ipari ipari o ṣafihan ẹni ti Enitan jẹ, ati pe iṣipaya naa ya mi lẹnu. O mu fiimu naa wa si ipele miiran ti ipari ẹdun. ”

column2: Those negative reviews for this movie are a joke. People need to leave their personal feelings and viewpoints out of it when they are reviewing a movie. And those petty enough to call the director out as a "liar," claiming "this never happened" nonsense is equally ridiculous; it's a movie, created to entertain and or educate. Who cares if it's fact or fiction? The people with this complaint probably believe that Hollywood trash like "Pearl Harbor" is not mostly fiction. On to the technical aspects of this movie, (something that actually matters), "Farming" is a beautifully, artfully shot slice of eye candy, which is ironic considering the grotesquely ugly themes of this difficult movie. Kate Beckinsale is utterly believable as the Cockney speaking Londoner who brings extra cash into the house by raising the Nigerian children left in her care by parents who don't have the means to raise them. Growing up in a completely White surrounding, where most everyone seems to be at least a little racist, and sometimes intensely racist against the people who's skin color is the same as young Enitan, the Nigerian boy, thrust into this alien world where everyone looks different from him. This film is basically about self identity, and how our surroundings and upbringing shape the person we become, and how our minds work. So although Enitan is Black, he grows up like his peers, despising people with black skin. What an insane and unique theme for a film..FINALLY something different. When Enitan joins up with the skinhead gang who had been torturing him, things become quite intense indeed. He calls himself Andy and shaves off his offending afro, so desperate to be among the people he relates to, even as they hate him and abuse him to no end. Movies about skinhead culture are rare, maybe one appears every 10 years or so. This one stands out with the best of them, including "This Is England," "Romper Stomper," and is especially similar in tone to "Made In Britain" with Tim Roth. Also worthy of praise is the acting in "Farming," as everyone turns in intensely believable performances. John Dagleish gives an especially ferocious performance as 'Levi,' the leader of the Tilbury skinheads, and Damson Idris' portrayal of the tortured, self loathing Enitan is brave and faultless. This movie is destined for cult status as it finds it's right audience. Those pathetic 1 star reviews prove that this film reached the wrong audience. Oh well, "Blade Runner" was also a flop when it first came out, so only time will tell. I recommend "Farming" to fans of edgy cinema that doesn't shy away from uncomfortable scenarios, and also to those interested in the Skinhead youth culture of the 70's and 80's. Similar to "The Krays" and "Legend," thankfully this is also a British production, so it manages to avoid the sappy, moralizing and PC garbage that Hollywood feels the need to inject into it's productions.
column3: Àwọn àgbéyẹ̀wò òdì ti fíìmù yìí ní jẹ́àwàdà. Àwọn èèyàn ní láti fi ìkùnsínúàfojúsùn ara wọn sílẹ̀ tí wọ́n bá ń ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò Fíìmù . Àwọn tí ó kún ojú ìwọ̀n tí wọ́n ń pe adarí Fíìmù  náà ní “òpùró”, tí wọ́n ní “ohun tó jọ bẹ́ẹ̀ kò ṣẹlẹ̀ rí” jẹ́ oníyèyè; Fíìmù  ni, tí a ṣ'èdá láti dánilárayá àti láti kọ́nilọ́gbọ́n. Ta ló nífẹ̀ẹ́ láti mọ̀ pé bóyá òtítọ ohun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ rí ni tàbí bóyá àpilẹ̀kọ ni? Àwọn èèyàn pẹ̀lú ẹ̀dùn ọkàn yìí lè rò pé ọ̀pọ̀ìranù Hollywood bíi “Pearl Harbor” kìí ṣe àpilẹ̀kọ. Ní àwọn abala iṣẹ́ ọnà Fíìmù  yìí, (oun tí ó ṣe kókó), “Farming” jẹ́ Fíìmù  tí ó dára lójú ṣùgbọ́n tí kò dára dénú, tí ẹni bá wo àwọn òbùrẹwà àkòrí Fíìmù  yìí. Kate Beckingsale ṣeé gbàgbọ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè London, tí ó ń sọ èdè Cockney (ọkàn nínú àwọn ẹ̀ka èdè tí wón ń sọ ní London) tí ó ń mú owó èlé wá sílé nípa títọ́ àwọn ọmọ wẹ́wẹ́ orílẹ-èdè nigeria tí àwọn òbí wọn kò ní ọ̀nà láti tọ́ wọn fi sí abẹ́ ìtọ́jú rẹ. Dídàgbà sókè nínú agbègbè tí ó jẹ́ kìkì àwọn aláwọ̀funfun, níbi tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wọn jẹ́ elẹ́yàmẹ̀yà bí ó ti ń wù ó mọ, tí wọ́n sì máa ń fi ìwà ẹlẹ́yàmẹ̀yà hàn gidi pàápàá sí àwọn tí àwọ̀ wọn jẹ́ bákan náà pẹ̀lú Eniìtàn tí ó jẹ́ ọ̀dọ́, ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè nigeria tí wọn jù sí ayé àjòjì yìí níbi tí gbogbo ènìyàn yàtọ síi. Fíìmù  yìí dálórí ìdáraenimọ̀, pẹ̀lú bí agbègbè àti ìtọ́nidàgbà máa ń sọ irú ẹni tí onítọ̀hún máa jẹ́, àti bí ọkàn rẹ̀ yóò ṣe máa ṣiṣẹ́. Nítorínâ, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé aláwọ̀ dúdú ni Eniìtàn, ó dàgbà láàrin àwọn akẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀, tí ó sì ń kórira àwọn ènìyàn aláwọ̀ dúdú. Irú Fíìmù  tí kò bójú mu tí o sì jẹ́ àrà ọ̀tọ̀ wo ni èyí? LÁKǑTÁN,  nkan yàtọ. Nígbà tí Ẹniìtàn dara pọ̀ mọ́ egbé oníjàgídíjàgan kan tí àkọ́mọ̀nà wọn jẹ́ íjẹgàba àwọn aláwọ̀ funfun lórí aláwọ̀ yòókù, tí wọ́n tí ń fìyàje, àwọn nkan ń pele si nítòótó. Ó sọ orúkọ ara rẹ̀ di Andy, ó sì gé irun tí ó ń dásí tẹ́lẹ̀ tí ó ń bi àwọn èèyàn nínú, ó ń wá ọna-kọna láti dára pọ̀ mọ́ àwọn tí ó ń bá ṣe, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọn kòrira rẹ, wọ́n sì ń fìyàjẹ́ síbẹ. Àwọn Fíìmù  nípa ẹgbẹ́ oníjàgídíjàgan kan tí àkọ́mọ̀nà won jẹ íjẹgàba àwọn aláwọ̀ funfun lórí aláwọ̀ yòókù ṣọwọn, bóyá ẹyọkan láàrin ọdún mẹ́wàá. Èyí fakọyọ pẹ̀lú àwọn tí ó dára jù lọ bíi “This is England”, “Romper Stomper”, ó sì fi ohùn farapé “Made In Britain” pẹlú Tim Roth. Eré sise won ní “Farming” gbóríyìn gẹ́gẹ́ bí gbogbo wọn ṣeré ní ọ̀nà tí ó bòjúmu gidi. John Gladesh ṣeré lákoláko gẹ́gẹ́ bí ‘Levi’’, olórí àwọn ẹgbẹ́ oníjàgídíjàgan ti Tilbury kan tí àkọ́mọ̀nà wọn jẹ́ íjẹgàba àwọn aláwọ̀ funfun lórí aláwọ̀ yòókù. Àti bí Damson Idris ṣe ṣojú eni tí wọ́n fi ìyà jẹ, Eniìtàn tí ó kórira ara rẹ̀ ní ìgboyà, kò sí lẹ́bi. Fíìmù  yìí wà fún ipò ẹgbẹ́ awo gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe rí àwọn olúwòran tí ó tọ̀nà. Àwọnn aláìní kan ṣe tí won kò gbóríyìn tí ó tó fún Fíìmù  yìí ṣàfihàn wí pé Fíìmù  yìí kan àwọn olúwòran tí kò tọ̀nà lára. Bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni “Blade Runner” jẹ́ ìkùnà nígbà tí ó kọ́ jáde, nítorínâ, ìgbà nìkan ló máa sọ bí yóò ṣe jásí. Mo gba àwọn olùfẹ́ Fíìmù  tí ó ń kángun sápá kan tí wọn kò sí ń tijú àwọn abala Fíìmù  tí kò bòjúmu lámọ̀ràn láti wo “Farming”, àti àwọn tí wọ́n ní ìfẹ́ sí ìṣesí àwọn ẹgbẹ́ oníjàgídíjàgan ti àwọn ọdún 1970 títí dé 1980, tí a mẹ́nu bà tẹ́lẹ̀. Ní ìbámu pẹlú “The Krays” àti “Legend”, pẹ̀lú ọpẹ́ wípé orílẹ-èdè Britain ni wọ́n ti ṣe àgbéjáde rẹ̀, nítorínâ ó rápálá yàgò fún àtúntò àti àyọkúrò tí Hollywood máa ń fẹ́ láti ṣe sí àwọn àgbéjáde rẹ̀.
column4: Awọn atunyẹwo odi yẹn fun fiimu yii jẹ awada. Awọn eniyan nilo lati fi awọn ikunsinu ti ara ẹni ati awọn oju-iwoye silẹ ninu rẹ nigbati wọn ba nṣe atunwo fiimu kan. Ati awọn ti o kere to lati pe oludari ni “opurọ,” ni sisọ pe “eyi ko ṣẹlẹ rara” isọkusọ jẹ ẹgan bakanna; o jẹ fiimu kan, ti a ṣẹda lati ṣe ere ati tabi kọ ẹkọ. Tani o bikita boya o jẹ otitọ tabi itan-akọọlẹ? Awọn eniyan ti o ni ẹdun yii le gbagbọ pe idọti Hollywood bi "Pearl Harbor" kii ṣe itan-akọọlẹ pupọ julọ. Lori si awọn imọ ise ti yi movie, (nkankan ti o kosi ọrọ), "Ogbin" ni a ẹwà, artfully shot bibẹ oju suwiti, eyi ti o jẹ ironic considering awọn grotesquely ilosiwaju awọn akori ti yi soro movie. Kate Beckinsale jẹ igbagbọ patapata gẹgẹbi Cockney ti n sọ Ilu London ti o mu afikun owo wa sinu ile nipa gbigbe awọn ọmọde Naijiria ti o fi silẹ ni itọju rẹ nipasẹ awọn obi ti ko ni ọna lati dagba wọn. Ti ndagba ni agbegbe White patapata, nibiti pupọ julọ gbogbo eniyan dabi ẹni pe o kere ju ẹlẹyamẹya diẹ, ati nigba miiran ẹlẹyamẹya ti o lagbara si awọn eniyan ti o ni awọ awọ jẹ kanna bii ọdọ Enitan, ọmọkunrin Naijiria, ti lọ sinu agbaye ajeji yii nibiti gbogbo eniyan ṣe yatọ si yatọ. lati ọdọ rẹ. Fiimu yii jẹ ipilẹ nipa idanimọ ara ẹni, ati bii agbegbe ati idagbasoke wa ṣe n ṣe apẹrẹ eniyan ti a di, ati bii ọkan wa ṣe n ṣiṣẹ. Beena bo tile je pe Enitan je Dudu, sugbon o dagba bi awon egbe re, o ma ngan eniyan ti o ni awo dudu. Kini akori aṣiwere ati alailẹgbẹ fun fiimu kan.. LAKẹhin nkan ti o yatọ. Nigbati Enitan darapo mo egbe onijagidijagan ti o ti n da a ni ijiya, awọn nkan di pupọ nitootọ. O pe ara rẹ Andy o si fá afro ibinu rẹ, o ni itara lati wa laarin awọn eniyan ti o ni ibatan si, paapaa bi wọn ti korira rẹ ti wọn si ṣe aiṣedeede rẹ ni ailopin. Awọn fiimu nipa aṣa ori awọ jẹ toje, boya ọkan yoo han ni gbogbo ọdun 10 tabi bẹ. Eyi duro jade pẹlu eyiti o dara julọ ninu wọn, pẹlu “Eyi Ni England,” “Romper Stomper,” ati pe o jọra ni pataki ni ohun orin si “Made In Britain” pẹlu Tim Roth. Paapaa ti o yẹ fun iyin ni iṣe ni “Ogbin,” bi gbogbo eniyan ṣe yipada ni awọn iṣẹ iṣe igbagbọ ti o lagbara. John Dagleish funni ni iṣẹ akikanju paapaa bi 'Lefi,' adari awọn ori awọ Tilbury, ati aworan Damson Idris' ti ijiya, ikorira ara ẹni Enitan jẹ akọni ati ailabawọn. Fiimu yii jẹ ipinnu fun ipo egbeokunkun bi o ṣe rii pe o jẹ olugbo ti o tọ. Awọn atunyẹwo irawọ 1 ẹlẹnu yẹn jẹri pe fiimu yii de awọn olugbo ti ko tọ. O dara, "Blade Runner" tun jẹ flop nigbati o kọkọ jade, nitorina akoko nikan yoo sọ. Mo ṣeduro “Ogbin” si awọn onijakidijagan ti sinima edgy ti ko ni itiju lati awọn oju iṣẹlẹ ti korọrun, ati paapaa si awọn ti o nifẹ si aṣa ọdọ Skinhead ti awọn ọdun 70 ati 80. Iru si "The Krays" ati "Arosọ," A dupe yi tun kan British gbóògì, ki o ṣakoso awọn lati yago fun awọn sappy, moralizing ati PC idoti ti Hollywood kan lara ye lati ara sinu o ká iṣelọpọ.

column2:
An Educational But Visceral & harrowing Film Expertly Crafted
It's A great movie well acted and Directed Expertly Crafted while Being educational to a degree but it's a fully immersive visceral experience .

Exploring Race ,and Gang Culture ,in England it's hard to believe some of these things Knowing that it was based on true story makes it and even tougher pill to swallow .Maybe a few scenes are for theatrical licence but still it comes from some where real .

There's so many point in the film where i'd just ask why ? why would you do that ! Nooo !

it's not for the faint hearted and it kind of messes with your mind it's the kind of movie that will leave you with many questions

entertaining but thought provoking and intriguing A work of art One of the Most Original Movies I've seen in ages a refreshing perspective Definitely worth a watch
column3:
Ere akọ́nilọ́gbọ́n, ṣùgbọ́n tí ó ń wọ inú akínyemí ara ènìyàn pẹlú ìrora. Àgbékalẹ̀ pẹlú ìmòye tí ó lágbára. 
Fíìmù  ńlá tí wọ́n ṣe tí wọ́n sì darí pẹ̀lú ìmòye. Àgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀ ń kọ́nilọ́gbọ́n sí ipele kan, ṣùgbọ́n ó kún fún ìrírí tí ó ń ki ni sínú ìrora..
Ó ń ṣàwarí ẹ̀yà àti ìṣesí àwọn ọmọ jàgídíjàgan, ní orílẹ-èdè England, ó ṣòro láti gba àwọn oun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú rẹ̀ gbọ́, ìmọ̀ wí pé Fíìmù  náà dálórí oun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ lójú ayé tún bọ̀ sọ́ di òtítọ kíkorò. Bóyá awọn abala kan wà níbẹ̀ tí wọ́n jẹ́ fún ìṣèré lásán, ṣùgbọ́n ó sì wà láti ohun tí ó dìídì ṣẹlẹ̀.
 
Àwọn ibi kan wà nínú sinemá àgbéléwò tí màá kàn bèèrè pé: “Kílódé"? Báwo ló ṣe máa ṣe bẹ́yen? Rárááá!.
 
Kò wà fún àwọn ọlọ́kàn yẹpẹrẹ, ó sì ń sẹni lọ́kàn básubàsu. Ó jẹ́ eré Fíìmù  tí yóò fi ọ́ sílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú òpòlopò ìbéèrè. Ó ń dánilárayá ṣùgbọ́n áá fa àròjinlè àti ìdáhùn sí yọ. Iṣẹ́ ọnà. Ọkàn nínú àwọn ògidì ere tí mo ti wò ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn. Àfojúsùn tuntun tí ó tọ́nà láti wò.
column4:
Ẹkọ Ẹkọ Ṣugbọn Visceral & Fiimu Harrowing ti a ṣe ni imọ-jinlẹ
O jẹ fiimu nla ti o ṣe adaṣe daradara ati Ti ṣe itọsọna ni Imoye lakoko ti o jẹ eto-ẹkọ si alefa kan ṣugbọn o jẹ iriri visceral immersive ni kikun.

Ṣawari Ije ,ati Gang Culture , ni England o ṣoro lati gbagbọ diẹ ninu awọn nkan wọnyi Mọ pe o da lori itan otitọ jẹ ki o ati paapaa egbogi lile lati gbe .Boya awọn oju iṣẹlẹ diẹ jẹ fun iwe-aṣẹ ere idaraya ṣugbọn sibẹ o wa lati diẹ ninu awọn ibi ti gidi. .

column2: Farming makes for a harrowing watch, but Idris is a star in the making, and Beckinsale is terrific as a Tilbury mommie dearest.
column3: “Farming” ń fa ìrora ní wíwò, ṣùgbọ́n Idris jẹ́ ìràwọ tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń gbórísókè. Beckinsale náà kàmìmì gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìyá àwọn Tilbury.
column4: Ogbin ṣe fun aago harrowing, ṣugbọn Idris jẹ irawọ kan ni ṣiṣe, ati pe Beckinsale jẹ ẹru bi Tilbury mommie olufẹ.

column2: The extremely violent story is based loosely on the childhood experiences of director Adewale. And it is his passion for this project which sets Farming above so many other homegrown movies you will see this year.
column3: Ìtàn tí ó kún fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìwà ipá yìí fẹ́ fàpẹ̀lẹ́ dálórí ìrírí ìgbà èwe adarí Adéwálé. Ó sì jẹ́ àníyàn rẹ̀ fún àgbékalẹ̀ iṣẹ́ yìí tí ó gbé Farming lórí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn eré ìbílẹ̀ míràn ti ẹ máa rí ní ọdún yìí.
column4: Itan iwa-ipa ti o lagbara pupọ da lori awọn iriri igba ewe ti oludari Adewale. Ati pe o jẹ ifẹ rẹ fun iṣẹ akanṣe yii eyiti o ṣeto Ogbin loke ọpọlọpọ awọn fiimu ile-ile miiran ti iwọ yoo rii ni ọdun yii.

Woefully underrated....and it deserves to be seen.

"Namaste Wahala" is a very good film....and I wonder WHY it has a paltry rating of only 5.1 on IMDB. 

All in all, it's a very sweet and interesting film
column3:

 wíwò

Lákǒtán, ere ọ̀hún dùn, ó sì wuni
column4:
“Ibinujẹ aibikita… ati pe o yẹ lati rii.

""Namaste Wahala" jẹ fiimu ti o dara pupọ .... Mo si ṣe iyanilenu IDI ti o ni idiyele kekere ti 5.1 nikan lori IMDB.

Ni gbogbo rẹ, o jẹ fiimu ti o dun pupọ ati ti o nifẹ “Idara ti iwe afọwọkọ ko le ṣe aṣiṣe. O ṣe afihan itan-akọọlẹ ti a ṣe iwadii daradara ti o nṣan nipa ti ara ati pe ko ni awọn ẹya ti o ni itusilẹ. Iwọ yoo ma ṣe iyalẹnu, ro pe o ti yanju irufin naa, nikan fun o lati nigbamii mọ awọn akosile ti wa ni orisirisi awọn igbesẹ ti wa niwaju rẹ, fiimu jẹ meji ati idaji wakati ni gigun, sugbon ko si ṣigọgọ.

column2:
Charming and unusual in its cultural mix

Above all it made me want to visit Lagos. This is a preview of a world I want to live in. If Nigerians and Indians can overcome their cultural differences, so can we all.
column3:
Ó ń fanimọ́ra, ó sì jẹ́ àrà ọ̀tọ̀ nínú ìdàpọ̀o àwọn àṣà.
Lórí oun gbogbo, ó jẹ́ kí ń fẹ́ bẹ Èkó wò. Èyí jẹ́ àgbéyẹ̀wò ìṣáájú irú ayé tí mo fẹ́ gbé inú rẹ̀. Bí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nigeria àti India bá lè borí àwọn oun tó kù díẹ̀ káàtó tí ó wà nínú àṣà wọn, ajẹ́wípé gbogbo wa náà léè ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
column4:
“Pẹwa ati dani ni akojọpọ aṣa rẹ

Ju gbogbo re lo lo je ki n fe Eko. Eyi jẹ awotẹlẹ ti agbaye ti Mo fẹ lati gbe. Ti awọn ọmọ Naijiria ati awọn ara India ba le bori awọn iyatọ aṣa wọn, bẹẹni gbogbo wa le.”

column2:
An amazing piece of work

Truly, I went into the movie not really expecting much but I was pleasantly surprise. There are some scenes i am yet to recover from. Beautiful piece of work, stuff that classics are made of. I am really going to see it again!

column2: While the themes here are, of course, redolent of neorealism, the filmmakers don’t make ostentatious nods to cinema past. Their voice is their own; the camera is mobile when it needs to be, but stands still much of the time, letting the excellent cast build their characters as the events of the film test their endurance.
column3: Nígbà tí àwọn àkòrí rẹ̀ jẹ́ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ òtítọ́ tí ó dùn moní, àwọn olùpilèsè eré náà ó kàn ṣe àwítúnwí asán àwọn fíìmù tí wọ́n ti ṣe sẹ́yìn. Ohùn wọn jẹ́ tiwọn. Irinṣẹ́ ìyafọ́tò (camera) náà kò dúró ṣin nígbà tí ó yẹ kí ó máa káà kiri, ṣùgbọ́n ó dúró lópòlopò ìgbà láti fi àyè sílẹ̀ fún àwọn òṣèré kí wọ́n lè fi àwọn àbùdá wọn hàn kedere gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ fíìmù náà ń dán ìrọ́jú wọn wò.
column4: Lakoko ti awọn akori nibi jẹ, dajudaju, redolent ti neorealism, awọn oṣere fiimu ko ṣe awọn nods ostentatious si sinima ti o ti kọja. Ohùn wọn jẹ tiwọn; kamẹra jẹ alagbeka nigbati o nilo lati jẹ, ṣugbọn o duro ni igba pupọ, jẹ ki simẹnti ti o dara julọ kọ awọn ohun kikọ wọn bi awọn iṣẹlẹ ti fiimu ṣe idanwo ifarada wọn.

column2:
A charming and colorful gem

The cinematography alone with its charming use of detailed colors makes Eyimofe a must watch. The plot is balanced and compelling with barely any cliches and the acting is phenomenal.
column3:
Ohun iyebíye tí ó ń fanimọ́ra pẹ̀lú àwọ̀ aláràbarà.
Àgbékalẹ̀ eré náà sọ Èyímofẹ́ di àìgbudọ̀máwò pẹ̀lú àwọn èlò afanimọ́ra.
Àgbékalẹ̀ eré náà dúró déédé, ó sì ń fanimọ́ra láìsí àṣìṣe, ìṣèré rẹ̀ gbóúnjẹ fẹ́gbẹ́, gbàwo bọ̀
column4:
Olowoiyebiye ti o ni awọ

Cinematography nikan pẹlu lilo rẹwa ti awọn awọ alaye jẹ ki Eyimofe gbọdọ wo. Idite naa jẹ iwọntunwọnsi ati ọranyan pẹlu aifẹ eyikeyi awọn cliches ati iṣe iṣe jẹ iyalẹnu. ”

column2: a week in the life of nigerians. good stuff.

column2: Working from a script by playwright Darci Picoult, Dosunmu fashions a tale that’s realistic, melodramatic and culturally specific (we spend as much time ogling colorfully patterned dresses as we do admiring Gurira’s endlessly expressive face), yet unmistakably archetypal.
column3: Iṣẹ́ ṣíṣe láti inú àkọsílẹ àtowọ́ olùkọ̀tàn Darci Picoult, Dòsùnmú ṣe ìtàn lẹ́ṣọ̀ọ́ lónà tí ó bòjúmu, eré orí ìtàgé tí ó ṣe wẹ́kí pẹ̀lú ohùn orin, ó sọ ojú abe àṣà níkǒ (a lo ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà láti tẹjú mọ́ àwọn tí àwọ̀ ara wọn ṣe rẹ́gí, bí a ṣe lo ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà náà láti yófẹ̀ẹ́ ojú Gurira tí ó ń sọ orísirísi ọ̀rọ̀ láì lanu), tí ó sì ń farajọni.
column4: Ṣiṣẹ lati inu iwe afọwọkọ nipasẹ oṣere ere Darci Picoult, Dosunmu fashions itan kan ti o jẹ otitọ, aladun ati aṣa kan pato (a lo akoko pupọ lati ge awọn aṣọ ti o ni awọ ti o ni awọ bi a ṣe n ṣe iwunilori oju asọye ti Gurira ti ailopin), sibẹsibẹ archetypal ti ko han gbangba.

column2: Beautiful, poetic, and hard-hitting without the use of excessive force and deeply layered with evolving and regional nuances of feminine experience
column3: Lẹ́wà-lẹ́wà, lówe-lówe, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni ń luni wọnú eegun láìloagbára lápọ̀jù, tí ó sì kún fún oríṣiríṣi ipele nígbà tí ó ń gbé ìjọ̀gbọ̀n ìrírí obìnrin wá lágbègbè.
column4: Lẹwa, ewi, ati lilu lile laisi lilo agbara ti o pọ ju ati ti o jinlẹ pẹlu idagbasoke ati awọn nuances agbegbe ti iriri abo

column2: It’s a powerfully sensual movie, gorgeously lensed colors and textures conveying its characters emotional states while thoughtfully exploring the range of human sexuality through Adenike’s experience.
column3: Fíìmù tó fi ìmọ̀sílára hàn lákoláko, àwọ̀ tí wọ́n dúró déédé àti àwọn ohun tí wọ́n sojúringindin, tí wọ́n ń gbé ipò ìmọ̀sílára àwọn òṣèré nígbà tí wọ́n ṣe àyẹ̀wò ìsọkùnrin-ṣobìnrin ènìyàn nípasẹ̀ ìrírí Adéniìkẹ́.
column4: O jẹ fiimu ti o ni agbara ti o ni agbara, awọn awọ lẹnsi ti o ni ẹwa ati awọn awoara ti n ṣalaye awọn ohun kikọ rẹ awọn ipo ẹdun lakoko ti o ni ironu n ṣawari ibiti o ti jẹ ibalopọ eniyan nipasẹ iriri Adenike.

column2: This is one of the most striking entries in the 2013 global wave of black cinema, but also admittedly one that poses hurdles to audiences with conventional expectations.
column3: Èyí jẹ́ ìkan lára àwọn àgbéwọlé tí wọ́n sojú abẹ níkǒ ní ọdún 2013 nínú fíìmù aláwọ̀ dúdú ní àgbáyé, ṣùgbọ́n ó gbé ìdíwọ́ ka iwájú àwọn olùwòran tí ìrètí wọn kò kọjá àwọn ohun tí wọ́n ti mọ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀ rí.
column4: Eyi jẹ ọkan ninu awọn titẹ sii idaṣẹ julọ ni 2013 igbi agbaye ti sinima dudu, ṣugbọn tun jẹwọ ọkan ti o fa awọn idiwọ si awọn olugbo pẹlu awọn ireti aṣa.

column2: This world is ravishingly beautiful, but there’s also something oppressive about its exoticism. The color doesn’t just saturate the frame; it thickens it.
column3: Ayé yìí rẹwà lápọ̀jù, ṣùgbọ́n nǹkan ìrẹ́jẹ wà nípa títóbi rẹ̀. Àwọ̀ rẹ̀ kò pọ̀ káàkiri rẹ̀, sùgbón ó jẹ́ kí ó ki.
column4: Aye yii jẹ ẹlẹwa lọpọlọpọ, ṣugbọn ohun kan tun wa ti o ni aninilara nipa iyalẹnu rẹ. Awọn awọ ko kan saturate fireemu; o nipọn o.

column2: There's a lot to this film--and one that, in some ways, cuts across all cultures. Well worth seeing.

column4: Pupọ wa si fiimu yii - ati ọkan ti, ni diẹ ninu awọn ọna, gige kọja gbogbo awọn aṣa. Daradara tọ ri.

column2:
Very well written & performed.

This was quite an original take on the common subject of infidelity. The plot was very well thought out; interesting and the pacing kept me engaged from the very beginning. It would throw me off from any predictability in fairly creative ways at well spaced out intervals throughout its nice length and the acting was of a decent standard from everyone too. The ending sealed this movie off really nicely and the moral lessons are sound.

On another note, I am so impressed by Nollywood movies nowadays. The storytelling and themes in general are leading the way for "black movies" because they have simply advanced way past the obvious notion that the cast or setting is black-orientated and instead they just focus more on everyday life without those patronising caricatures. So refreshing!

Quick note the editor: Less warp stabiliser.
column3:
Eré tí wọ́n kọ dáradára tí wọ́n ṣè dáradára pẹ̀lú 
Eré yìí ṣiṣẹ́ gidi lóri àìjẹ́ olótìtọ́ nínú ìgbéyàwó. Ìtàn eré náà dára púpọ ti o pe àkíyèsí mi láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ eré náà. Eré náà ju bí mo ti rò lọ nípa iṣ̣ẹ́ takuntakun pẹ̀lu ọ̀nà ọlọ́gbọ́n tí wọ́n gbà ṣeré náà tí ó sí jẹ́kí o yẹ fún wíwò. Ìparí eré náà dára púpọ o sí kọ́ni lẹ́kọ̀ó.
Ní ọ̀nà mííràn, àwọn eré Nollywood ní lásìkò yìí dùn mó mi gidi. Àwọn ìtàn àti akọle eré náà jẹ́ ìlọsíwájú fún eré àwọn èèyàn dúdú nítorípé wọ́n ṣe bẹbẹ ju ti tẹ́lẹ lọ nípa fí fojú sí ìgbéayé ojojúmọ́ ju kí wọ́n má polówó ǹkan tí kò kún ojú òsùnwọ̀n. Ó dára gidigidi.
column4:
Gan daradara kọ ati ṣe.

Eleyi jẹ ohun atilẹba Ya awọn lori awọn wọpọ koko ti infidelity. Idite ti a gan daradara ro jade; awon ati awọn pacing pa mi npe lati ibere pepe. Yoo jabọ mi kuro ni eyikeyi asọtẹlẹ ni awọn ọna iṣẹda ti o niiṣe ni aye ni aaye daradara jakejado gigun ti o wuyi ati iṣe iṣe jẹ ti boṣewa bojumu lati ọdọ gbogbo eniyan paapaa. Ipari edidi yi movie ni pipa dara julọ ati awọn ẹkọ iwa jẹ ohun.

Ni akiyesi miiran, Mo ni itara pupọ nipasẹ awọn fiimu Nollywood ni ode oni. Itan-akọọlẹ ati awọn akori ni gbogbogbo n ṣe itọsọna ọna fun “awọn fiimu dudu” nitori wọn ti ni ilọsiwaju ni ọna ti o ti kọja iroro ti o han gbangba pe simẹnti tabi eto jẹ orisun-dudu ati dipo wọn kan fojusi diẹ sii lori igbesi aye ojoojumọ laisi awọn patronizing caricatures. Nitorina onitura!

Ṣakiyesi iyara olootu: Imuduro warp kere.

column2:

column2:
A lovely movie to see.

Yeaa, strain is indeed a lovely movie. I enjoyed it, it brought tear to my eyes towards the end maybe cos I'm AS and the dude I loved too is AS. So we had to call it a quit.

I could really relate to it because, I saw the picture of what would happen if I go ahead with the relationship.

However, the only challenge for me despite the lovely story line was the actors that played the parental role, for God sake, they didn't put life to the act at allllll.

The beards was off for me, cos there wasn't a need for it, it looked fake. The mother didn't put emotions as well, if Zainab Balogun had played that role, dammit, would have been the bomb. Though, she could have tried to be better.

Also, the part that really got me laughing hard was when she went to apologize to her daughter. The way she said 'I'm sorry' and ran away was was epic. 🤣🤣🤣 Typical Nigerian mothers, having difficulties saying sorry.

The Doctor played a beautiful role, not the regular we are made to watch.

Asides all these, I enjoyed the movie, rating it 8/10 that's why I added it to my list for friends weekend watch.
column3:
Eré tí ó dára fún wíwò
Bẹ́ẹ̀ni, Strain jẹ́ eré ti o dára gidigidi. Mo sì gbádùn rẹ̀. O mú omijé wá sí ojú mi nípari rẹ̀, bóyá nítorípé mo jẹ́ AS àti wípé òṣèré ti mo fẹràn náà je AS.
 
Ìṣẹ̣̀lẹ̣̀ náà yé mí nítorí wípé mo ro nkan tí yóò ṣẹlẹ̀ tí ó ba wọ inú Ìbásepọ̀ náà.
Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, ǹkan ẹyọ̀kan tí mi ò fẹ́ràn níísẹ pẹ̀lu àwọn òṣèré tí kópa òbí nínú eré náà, nítorípé, wọn kò o ṣeré náà kún ojú òsùnwọ̀n rárá.
Bésìni, àṣejù wà nínú ìmúra wọn àti wipe òṣèré to kopa iya ninu eré náà kò gbesẹ náà yóò dáadáa. Oun tí ó pamílèrin jù ni ìgbàtí ó fẹ́ tọrọ àforíjìn lówó ọmọ rẹ̀, ó ṣe gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn ìyá ní ilẹ̀ Nàìjíríà tó nira fún láti tọrọ àforíjì`n.
Dokita náà gbìyànjú, bẹ́ẹ̀sìni ó kópa rẹ̀ dáadáa. Nitorinà, mo gbádùn eré náà mo sì sọ fún àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi láti wò. Màá fún eré náà ní máàrkì mẹ́jọ nínu mẹ́wàá.
column4:
Fiimu ẹlẹwa kan lati wo.

Bẹẹni, igara jẹ fiimu ẹlẹwa nitootọ. Mo gbadun re, o fa omije si oju mi ​​si opin boya nitori mo wa AS ati dude ti mo feran paapaa ni AS. Nítorí náà, a ní láti pè é jáwọ́.

Mo ti le gan relate si o nitori, Mo ti ri awọn aworan ti ohun ti yoo ṣẹlẹ ti o ba ti mo ti lọ siwaju pẹlu awọn ibasepo.

Sibẹsibẹ, ipenija kanṣoṣo fun mi laibikita ila itan ẹlẹwa ni awọn oṣere ti o ṣe ipa ti obi, nitori Ọlọrun, wọn ko fi igbesi aye si iṣe rara.

Irungbọn wa ni pipa fun mi, nitori ko si iwulo fun, iro ni o dabi. Iya naa ko fi ẹdun ọkan si, ti Zainab Balogun ba ti ṣe ipa yẹn, dammit, yoo jẹ bombu. Bi o tilẹ jẹ pe, o le ti gbiyanju lati dara julọ.

Pẹlupẹlu, apakan ti o mu mi rẹrin gaan ni nigbati o lọ lati tọrọ gafara fun ọmọbirin rẹ. Ọna ti o sọ pe 'Ma binu' ti o si sa lọ jẹ apọju. 🤣🤣🤣 Awọn iya ti orilẹ-ede Naijiria, ni awọn iṣoro lati sọ ma binu.

Dokita ṣe ipa ti o lẹwa, kii ṣe deede ti a ṣe lati wo.

Yatọ si gbogbo iwọnyi, Mo gbadun fiimu naa, ni idiyele rẹ 8/10 iyẹn ni idi ti Mo ṣafikun rẹ si atokọ mi fun iṣọ awọn ọrẹ ni ipari ipari.

column2:
Really great for women (and men too)
In a world where women are pressured to look better than they are, and live above their means, this show serves as a great tool of financial education to guide them into sensible organisation of their finances and the benefits of delayed gratification. Oh, and it's entertaining too! Fantastic acting!

I don't know what's with the music production though, seems like the same songs were on repeat in every episode.
column3:
O dára púpọ fún àwọn obìnrin àti àwọn ọkùnrin náà. Nínú Ayé tí ó pọndandan fún àwọn obìnrin láti ṣe ju arawọn lọ, tí wọn sì ni gbé jù bí wọ́n ti mọ̀ lọ, eré yìí jẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí irinṣẹ́ fún ìdánilékọ̀ọ́ nípa ètò ìṣúná tí o sí tún darí wọn sì Egbe ètò ìṣúná ti o dára àti ànfàní tí ó wà nínú ìserenílógo tí ó pẹ̀. Béèsìni, eré náà dún wò ó sí tún fakọyọ.
Sùgbón o, orin inú eré nà kò dára tó.
column4:
“O dara gaan fun awọn obinrin (ati awọn ọkunrin paapaa)
Ni agbaye kan nibiti a ti fi agbara mu awọn obinrin lati wo dara ju ti wọn lọ, ti wọn si gbe ga ju awọn ohun-ini wọn lọ, iṣafihan yii ṣiṣẹ bi irinṣẹ nla ti ẹkọ inawo lati ṣe amọna wọn sinu iṣeto ti oye ti inawo wọn ati awọn anfani ti itẹlọrun idaduro. Oh, ati pe o jẹ idanilaraya paapaa! Ikọja iṣere!

Emi ko mọ kini o jẹ pẹlu iṣelọpọ orin botilẹjẹpe, o dabi pe awọn orin kanna wa ni atunwi ni gbogbo iṣẹlẹ. ”

column2:
flawed but enjoyable (and important)

A faithful adaptation of one of the novels that began modern Hausa literature in the colonial period, by the future Prime Minister of Nigeria, Abubakar Tafawa Balewa. The acting is a bit stilted at times, and the director betrays his training in documentaries. But Hausa (or "Haoussa" as they spell it in most of the French speaking countries) is the largest language in Africa south of the Sahara, and if you are at all curious to see a Hausa movie, or real African film, this is one to see.

When I saw it in the States with a friend we watched a long dialogue at the beginning, followed by subtitles which translated the exchange with two words: "Hello." and "Hello."

My friend leaned over and whispered "What did they say?"

"That was it." I explained "That was 'hello' in Hausa."

It may not always make sense to you, but to the Hausa this movie was a hit, and remains a classic, "must see" Hausa film.
column3:
O labawọn sugbon mo gbádùn rẹ o sí tun se kókó.
Eré yii farapẹ ọkan ninu awọn ìtàn tó bẹrẹ litireso Hausa nigba ikonileru nipasẹ adari orile-ede tẹlẹ rí Abubakar Tafawa Balewa. Wọn gbìyànjú ninu eré náà. Hausa je ede tó tóbi jù lọ ní gúúsù áfríkà. Ti o ba fẹ lati wo ere ni ede Hausa, ma ro ọ lati wo eleyii.
Nigbati mo wo ere yii ni òkè òkun pẹlu ọrẹ mi, a wo itakuroso to Gun ni ibẹrẹ ti o sí ní akọle kékeré.
Ọrẹ mi bere pe kini won sọ, mo sì saleyi fún.
Eré yii jẹ eré tó dáa ti o sí yẹ fún wíwo.
column4:
"aibikita ṣugbọn igbadun (ati pataki)

Iṣatunṣe olododo ti ọkan ninu awọn aramada ti o bẹrẹ litireso Hausa ode oni ni akoko ijọba amunisin, nipasẹ Alakoso Agba ti Nigeria, Abubakar Tafawa Balewa. Oṣere naa jẹ iduro diẹ ni awọn igba, ati pe oludari naa tako ikẹkọ rẹ ni awọn iwe itan. Sugbon Hausa (tabi "Haoussa" gege bi won se n pepe ni opolopo awon orile-ede ti won n so ede Faranse) je ede to tobi julo ni ile Afrika ni guusu saharia, ati pe ti o ba wa ni iyanilenu lati wo fiimu Hausa, tabi fiimu Afirika gidi. eyi jẹ ọkan lati rii.

Nigbati mo rii ni Awọn orilẹ-ede pẹlu ọrẹ kan a wo ifọrọwerọ gigun ni ibẹrẹ, atẹle nipasẹ awọn atunkọ eyiti o tumọ paṣipaarọ pẹlu awọn ọrọ meji: ““Hello”” ati “Hello.”

Ọrẹ mi farabalẹ o si sọ kẹlẹkẹlẹ "Kini wọn sọ?"

""Iyẹn ni." Mo ṣe alaye "" Iyẹn 'hello' ni Hausa."

O le ma jẹ ori fun ọ nigbagbogbo, ṣugbọn fun awọn Hausa fiimu yii jẹ ohun to dun, o si jẹ olokiki, "" gbọdọ ri "fiimu Hausa."

column2:
Simple and creative, beautiful production Nigerian...
A light comedy, with intelligent and fun dialogues, that veiled humor, charismatic characters, and the seriousness and sobriety of the protagonist enchant... A real mechanics lesson for us, moviegoers and car curiosity, very cute, simple and creative, beautiful production Nigerian...
column3:
Eré tó rọrùn to sì jẹ atinuda pẹlu ìgbéjáde tó lẹ́wà. 
Eré tó panilẹ́ẹ̀rín léréfèé tí ó sí kún fún ìtàkùròso tó mọ́gbọ́n dání tí ó sì tún panilẹ́ẹ̀rín. Nítòótó, eré náà kò ni lẹkọ, o sí je eré atinuda pẹlu ìgbéjáde to rẹwa.
column4:
“Irọrun ati iṣẹda, iṣelọpọ ẹlẹwa Naijiria…
Awada imole kan, pẹlu awọn ifọrọwanilẹnuwo ti oye ati igbadun, ti o ṣoki awada, awọn ohun kikọ alarinrin, ati iwulo ati aibikita ti oluranlọwọ protagonist… Ẹkọ imọ-ẹrọ gidi kan fun wa, awọn oṣere fiimu ati iwariiri ọkọ ayọkẹlẹ, wuyi pupọ, rọrun ati ẹda, iṣelọpọ lẹwa Nàìjíríà..."

column2:
Some very fine acting

With all the fake drama dominating Nollywood, which nothing says about the life of average Nigerian, Mokalik almost feels revolutionary. Values are the thread of an only apparently simple story. Really wish this movie may set a bew trend
column3:
Eré tí wọ́n ṣe dáradára.
Pẹlú gbogbo àwọn ayédèrú eré Nollywood tí kò ní ǹkankan sọ nípa ìgbéayé àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà. Àmó Mokálìk tàbí ìrònúpìwàdà kúrò nínú ǹkan tí a mọ eré Nollywood fún. 
Ìtàn eré náà kún fún ẹ̀kọ́ iyebíye. Ìfẹ́ ọkan mi ni wípé eré náà yóò jẹ́ àṣà titun.
column4:
Diẹ ninu iṣe ti o dara pupọ

Pẹlu gbogbo ere iro ti o jẹ gaba lori Nollywood, eyiti ko si nkankan ti o sọ nipa igbesi aye apapọ Naijiria, Mokalik fẹrẹ ni rilara rogbodiyan. Awọn iye jẹ o tẹle ara ti itan kan ti o han gbangba ti o rọrun. Lootọ nireti pe fiimu yii le ṣeto aṣa bew kan

column2:
An Intelligent Film

This is a Film that gives an introspect into the degradation of surrealism and spiritual elements in the African society due to environmental pollution. This goes to show how the physical greatly affects the spiritual and vice versa. This is a really good movie to see.
column3:
Eré ọlọ́gbọ́n
 
Eré yìí jẹ́ irú eré tó ṣàfihàn ìbàjẹ́ tó wà nínú àwọn oun èmí tí ilẹ̀ áfríkà nípasẹ ìdọ̀tí àyíká àti agbègbè. Ó sì tún ṣàfihàn bí oun tí ara ṣe ṣe àkóbá fún oun témi ati bi oun témi náà ṣe ṣe àkóbá fún ohùn rara. Nítòótó, eré yii yẹ fún wíwo.
column4:
Fiimu ti oye

Eyi jẹ Fiimu ti o funni ni introspect sinu ibajẹ ti surrealism ati awọn eroja ti ẹmi ni awujọ Afirika nitori idoti ayika. Eyi n lọ lati ṣafihan bii ti ara ṣe ni ipa pupọ ti ẹmi ati ni idakeji. Eyi jẹ fiimu ti o dara gaan lati rii.”

column2:
Relatable

This was a very well acted Nollywood film. My experience with previous films from Africa that I've watched haven't been acted well.
column3:
Eré tó yeni
Eré Nollywood tí àwọn òṣèré kópa wọn dáradára. Ìrírí mi nípa àwọn eré tí wọ́n se ní áfríkà tẹ́lẹ̀ kò dára nítorípé wọn kò gbé iṣẹ́ jáde dáradára.
column4:
Ti o jọmọ

Eyi je fiimu Nollywood kan ti o ṣe daradara pupọ. Iriri mi pẹlu awọn fiimu iṣaaju lati Afirika ti Mo ti wo ko ti ṣe daradara.”

column2: Nigerian Prince stands out for its setting, making it a welcome addition to the crime movie pantheon.
column3: Eré Nigeria Prince tayọ nínú ètò rẹ̀, èyí losi jẹ kí o jẹ àfikún sí àwọn eré ti o nííṣe pẹ̀lú ọ̀ràn
column4: Ọmọ-alade Naijiria ṣe pataki fun eto rẹ, ti o jẹ ki o ṣe afikun itẹwọgba si pantheon fiimu ẹṣẹ.

column2: Citation is an important window into the gender politics of a culture seemingly very different ìnto our own, but where the nuts-and-bolts sexist dynamics that have oppressed and left women around the world open to abuse remain sadly familiar
column3: Citation jẹ́ ọ̀nà pàtàkì sínu àṣà ṣíṣe ìyàtò láarin ọkùnrin àti obìnrin tí ó yàtọ̀ sí ìṣ̣ẹ wa sùgbọ́n níbi tí ó tí fi àwọn obìnrin káàkìrì àgbáyé sínú ewu àị̀bùolafún.
column4: Itọkasi jẹ window pataki si iṣelu iṣelu ti aṣa ti aṣa ti o dabi ẹnipe o yatọ pupọ si tiwa, ṣugbọn nibiti awọn eso-ati-boluti awọn agbara ibalopo ti o ti nilara ati fi awọn obinrin silẹ ni ayika agbaye ni ṣiṣi si ilokulo jẹ faramọ ni ibanujẹ.

column2: "Citation" works best when it hovers in the infuriating skepticism hurled at its young protagonist as she makes her case, and it's unclear whether the system will work in her favor until the final, unnerving act.
column3: Eré Citation ṣe iṣẹ gidi nígbàtí o ṣàfihàn ìgbàgbọ òṣèré pàtàkì àti bí wón se gbógun tó nígbà tí ó sàlàyé oun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí, bésìnì lákọ̀kọ́ó kò ye ni bóyá ìdájọ́ náà yóò ṣàfàní fún òṣèré náà Àbí yóò ṣe àkóbá fún.
column4: "Itọkasi" n ṣiṣẹ dara julọ nigbati o ba npa ni ṣiyemeji ibinu ti a sọ si ọdọ protagonist ọdọ rẹ bi o ṣe n ṣe ọran rẹ, ati pe koyewa boya eto naa yoo ṣiṣẹ ni ojurere rẹ titi di ipari, iṣe aibikita.

column2: I thought it was a traditional action movie. But it has a very good story with meaningful inspiration. It uncovers the competition between weapons and water in Africa.
column3: Mo rò wípé eré ibile oníjà ni. Sùgbón o ni ìtàn tí ó dára tí ó sì mú ọpọlọ dání. O sí aso lójú ìjà láàrin oun èlò ogun àti omi nílè Áfríkà.
column4: Mo ro o je kan ibile igbese movie. Ṣugbọn o ni itan ti o dara pupọ pẹlu awokose ti o nilari. O ṣii idije laarin awọn ohun ija ati omi ni Afirika.

column2: A great film; and was a huge success at the time of release. Films like Glamour Girls put the Nigerian film industry on the map; Nollywood owes this film a lot.
column3: Eré ńlá tí o sì ní àṣeyọrí nla ní àsìkò ìgbéjáde rẹ. Eré bíi ti Glamour Girls gbé iléeṣé iṣẹ eré ni Nàìjíríà jáde lórí àwòrán ayé. Nollywood jẹ eré yìí ní gbèsè.
column4: Fiimu nla kan; ati pe o jẹ aṣeyọri nla ni akoko idasilẹ. Awọn fiimu bii Glamour Girls fi ile-iṣẹ fiimu Naijiria sori maapu; Nollywood ni gbese fiimu yii lọpọlọpọ.

column2:
Great movie but weak ending

The movie was great until the last 20 minutes, it's just went armateur. Was strong until they had to fill in too much details just before the end and then not even end the story.
column3:
Eré tó dára sùgbón ko ní ìparí tó dára. 
Ere yìí dùn títí tí ó fi dé ìṣẹ́jú ogún tí yóò fi parí. Eré náà dára títí di ìgbà tí wọ́n fi fi àṣejù síi, èyí ni kòsì jẹ kí eré náà parí dáradára
column4:
"Fiimu nla ṣugbọn ipari ti ko lagbara

Awọn movie je nla titi ti o kẹhin 20 iṣẹju, o ti n kan lọ armateur. Ni agbara titi wọn fi ni lati kun awọn alaye pupọ pupọ ṣaaju opin ati lẹhinna paapaa ko pari itan naa. ”

column2:
Hits the right note
The language is Street, the cast stellar, cinematography and editing is on point. It also has a great plot. Best of all it puts Ajegunle on the map.
column3:
Eré náà sọ ojú abẹ́ niko
Èdè tí wọn ló jẹ èdè oríta, àwọn òṣèré náà ṣe bẹbẹ, ìgbé eré jáde àti ìsàtúntò naa dara lọ́pọ̀. Ó sì tún ní ìtàn tó dára. Pabambarì rẹ̀ ni wípé ó gbé Ajegunle sórí àwòrán ayé.
column4:
O lu akọsilẹ ọtun
Ede naa jẹ Street Street, irawọ simẹnti, sinima ati ṣiṣatunṣe wa lori aaye. O tun ni idite nla kan. Ju gbogbo rẹ lọ o fi Ajegunle sori maapu.

column2: They took a risk but the execution from production to acting was very well done.
column3: Wọ́n farawọn wéwu ṣùgbọn ìgbéjáde eré náà dára.
column4: Wọn mu eewu ṣugbọn ipaniyan lati iṣelọpọ si iṣe ti ṣe daradara.

column2: EXCELLENT film! The actors were great performers. The scenery and backdrops were well done. The soundtrack outstanding. The storyline is the bomb!

column2:
Nice storyline
Good movie, nice storyline. I like the fact that actors from different African countries acted in this movie.
column3:
Ìtàn tí o dára.
Eré gidi pẹ̀lu ìtàn tó dára. Mo sì tún fẹràn wípé àwọn òṣèré láti orísìrisi orílẹ̀ èdè ní Africa kópa nínú eré náà.
column4:
Itan itan ti o dara
Fiimu ti o dara, itan itan to dara. Mo nifẹ si otitọ pe awọn oṣere lati oriṣiriṣi awọn orilẹ-ede Afirika ṣe iṣere ninu fiimu yii.

column2: This movie is a bit hard to follow but it is worth the effort. A sort of Romeo and Juliet story set in Nigeria. The parents are like all others wanting only the best for the kids. If you like romantic comedies, pay close attention and you will be rewarded in the end.
column3: Eré náà lè diẹ láti fi ọkàn báa lọ àmọ́ o to akitiyan tí wọ́n fi síi. Ó dàbí eré Romeo and Juliet ni a ṣẹ ní orílẹ̀-ède Nàìjíríà. Àwọn òbí gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn mìíràn fẹ́ oun tó dára fún àwọn ọmọ wọn. Tí o bá fẹ́ràn eré ìfẹ tó sì tún panilérìn-ín, wo eré yìí títí dé òpin, wà á síì gbádùn rẹ̀.
column4: Fiimu yii jẹ lile diẹ lati tẹle ṣugbọn o tọsi igbiyanju naa. Iru itan Romeo ati Juliet ti a ṣeto ni Nigeria. Awọn obi dabi gbogbo awọn miiran nfẹ nikan ti o dara julọ fun awọn ọmọde. Ti o ba fẹ romantic comedies, san sunmo akiyesi ati awọn ti o yoo wa ni san nyi ni ipari.

column2:
A feel good movie.

It's a Iight great watch. Not heavy and quite funny without seeming to!

Eré tó dára
