"Fiimu ti o dara.

O jẹ aago Iight nla kan. Ko wuwo ati ẹrin pupọ laisi dabi ẹnipe!”

column2: The 7 episode show went through the backstory of the African people and it really delves into the stories no one hears about and the unsung heroes that lead the Nigerian people to finding their independence.
column3: Ìran keèje ṣàfihàn ìtàn àwọn ènìyàn Áfríkà ti o sí tuń sọ nìpa àwọn akọni tí ó ti kọjá tí wón sì kópa nínú gbígba òmìnira fún Nàìjíríà.
column4: Ifihan isele 7 naa kọja nipasẹ itan ti awọn eniyan Afirika ati pe o jinlẹ gaan sinu awọn itan ti ẹnikan ko gbọ ati awọn akọni ti ko kọrin ti o mu ki awọn eniyan Naijiria wa ominira wọn.

column2:
Good movie...

Excellent film, in a dystopian future in Nigeria, with all its ailments, a hope in honesty and manliness, turn to chaos, very good, female characters in addition to beautiful strong and determined, unscrupulous taking advantage of despair and helplessness, good tension scenes , good movie..
column3:
Eré tó dára.
 
Eré tó tayọ, nínú àìní àfojúsùn fún ọjọ́ iwájú ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà pẹ̀lú gbogbo àìlera rẹ̀, ìrètí nínú ìsòtítọ́ àti ìsọ̀kan akín yorísí ìdàrúdàpọ̀. Ìkópa dídára òṣèré obìnrin ní àfikún sí afojusun lati mu ànfàní àsìkò ìpayà àti àìlágbára lọ. Eré tó dára pẹlú akoko ẹdọfu.
column4:
Fiimu ti o dara ...

Fiimu ti o dara julọ, ni ọjọ iwaju dystopian ni Nigeria, pẹlu gbogbo awọn ailera rẹ, ireti ni otitọ ati iwa ọkunrin, yipada si idarudapọ, ti o dara pupọ, awọn ohun kikọ obirin ni afikun si lẹwa ti o lagbara ati ipinnu, aiṣedeede ti o ni anfani ti ibanujẹ ati ailagbara, awọn oju iṣẹlẹ ti o dara. fiimu ti o dara..

column2:
Amazing
I'd of normally flicked past this, but honestly it's an amazing story. You can tell it had a low budget, but the direction and screen play is fantastic! The choreography of the fight scenes lacked a little. Worth a watch definitely
column3:
Ìyàlẹ́nu
Tẹ́lẹ̀tẹ́lẹ̀, mi ò kí n kàsíí, ṣùgbọ́n nítòótó, eré yìí yanilẹ́nu. Níṣe ni èèyàn máa mọ wípé, wón kò náwó púpọ̀ lórí eré náà sùgbọ́n ìfojúsùn wọn àti ìṣe eré náà yanilẹ́nu. Bótilẹ̀jẹ́pé, ibi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìjà náà kò dára tó, síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, ó yẹ fún wíwo.
column4:
Iyanu
Emi yoo ṣe deede kọja eyi, ṣugbọn nitootọ o jẹ itan iyalẹnu. O le sọ pe o ni isuna kekere, ṣugbọn itọsọna ati ere iboju jẹ ikọja! Awọn choreography ti awọn oju iṣẹlẹ ija ko ni diẹ. O yẹ aago kan pato

column2: I thought it would be quite boring, however it was more engaging than I supposed, good characters, good acting, marathoning Nigerian movies and in love with them... , by the elite population, sad observation, apart from the patriarchal machismo, the scene of the wife humiliating herself to apologize, on her knees, was outrageous, although it has a comical character, veiled submission, or explicit...
column3: Mo rò wípé eré náà kò ní dùn ni, ṣùgbọ́n ó ju bí mo ti rò lọ. Eré náà ni àwọn osere daradara ti wọn ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun, mo fẹ́ràn àwọn eré Nàìjíríà. Ṣùgbọ́n ǹkan tí kò dára tí mo rí nínú eré náà ni bí ìyàwó ilé ṣe fi ara rẹ̀ sẹlẹ́yà tí ó sì bẹ̀bẹ̀ lórí eékún, bótilẹ̀jẹ́pé, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà panilérìn-ín síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, kò kún tó.
column4: Mo ro o yoo jẹ ohun alaidun, sibẹsibẹ o je diẹ lowosi ju Mo ti ro, ti o dara ohun kikọ, ti o dara osere, marathoning Nigerian sinima ati ni ife pẹlu wọn... , nipa awọn Gbajumo olugbe, ibanuje akiyesi, yato si lati awọn patriarchal machismo, awọn Ìrísí tí ìyàwó ń dojúbolẹ̀ ara rẹ̀ láti tọrọ àforíjì, lórí eékún rẹ̀, jẹ́ ohun ìríra, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó ní ìhùwàsí apanilẹ́rìn-ín, ìfarabalẹ̀ tí ó bojú, tàbí tí ó ṣe kedere...

column2: A must see, very interesting story and well acted, great collaboration with Hollywood and Nollywood actors. I thoroughly enjoyed it.
column3: Eré tí èèyàn gbọdọ̀ wò ni, ìtàn tí ó dára tí wọ́n sì ṣe dáradára pẹ̀lú àkójọpọ̀ àwọn òṣèré Hollywood àti Nollywood. Mo gbádùn-un rẹ̀.

column2: Low-key, low-budget, high-intelligence, this is precisely the kind of film London ought to be producing.

column2: While it's certainly social commentary, Gone Too Far is also a breath of fresh air in the often stifling stable of British sociorealism.

column4: Ere idaraya ti o ni imọlẹ diẹ sii ju ẹrin ti n pariwo awada, Lionheart ṣe afihan fiimu Naijiria ti o de ọdọ awọn olugbo agbaye ni ọna nla.

column2: I really enjoyed watching the movie. First time seeing Nollywood do something that can compete internationally.

column4: Mo gbadun wiwo fiimu naa gaan. Ni igba akọkọ ti ri Nollywood ṣe nkan ti o le dije ni kariaye.

column2: Lionheart is a solid film that effectively portrays sexism in workplace in Nigeria. It is very straightforward, highly predictable and also quite weakly directed by Genevieve Nnaji. But on the opposite side of things, her acting performance is terrific, and she successfully elevated both the character and the overall material. The movie is clichéd, but charming. It would have been a perfect potential nominee for the Academy had they not stupidly eliminated it due to it being filmed in the English language.
column3: Lionheart jẹ́ fíìmù tí o lágbára tó sì fi ìbálòpọ̀ hàn dáradára ní ibi-iṣẹ́ mi orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà. Ó wá ní ọ̀nà òtítọ́, àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ gíga àti ní ìtọ́sọ́nà ní ye aláìlágbára nípasẹ̀ Genevieve Nnaji. Ṣùgbọ́n ní ọnà ìdákejì, iṣẹ́ ṣíṣe rẹ̀ kò jẹ lásán àti wípé o fi iṣẹ́ ìgbéga hàn fún òṣèré ati awọn òun èlò òṣèré. Fíìmù nàà jẹ́ oun ìwúrí. Yíò o dára láti yàn án fún ilé - ẹ̀kọ́ fíìmù,tí kò bá n se wipe wọ́n ṣe ní èdè gèésì.
column4: Lionheart jẹ fiimu ti o fẹsẹmulẹ ti o ṣe afihan ibalopo ni imunadoko ni aaye iṣẹ ni Nigeria. O jẹ taara pupọ, asọtẹlẹ gaan ati pe o tun jẹ alailagbara nipasẹ Genevieve Nnaji. Ṣugbọn ni apa idakeji ti awọn nkan, iṣẹ iṣe rẹ jẹ ẹru, ati pe o ṣaṣeyọri igbega mejeeji ihuwasi ati ohun elo gbogbogbo. Fiimu naa jẹ clichéd, ṣugbọn pele. Yoo jẹ yiyan ti o ni agbara pipe fun Ile-ẹkọ giga ti wọn ko ba pa a kuro lọna aimọgbọnwa nitori ti o ya aworan ni ede Gẹẹsi.

column2: Farming is based upon writer / director Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje's life as a young Nigerian boy who was fostered to a white working class British family in the 1980's. This was something that occurred frequently from the 1960's - 1980's and became known as farming. The film's main focus is on identity and how this young boy grew up confused and alone with a verbally abusive and casually racist white British mother and traditional conservative Nigerian parents who he only saw every few years. He struggled to accept who he was, forming a strong desire to be white and eventually fell in with a group of abusive and violent skinheads, completely losing his way until tragic and violent events eventually lead him back to the right path and accepting his own identity. I thought this was excellent. Damon Idris is superb in the lead role as someone who is filled with so much hate for himself and others who share his cultural identity yet also hates the new group that have formed around him. It's tense, harrowing and a powerful film and my heart breaks for any children that were put through this system because it must have been a real struggle adjusting to life in Nigeria after spending time growing up on the streets with the white British working class .
column3: Farming dá lé ìtàn ayé ò kọwé ati Olùdarí Adéwálé Akinnuoye-Agbaje gẹgẹ bí ọmọdé kùnrin Nàìjíríà, tí àwọn ẹbí alawọ funfun gba sí ọdọ ni ọdún 1980. Èyí jẹ òun tó ṣẹlẹ larin odun 1960 sí ọdún 1980, èyí tí a mọ̀ sí ògbìn. Fíìmù náà dá lórí bí ọmọdé kùnrin yìí ṣe da'mu láti mọ ẹni tí o jẹ,pẹlu ìyá alawọ funfun tí o jẹ ẹlẹ́yàmẹ́yà tí o má n ni àti òbí Nigeria rẹ tí wọn pa àṣà mọ èyí tí o má n rí ní ọdún kánkan sí ra wọn. O tiraka láti gba irú ènìyàn tó jẹ o sí tún nife lati je alawọ funfun èyí tí o sọkún fa ki o dára po mọ́ àwọn ọrẹ búburú èyí tí o jẹ ki o kùnà pátá pátá. Nígbà tí àwọn àjálù burúkú sele ní o to pada sí ònà tí o tọ,tí o sí faramọ́ iru faramo irú ènìyàn tí o jẹ́.O dára lọpọlọpọ. Damon Idris jẹ  òṣèré pàtàkì tó gbìyànjú láti jẹ kí a mọ bi o se kórìra ará rẹ àti àwọn tó won jọ ní àsà kàn náà,tí o sí tún kórìra àwọn ẹgbẹ tuntun tí o yíká. O jẹ fíìmù tí o gara tí o sí lágbára. Ìbànújẹ ọkàn mi o jẹ fún mi láti rọ iye àwọn ọmọ ti irú nkan bayii ṣẹlẹ́ sí. Yi o jẹ ìjàkadì nla fún wọn láti faramọ́ ìgbé ayé Nàìjíríà lẹyìn tí wọn tí gbé pẹ̀lú àwọn òbí alawọ funfun
column4: Ogbin da lori igbesi aye onkọwe / oludari Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje gẹgẹbi ọmọdekunrin ọdọ Naijiria kan ti a ṣe abojuto si ẹgbẹ alawo funfun kan ti idile Gẹẹsi ni awọn ọdun 1980. Eyi jẹ nkan ti o waye nigbagbogbo lati awọn ọdun 1960 - 1980 ti o si di mimọ bi ogbin. Ohun pataki ti fiimu naa jẹ lori idanimọ ati bi ọmọdekunrin yii ṣe dagba ni idamu ati pe o nikan ni iya funfun ti o jẹ ẹlẹyamẹya ti Ilu Gẹẹsi ati awọn obi aṣaaju aṣa Naijiria ti o rii nikan ni ọdun diẹ. O tiraka lati gba ẹni ti o jẹ, ti o ni ifẹ ti o lagbara lati jẹ funfun ati nikẹhin ṣubu ni pẹlu ẹgbẹ kan ti ipanilaya ati iwa-ipa awọ-ara, ti o padanu ọna rẹ patapata titi di awọn iṣẹlẹ ti o buruju ati iwa-ipa bajẹ mu u pada si ọna titọ ati gbigba idanimọ tirẹ. . Mo ro pe eyi dara julọ. Damon Idris jẹ ohun ti o dara julọ ni ipa asiwaju gẹgẹbi ẹnikan ti o kún fun ikorira pupọ fun ara rẹ ati awọn miiran ti o pin idanimọ aṣa rẹ sibẹsibẹ tun korira ẹgbẹ titun ti o ti ṣẹda ni ayika rẹ. O jẹ ẹdọfu, harrowing ati fiimu ti o lagbara ati pe ọkan mi fọ fun awọn ọmọde eyikeyi ti a fi sinu eto yii nitori pe o gbọdọ jẹ Ijakadi gidi lati ṣatunṣe si igbesi aye ni Nigeria lẹhin lilo akoko dagba ni opopona pẹlu ẹgbẹ oṣiṣẹ funfun ti Ilu Gẹẹsi.

column2: Akinnuoye-Agbaje's directorial debut is a troubling coming-of-age story based upon the directors own experiences as a 'farmed out' Nigerian child in the UK during a period of surging xenophobia in the wake of the Windrush generations arrival. The look and feel of the films early moments present a setting and characters so raw and realistic that one could only capture from having experienced them. The pacing of the film in many ways reflects this. At times seeming to take on an almost frantic pace which is meaningful in a way that captures the effect of somebody recalling their life story - made up of the important details and traumatic moments - though occasionally making it difficult to capture and appreciate the passage of time bordering on surreal. The supporting characters similarly are raw and identifiable foils though lacking in the depth required to be whole characters beyond their interactions with the film's lead. Furthermore the film does little to address or contextualize its setting, deliberately choosing to focus on the internal struggles of it's central character. Despite this the films central character is compelling enough to keep the viewer engaged solely in his development throughout the film. Overall Farming is an impressive directorial debut that tackles issues of dual identity and self-hatred in a manner that leaves plenty unsaid but provides a bitter and frequently heartbreaking account of an individuals struggle for meaning and identity. There is so much to be admired about this film which presents an often overlooked period in British history, the importance of such a personal topic deserving of a greater run-time than the films mere 107 minutes.
column3: Íṣe Olùdarí àkọkọ Akinnuoye - Agbaje je itan tí o  bá ní nínú jẹ́ to dá lórí ìrírí Olùdarí náà èyí tí o jẹ ọmọ ti wọ́n 'gbìn jáde' ni Nàìjíríà lọ sí ìlú ọba ni asiko ìgbà kan . Wí wo ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ fíìmù yìí fi ibi ati òṣèré tí o ṣé gbàgbọ́ nípa wípé a ti ni ìrírí rẹ̀,ìgbà míràn yíò gbà ọnà ti o ni ìtúmọ̀ yíò fi ipá eni tó n rántí ìrírí ayé rẹ̀ ti o fi àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ pataki hàn. Sí wájú sí, fíìmù nà kò tọ́ka sí ibi tí o ti ṣẹlẹ, ṣùgbọ́n ìjàkadì tí òṣèré pàtàkì n jà nínú rẹ. Pẹlú gbagbo èyí, òṣèré pàtàkì fíìmù na ni ìwà ti o fé kí àwọn olùwò yíò fe mo bí o ṣe dàgbà sókè nínú fíìmù náà. Lápapọ̀, ìgbìn jẹ iṣẹ Olùdarí àkọ́kọ́ tí o kọjú sí ọ̀rọ̀ ìdánimọ̀ méjì àti ìkórìrá ẹni ní ọnà tí o fi òun púpọ lẹ̀laisọ sùgbọ́n o pèsè ìbànújẹ́ ati ìkòrò fun ènìyàn tó n tiraka fún ìtumò ati ìdánimọ̀. Òun tí a lè nifẹ sí pọ ninu fíìmù yìí, èyí tí o mú ìgbà kan ninu ìtàn àwọn aláwọ̀ funfun wá sáyé, pàtàkì kókó ọ̀rọ̀ ara eni ye ju ìṣẹ́jú éjeléniọgọ́run ti won fi ṣe.
column4: Akinnuoye-Agbaje's directorial debut is a controubling coming-of-age story based on the directors own experiences as a 'a farmed out' Nigerian child in the UK during a period of surging xenophobia in the wake of the Windrush generations. Wiwo ati rilara ti awọn fiimu ni awọn akoko ibẹrẹ ṣafihan eto kan ati awọn kikọ jẹ aise ati ojulowo ti eniyan le gba lati ni iriri wọn nikan. Pacing ti fiimu ni ọpọlọpọ awọn ọna ṣe afihan eyi. Ni awọn akoko ti o dabi ẹnipe o mu iyara ti o fẹrẹẹ jẹ ti o nilari ni ọna ti o gba ipa ti ẹnikan ti n ranti itan-akọọlẹ igbesi aye wọn - ti o jẹ awọn alaye pataki ati awọn akoko ajalu - botilẹjẹpe lẹẹkọọkan jẹ ki o ṣoro lati mu ati riri aye ti akoko. ààlà lori surreal. Awọn ohun kikọ ti o ṣe atilẹyin ni bakanna jẹ aise ati awọn foils ti o le ṣe idanimọ botilẹjẹpe aini ni ijinle ti o nilo lati jẹ gbogbo awọn kikọ ju awọn ibaraenisepo wọn pẹlu itọsọna fiimu naa. Pẹlupẹlu fiimu naa ko ṣe diẹ lati koju tabi ṣe itumọ eto rẹ, ni imọọmọ yan si idojukọ lori awọn ija inu ti ihuwasi aringbungbun rẹ. Bi o ti lẹ jẹ pe eyi ohun kikọ aarin fiimu jẹ ọranyan to lati jẹ ki oluwo naa ṣiṣẹ nikan ni idagbasoke rẹ jakejado fiimu naa. Ogbin Lapapọ jẹ iṣafihan oludari iyalẹnu ti o koju awọn ọran ti idanimọ meji ati ikorira ara ẹni ni ọna ti o fi ọpọlọpọ silẹ lainidi ṣugbọn pese akọọlẹ kikorò ati aibalẹ nigbagbogbo ti ẹnikọọkan Ijakadi fun itumọ ati idanimọ. Pupọ lo wa lati ṣe akiyesi nipa fiimu yii eyiti o ṣafihan akoko aṣemáṣe nigbagbogbo ninu itan-akọọlẹ Ilu Gẹẹsi, pataki ti iru koko-ọrọ ti ara ẹni ti o tọsi akoko ṣiṣe ti o tobi ju awọn fiimu lọ ni iṣẹju 107.

column2: The 'Set Up' is a step up. A real reach, this movie is some James Bond ish. And for quality; as far as Nollywood goes, 'Set Up' is top of the line. Sterling quality. You will be very proud of Nollywood when you see it. No doubt about that. The 'Set Up' proves that regardless of the troublesome filth swamping Nollywood, there is still great talent there that won't die. This is magnificent quality. Worth every kobo you will spend. We are sure of this, because when the screen closed, rapturous applause erupted.
column3: Ìṣètò(Set Up) ni ipa. O farapẹ́ fíìmù òyìnbó. Àmì idayatọ rẹ wà ní òkè tente, tí e bá wò, iṣẹ Nollywood yíò wù yín lórí. O fi hàn wípé pẹlu oríṣìíríṣìí aiṣedede tí o wa ní Nollywood , àwọn ẹbùn gbógì sí wá,tí tí o lẹ kú. O dára púpọ,gbogbo owó tí e bá na lẹ to sí nítorípé ni ìgbà tí a wo tán,àtéwọ́ gbalẹ́ kan ni.,
column4: Awọn 'Ṣeto' ni a igbese soke. A gidi arọwọto, yi movie ni diẹ ninu awọn James Bond ish. Ati fun didara; bi Nollywood ti lọ, 'Ṣeto' ni oke ti ila. Sterling didara. Iwọ yoo gberaga pupọ fun Nollywood ti o ba rii. Ko si iyemeji nipa iyẹn. Eto 'Set Up' fi idi re mule pe laika iru idoti to n po ni Nollywood, talenti nla tun wa nibẹ ti ko ni ku. Eleyi jẹ nkanigbega didara. Tọ gbogbo kobo ti o yoo na. A ni idaniloju eyi, nitori nigbati iboju ba ti pa, ìyìn rapturous bu jade.

column2:
Forget its old school Nollywood style title, 'Mama Drama' isn't just good. It is more than good. This movie is the real deal - A True Gem: Super fantastic. Super immersive. Absolutely shattering drama. And its story is simple and sick. "Sick" as in "freakishly good".

While Shaffy Bello stands out majestically; the acting here is generally, all round; Perfect! Honestly, the flawlessness of this flick is indescribable. Even the funny parts feel so real, they are life-like funny. So funny, you will be stumping your feet like you need to run out of your seat.

Yet, 'Mama Drama' is not a comedy. Neither does it pretend to be one. No. Not at all. 'Mama Drama' is drama in its purest sense. It is cogent, potent, thick and concentrated. Absolutely Amazing. Not to be missed.
column3: Ẹ gbàgbé pé o ní orúkọ Nollywood ayé àtijọ́, 'Mama Drama' kò dára lásán,ójù bẹ lọ, fíìmù yìí jẹ́ gídí,o dára lọ́pọ̀ , o sí ní ìtàn tó rọrùn, o jẹ eré tó yanilẹ́nu. Shaffy Bello dúró bí ọba ṣugbọn is yìí pe ni gbogbo ọnà. O pa ni l'ẹrin,to bẹ gẹ tí e o má rẹrìn takiti lórí ijoko. Síbẹ̀ ko kí n se fíìmù aláwàdà, kò sí dín láti fara pẹ. Mama Drama jẹ́ eré ní gbogbo ọnà. O kìí,o ni àṣàrò, o sí dára lọpọlọpọ. A kò gbọdọ̀ pàdánù rẹ̀
column4:
Gbagbe akọle ara ile-iwe Nollywood atijọ rẹ, 'Mama Drama' ko dara nikan. O jẹ diẹ sii ju ti o dara lọ. Fiimu yii jẹ adehun gidi - A True Gem: Super fantastic. Super immersive. Egba ti npa eré. Ati itan rẹ jẹ rọrun ati aisan. " Alaisan" bi ninu "Freakishly dara".

Nigba ti Shaffy Bello duro jade majestically; awọn sise nibi ni gbogbo, gbogbo yika; Pipe! Nitootọ, ailabawọn flick yii ko ṣe alaye. Paapaa awọn ẹya alarinrin ni rilara gidi gidi, wọn jẹ ẹrinrin-aye. Ki funny, o yoo wa ni stumping ẹsẹ rẹ bi o ba nilo lati ṣiṣe jade ninu rẹ ijoko.

Sibẹsibẹ, 'Mama Drama' kii ṣe awada. Bẹni ko ṣe dibọn lati jẹ ọkan. Rara rara. 'Mama Drama' jẹ ere ni ori mimọ rẹ. O ti wa ni cogent, ni agbara, nipọn ati ogidi. Iyalẹnu Egba. Ko yẹ ki o padanu.

column2:
Recommend, strictly for Baba Suwe's crowd. Because; flamboyantly nonsensical, 'Sugar Rush' is a "Baba Suwe" feem. There's simply no art to it - The comedy it offers is terribly predictable and sorely obvious. Lacking in any subtlety or thoughtfulness, this movie was not made for the intellectual viewer. It was made for the mob; that Baba Suwe crowd. 'Sugar Rush' was crafted specifically to please them. Only them. And it worked. It worked spectacularly:

The hall was packed. And from start to finish, this crowd laughed their heads off. From minute to minute, explosions of laughter filled the room. People, violently animated by punchlines; literally tore out of their seats and jerked back furiously, time and time again, seemingly having lost control of their bodies. Visibly drunk with incessant laughter, they laughed hard and coughed out even louder -  'Sugar Rush' wouldn't give them a moment's rest to catch their breaths.

So loud and continuous was the laughter, you could feel the atmosphere vibrating with the fire of their satisfaction. It was amazing to watch. For these people, 'Sugar Rush' was exactly that; A Rush of Sugar. And they loved it beyond description. We can well testify to that. Nevertheless, we hated it. Every single second of it. 'Sugar Rush' was a celebration of The Ridiculous. And it was utterly foolish.
column3: Mo gba níyàn fún àwọn olólùfẹ́ Bàbá Suwe nítorípé kò dára púpọ̀.Sugar Rush wà fún àwọn olólùfẹ́ Bàbá Suwe nìkan. Kò sí íṣe ọnà tó dára, Àwàdà rẹ̀ ṣé ṣọ tẹ́lẹ̀. Kò ní àárò tẹ́lẹ̀ rara. Wọn kò ṣè fún olùwò ọlọ́gbọ́n. Lati ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ dé òpin, iyàrá náà ti kú fún ẹ̀rín láti ìgbà sí ìgbà tó bẹ gẹ ti wọ́n wúkọ́ láì jẹ́ kí wọn mí fún ìgbà díẹ,o jẹ òun iyalẹnu fún àwọn kàn,wọn sí fẹràn rẹ ṣùgbọ́n mo korira rẹ,kò mú ọgbọ́n dání.
column4:
"So, muna fun Baba Suwe ká enia. Nitori; flamboyantly nonsensical, 'Sugar Rush' ni a "" Baba Suwe" owo. Nibẹ ni nìkan ko si aworan si o - The awada ti o nfun ni lasan asọtẹlẹ ati ki o gidigidi kedere. Lacking ni eyikeyi subtlety. tabi ironu, fiimu yii kii se fun oniwoye oye, a se fun awon agbajo; ti Baba Suwe enia.’Sugar Rush’ was crafted specifically to please them.” Awon nikan ni o si sise, o sise iyanu:

Gbọ̀ngàn náà ti kún. Ati lati ibere lati pari, enia yi rerin ori wọn pa. Lati iseju si iseju, awọn bugbamu ti ẹrín kún yara. Eniyan, iwa ere idaraya nipa punchlines; gangan ya jade kuro ninu awọn ijoko wọn ati ki o yiyi pada ni ibinu, akoko ati akoko lẹẹkansi, o dabi ẹnipe wọn ti padanu iṣakoso ti ara wọn. Níwọ̀n bí wọ́n ti mutí yó pẹ̀lú ẹ̀rín tí kò dáwọ́ dúró, wọ́n rẹ́rìn-ín kíkankíkan tí wọ́n sì wú gan-an pàápàá – ‘Sugar Rush’ kò ní fún wọn ní ìsinmi díẹ̀ kí wọ́n lè mí.

Ki npariwo ati ki o lemọlemọfún ni ẹrín, o le lero awọn bugbamu ti gbigbọn pẹlu ina ti won itelorun. O jẹ iyalẹnu lati wo. Fun awọn eniyan wọnyi, 'Sugar Rush' jẹ gangan pe; A Rush ti Sugar. Ati pe wọn fẹran rẹ ju apejuwe lọ. A le jẹri si iyẹn daradara. Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, a kórìíra rẹ̀. Gbogbo nikan aaya ti o. 'Sugar Rush' jẹ ayẹyẹ ti The Ridiculous. Ó sì jẹ́ òmùgọ̀ pátápátá.”

column2:
Running for only a paltry sixty six minutes, 'The Delivery Boy' is the quintessential definition of "Quality over Quantity". This movie is one of the best movies we have seen come out of "Young" Nollywood. The makers had the good sense to match technical quality with a good story that is simple, yet very engaging and avoids being overly predictable like its lazy counterparts "Young" Nollywood is wont to churn out.

We had fun seeing this today, and so did the miniscule audience we were blessed to see it with. We all left the hall with zero regrets. And we are sure you will too. While 'The Delivery Boy' is far from being perfec, we can confidently tell you that; if there ever was a Nollywood movie that deserved your support by paying to see it, 'The Delivery Boy' is the one. It is incredibly bold and progressive. Applaudable material. Go for it!
column3:
Won se fún iṣẹju merin din ni adọrin, ọmọ ifijiṣẹ (The Delivery Boy) je ojúlówó ìtumò wípé dídára lori ọpọ. Fíìmù yìí je ìkan lára àwọn fíìmù gidi ti o ti jade ni  ọdọ Nollywood. Awọn to ṣe ní òye láti pa ìtàn ti o dára tí o sí pelu ìmọ - ẹrọ tó dára.
 
 
 
A gbádùn rẹ nígbà tí a woni èní, bẹ sí ní akojọpọ eniyan ti a ko wo. Gbogbo wa la kuro ni iyara láì ni ìbànújẹ. O sí dá wa lójú pé bẹ mi o ṣe rí fún eyin naa. Ọmọ ifijiṣẹ náà(The Delivery Boy)ko pẹ, ṣugbọn a lè sọ fún yín pẹlu ìgboyà wipe,tí e bá ní fíìmù tí o jẹ kẹ sanwo fún láti wò tí e sì lè tí lẹyìn,ọmọ ifijiṣẹ náà(The Delivery Boy) ni o yẹ kó jẹ. O ní ìgboyà o sí tún tẹ síwájú.
column4:
"Nṣiṣẹ fun nikan a kekere kan ọgọta iseju mefa, 'The Ifijiṣẹ Boy' ni awọn quintessential definition ti "" Quality over Quantity ". Eleyi movie jẹ ọkan ninu awọn ti o dara ju sinima ti a ti ri jade ti "Young" Nollywood. Awọn oluṣe ni oye ti o dara lati baramu didara imọ-ẹrọ pẹlu itan ti o dara ti o rọrun, sibẹ ti o ni ifaramọ pupọ ati yago fun jijẹ asọtẹlẹ aṣeju bi awọn ẹlẹgbẹ ọlẹ rẹ “”Young”” Nollywood kii yoo jade.

Inú wa dùn láti rí èyí lónìí, bákan náà sì ni àwọn àwùjọ kéékèèké tí a bù kún wa láti rí i. Gbogbo wa la fi gbọ̀ngàn náà sílẹ̀ láìsí kábàámọ̀. Ati pe a ni idaniloju pe iwọ yoo tun. Lakoko ti 'Ọmọkunrin Ifijiṣẹ' jinna lati jẹ pipe, a le sọ fun ọ ni igboya pe; ti o ba jẹ pe fiimu Nollywood kan wa ti o yẹ atilẹyin rẹ nipa sisanwo lati rii, 'The Delivery Boy' ni ọkan. O jẹ igboya iyalẹnu ati ilọsiwaju. Ohun elo ti o ṣe itẹwọgbà. Lọ fun!”

column2: Jumbled' is highly entertaining and exceptionally enjoyable. You will hate the characters, then you will love them, then hate them and love them again. 'Jumbled' is that special type of movie Nigerians love to love. You know, the type where one minute, you are going- "This guy is so stupid." The next, you are like "Awww". And not too long after that, your "Awww" quickly turns to "Hehn? My God!" Fantastic movie. Not perfect. But fantastic all the same.
column3: Jumbled' jẹ fíìmù tí o dùn tó sì pa'ni l'ẹrin. O ò kórìra àwọn òṣeré fún ìgbà díẹ̀ o sí tún fẹràn wọn díẹ̀ si. 'Jumbled'jẹ fíìmù pàtàkì tí awọn ọmọ Nigeria má n fẹràn. Fíìmù tí o dára gidigan, kò pẹ́ ṣùgbọ́n o dára bákanáà
column4: Jumbled' jẹ idanilaraya pupọ ati igbadun ni iyasọtọ. Iwọ yoo korira awọn ohun kikọ, lẹhinna o yoo nifẹ wọn, lẹhinna korira wọn ki o tun fẹ wọn lẹẹkansi. 'Jumbled' ni iru fiimu pataki yẹn Awọn ọmọ Naijiria nifẹ lati nifẹ. O mọ, iru nibiti iṣẹju kan, o nlọ - "Ọkunrin yii jẹ aṣiwere." Nigbamii ti, o dabi "Awww". Ati pe ko pẹ pupọ lẹhin iyẹn, “Awww” rẹ yarayara yipada si “Hehn? Ọlọrun mi!” fiimu ikọja. Ko pipe. Ṣugbọn ikọja gbogbo awọn kanna.

column2: An enormous amount of work and scrutiny went into making this. Such an enormous amount, its quality stands out easily and brazenly. The sheer amount of authenticity is simply breathtaking.
column3: Íṣe takuntakun àti àyẹ̀wò lọ sí inú iṣẹ yìí, iṣẹ takuntakun, àmì rẹ dára yàtọ̀ bákannáà, òtítọ́ ati ìgbé kalẹ̀ rẹ ya ní lẹ́nu gídígán
column4: Iye nla ti iṣẹ ati ayewo lọ sinu ṣiṣe eyi. Iru ohun nla iye, awọn oniwe-didara dúró jade awọn iṣọrọ ati brazenly. Iye lasan ti ododo jẹ iyalẹnu lasan.

column2: She is' Super Fantastic! You want to see this movie. This movie is extraordinarily enjoyable. Pure Nollywood sweetness.
column3: O kọja bẹẹ, ẹ ó fẹ́ wọ fíìmù yìí, fíìmù náà jẹ́ oun tí e ma gbádùn yàtọ̀, Nollywood to dùn gaara
column4: O jẹ 'Super Fantastic! O fẹ lati wo fiimu yii. Fiimu yii jẹ igbadun lọpọlọpọ. Adun Nollywood funfun.

column2: Quality is the hallmark of this movie. 'Lionheart' screams "Quality! Quality! Quality!" The production is a hundred. Everything just shinny and crispy.
column3: Àbùdá tó yàtọ̀ ni ọkàn kìnìún (Lion heart) o gbé àmì ìdáyàtọ̀ lórí. Iṣẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ rẹ̀ jẹ́ ọgọrun gbogbo nkán, o jẹ alára dan mère mère.
column4: Didara jẹ ami iyasọtọ ti fiimu yii. 'Lionheart' pariwo "Didara! Didara! Didara!" Isejade jẹ ọgọrun. Ohun gbogbo kan danmeremere ati crispy.

column2: The production was great a d light years ahead of most of the sub-par movies of African cinema. This movie is truly a great step in the right direction for Afican cinema.
column3: Iṣẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ rẹ tí yọrí ju awọn akẹgbẹ rẹ̀ lọ ní orílẹ́-èdè Afirika. Fíìmù náà jẹ́ ìgbésẹ̀ àrà ní ọ̀nà tí o tọ fún ṣinimá Afirika.
column4: Isejade jẹ nla ni awọn ọdun ina niwaju pupọ julọ awọn fiimu iha-ipin ti sinima Afirika. Fiimu yii jẹ igbesẹ nla nitootọ ni itọsọna ti o tọ fun sinima Afican.

column2: A great piece of work by Kemi Adetiba, the story was well scripted, good cinematography, all actors gave a great performance. This is a world class movie... Kudos to the all the crews
column3: Íṣe àrà làti ọwọ́ Kẹ́mi Adétiba, ìtàn náà ni akọsilẹ dáadáa, ìwà àkọọlẹ tí o yege. Gbogbo àwọn òṣeré ṣiṣe takuntakun. Fíìmù yìí jé ti àgbáyé,mo kàn sárá sí gbogbo ẹgbẹ awọn atuko
column4: Ise nla kan lati owo Kemi Adetiba, itan naa ni akosile daadaa, sinima ti o dara, gbogbo osere lo se ere nla. Eyi jẹ fiimu kilasi agbaye kan… O ṣeun si gbogbo awọn oṣiṣẹ

column2: Everything about the movie was well thought out, consisting of an Amazing cast who nailed their roles, an original story and top notch videography
column3: Gbogbo nkán nípa fíìmù náà ni wọ́n ti dáa dáa. O ní àwọn òṣeré tí o ṣe ipá wọn gídígán, ojúlówó ìtàn àti iṣeto àwòrán yí o yege jùlọ
column4: Ohun gbogbo nipa fiimu naa ni a ti ronu daradara, ti o ni simẹnti iyalẹnu kan ti o kan awọn ipa wọn, itan atilẹba ati aworan fidio ogbontarigi giga.

column2: The storyline is unpredictable, the acting of most of the characters are believable. The picture quality is amazing!
column3: Ìtàn alailọwaya, a lè gbà iṣẹ́ ọpọlọ àwọn òṣeré gbọ́, dídára àwòrán náà jẹ́ iyalẹnu.
column4: Awọn itan itan jẹ airotẹlẹ, iṣe ti ọpọlọpọ awọn ohun kikọ jẹ gbagbọ. Didara aworan jẹ iyanu!

column2:
The best Nigerian movie I've ever seen
This movie is amazing! Very creative and not predictable. I love how the story line is current and relates to what is going on in Nigeria at the moment. The acting was great - Sola Sobowale is a legend!
column3: Fíìmù orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà tó dára jùlọ tí mo yí rí, fíìmù yìí yá ní lẹ́nu, alátiúdá púpọ àti alailọwaya. Mo fẹràn ni ìtàn náà se jẹ́ ti òde òní,tí o sí tún n'isẹ pelu òun tí o nlọ ni orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà lọwọ yìí, iṣẹ́ àrà ní . Alayé ní Ṣọlá Sobowale jẹ́
column4:
Fiimu Naijiria to dara julọ ti mo ti ri ri
Fiimu yii jẹ iyalẹnu! Ṣiṣẹda pupọ ati kii ṣe asọtẹlẹ. Mo nifẹ bi laini itan ṣe jẹ lọwọlọwọ ati ni ibatan si ohun ti n lọ ni Naijiria ni akoko yii. Oṣere naa jẹ nla – Sola Sobowale jẹ arosọ!”

column2:
Want to watch again
This is one of those Nigerian movies you watch over and over and over again. Great work all through.
column3:
Mo fẹ́ tún wò.
èyí jẹ́ ìkan lára fíìmù orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà  tí mo fé tún wò. Iṣẹ́ àrà ní o jẹ́ títí dé òpin.
column4:
Fe lati wo lẹẹkansi
Eyi jẹ ọkan ninu awọn fiimu Naijiria ti o n wo leralera. Iṣẹ nla ni gbogbo igba. ”

column2:
Awesome Movie
Movie was awesome. Protagonist was amazing Storyline was great Choice of music was on point. Casting Great.
column3:
Fíìmù tó níyì. 
òṣèré pàtàkì rẹ jọmílójú,orin tí wọn yàn kún ojú àmì, ẹdá rẹ dára lọpọlọpọ.
column4:
Fiimu oniyi
Movie je oniyi. Protagonist je iyanu Storyline je nla Yiyan orin wà lori ojuami. Simẹnti Nla. Femu ti ko ni asọtẹlẹ pupọ, fiimu Naijiria to dara julọ ninu itan-akọọlẹ. E daadaa Kemi Adetiba ati awọn oṣere, ko le sọ pe pupọ julọ awọn oṣere ko ni iriri bẹ nigbati wọn n wo fiimu naa. E daadaa!!

column2: Very unpredictable movie, the best Nigerian movie in history. Well done Kemi Adetiba and the cast, couldn't tell that most of the actors are not so experienced when watching the movie. Well done!!
column3: Fíìmù aláìlọ́wàyà, fíìmù  Nàìjíríà tó pẹ ojú òṣùwọ̀n nínú ìtàn. Kẹ́mi Adétiba ati awọn kasiti ku iṣẹ́ takuntakun. Nígbà tí mo wò fíìmù náà,kò hàn gèrè wípé ọpọlọpọ awọn òṣeré nà o ní ìrírí. Ku iṣẹ́ takuntakun
column4: Fiimu airotẹlẹ pupọ, fiimu Naijiria to dara julọ ninu itan-akọọlẹ. E daadaa Kemi Adetiba ati awon osere tiata, ko le so pe opolopo awon osere tiata ni ko ni iriri to bee nigba ti won n wo sinima naa. Kú isé!!

column2:
Simply the best so far
Not surprise that it is Kemi Adetiba on this one but everything about the film is the best of its kind so far in Nollywood. Of course there enough room for improvement. Cinematography was top notch but most impressive is the interpretation of the story.
column3:
Nírọ̀rùn,o jẹ́ òun tó dára.
 
kò jẹ òun ìyàlẹ́nu wípé Kẹ́mi Adétiba ló ṣe iṣẹ́ yìí. Gbogbo nkán nípa fíìmù na ni o pẹ ojú òṣùwọ̀n lára akẹgbẹ́ re ni Nollywood. Síbe sí,ayé wà fún ìtẹ̀síwájú. Ìwà àkọọlẹ jẹ́ oun ìpele gíga. Ṣùgbọ́n òun tí o tani lẹ́nu jùlọ ní bí wọ́n ṣe tunmọ ìtàn náà.
column4:
Nikan ti o dara julọ titi di isisiyi
Kii ṣe iyalẹnu pe Kemi Adetiba ni lori eyi ṣugbọn gbogbo nkan nipa fiimu naa lo dara julọ ninu iru rẹ ni Nollywood. Dajudaju nibẹ to yara fun yewo. Cinematography jẹ ogbontarigi oke ṣugbọn iwunilori julọ ni itumọ itan naa. ”

column2:
Good suspense but unnecessarily long
I would rate the movie as to be a peak standard for Nigerian movies. It has its bit of suspense and great movie visuals. Sola Sobowale is a legendary actress.
column3: Ìsíyèméjì ti o dára ṣugbọn o tí gùn jù. Mo fún ni ìwọn gbendéke nti o wà ní  òkè tente ni fíìmù orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà. O ní ìsíyèméjì bíntin ati àwòrán fíìmù tí o dára. Ṣọlá Sobowale jẹ́ àlàyé òṣeré.
column4:
Idaniloju to dara ṣugbọn pipẹ ko wulo
Emi yoo ṣe oṣuwọn fiimu naa bi o ṣe le jẹ idiwọn giga fun awọn fiimu Naijiria. O ni o ni awọn oniwe-bit ti ifura ati nla movie visuals. Oṣere olokiki ni Sola Sobowale.

column2:
Funny, romantic film!

I went into this thinking it wouldn't be that good but I was so engrossed, the whole movie was like a ball of sunshine, it makes you laugh and smile along with the characters!
column3:
Apanilẹ́rin, fíìmù ìfẹ  
 
Mo wò pelu ìrònú pe kò lè dá, ṣugbọn o gba gbogbo akiyesi mi,o jẹ fíìmù apanilẹ́rin. Yíò jẹ́ kí o rẹrìn pẹlu awọn òṣeré náà.
column4:
Funny, fiimu ifẹ!

Mo lọ sinu ero yii kii yoo dara bẹ ṣugbọn Mo ti gba mi lẹnu, gbogbo fiimu naa dabi bọọlu ti oorun, o jẹ ki o rẹrin ati rẹrin musẹ pẹlu awọn ohun kikọ!

column2:
Fantastic

This for me is way better than all the over hyped nollywood wedding party, Chief daddy and what-have-you. The humour wasn't forced, it came about naturally. Fantastic acting and great plot. Really enjoyed it.
column3:
Ojúlówó.
 
Èyí dára jù gbogbo awọn fíìmù tí wọ́n pariwo lé bi Wedding Party, Chief Daddy àti bẹẹ bẹẹ lọ. Àwàdà rẹ̀ kò n ṣé t'ipá, ojúlówó iṣẹ ati ìtàn tó dára. Mo gbádùn rẹ lọpọlọpọ.
column4:
Ikọja

Eyi fun mi ni ọna ti o dara julọ ju gbogbo ayẹyẹ igbeyawo nollywood ti o pọju lọ, Baba Oloye ati kini-o. Apanilẹrin naa ko fi agbara mu, o wa nipa ti ara. Ikọja osere ati nla Idite. Idunnu re gaan.

column2:
Light and funny!
An absolute comedy gold with a great plot-line. From the sisters to the villains, this is a must watch! Not the mention the unexpected fantasy elements and great special effects! Highly recommended.
column3:
O fúyẹ́ o sí pa'ni l'ẹrin
Ìdíyelé góòlù àwàdà pelu ìtàn tó dára. Lati ọ̀dọ̀ awọn arábìnrin dé orí awọn alátakò,o gbọdọ̀ wò. Ka na so ìdá pìlẹ̀ àlà aìròtẹ́lẹ̀ ati ipá pàtàkì! Mo gba yi. Níye kí ẹ wòó.
column4:
Imọlẹ ati funny!
Ohun idi awada goolu pẹlu kan nla Idite-ila. Lati awọn arabinrin si awọn villains, eyi ni a gbọdọ wo! Kii ṣe darukọ awọn eroja irokuro airotẹlẹ ati awọn ipa pataki nla! Gíga niyanju.

column2: Well, the movie is good, I actually enjoyed it I got what I expected after seeing the end scene of Chief Daddy (the first movie) The actors did a good job with their roles, and yea the movie gat me laughing 😂😂 It was hilarious.
column3: Fíìmù náà dára mó sì gbádùn rẹ,mo rí òun tí mo gb'ọ̀kán le nigba tí Chief Daddy fí ma parí. Awọn òṣeré ṣé iṣẹ́ takuntakun àti wípé fíìmù náà pa ni l'ẹrin.
column4: O dara, fiimu naa da, Mo gbadun re gan-an Mo ni ohun ti mo reti leyin igba ti mo ti ri ipo ipari Oloye Daddy (fiimu akoko) Awon osere naa se daadaa pelu ipa won, beeni fiimu naa si n rerin-in 😂😂 panilerin.

column2: Loved this movie- the cinematography, the shots, the fashion and music was on point. Lagos looks sooooo good. The acting was very believable and I enjoyed humor in unexpected scenes like well- find out for yourself.
column3: Mo fẹràn fíìmù yìí, iṣẹ́ eso aṣọ, aṣọ kagba ati orin wà ní ìbámu. Èkó dára loju,iṣẹ náà ṣé gba gbàgbọ́. Mo sì gbádùn àwàdà aìròtẹ́lẹ̀ bíi,lọ wò fún rà rẹ̀
column4: Fẹran fiimu yii- sinima, awọn iyaworan, aṣa ati orin wa lori aaye. Lagos wo ooooo dara. Oṣere naa jẹ igbagbọ pupọ ati pe Mo gbadun awada ni awọn iṣẹlẹ airotẹlẹ bii daradara- wa jade fun ararẹ.

column2:
A movie for weekend relaxation
It's a good movie to watch with family and friends after a long week. Particularly interesting is the strength of some of the characters as they played their roles. Good job to the director, cast and crew.
column3: Fíìmù tí a lè fi sinmi ní òpin ọsẹ, fíìmù tí o dára láti wò pẹ̀lú ẹbí àti ọrẹ lẹyìn ọsẹ ti o ní ẹni lára, paapaa jùlọ ní ìmí àwọn òṣeré kàn kàn pẹ̀lú bí wọ́n ṣe ṣiṣe wọn dára dára.sàárá fún Olùdarí,awọn òṣeré ati kasiti náà.
column4:
A movie fun ìparí isinmi
O jẹ fiimu ti o dara lati wo pẹlu ẹbi ati awọn ọrẹ lẹhin ọsẹ pipẹ kan. Pataki julo ni agbara ti diẹ ninu awọn ohun kikọ bi wọn ṣe nṣe ipa wọn. Ti o dara ise to director, simẹnti ati atuko.

column2: Great storyline, excellent audio and video quality. Production was top notch! Great combination of actors
column3: Ìtàn tó dára, ohùn ati fídíò tó dára púpọ̀, iṣelọpọ jẹ ohun ìpele gíga, àpapọ àwọn òṣeré dáa púpọ.
column4: Itan nla, ohun afetigbọ ati didara fidio. Production je oke ogbontarigi! Nla apapo ti olukopa

column2:
Great acting and love story

Loved. Loved this film. It's so refreshing to see wonderful love stories coming out of Africa. I am now searching for these actors in other movies.
column3:
Íṣe tí o dára ati ìtàn ìfẹ
 
Mo fẹràn fíìmù yìí, o tu ní lára láti rí ìtàn ìfẹ tí o ya ní lẹ́nu jáde láti Afirika. Mo n wa awọn òṣeré yìí nínú fíìmù míràn.
column4:
Nla osere ati ife itan

Ololufe. Nifẹ fiimu yii. O jẹ onitura pupọ lati rii awọn itan ifẹ iyanu ti n jade lati Afirika. Mo n wa awọn oṣere wọnyi ni awọn fiimu miiran.

column2:
What it means to be Nigerian.

Well done Genevieve Nnaji: a movie for all to see. Kudos Naija, keep improving.
column3: Ohun tí o jẹ́ pàtó láti jẹ ọmọ Nàìjíríà, Genevieve Nnaji kú iṣẹ́. Fíìmù tí ènìyàn gbogbo gbúdọ̀ wò, Naijiria saara rẹ,má tẹ̀síwájú.
column4:
Ohun ti o tumo si lati wa ni Nigerian.

O dara Genevieve Nnaji: fiimu fun gbogbo eniyan lati rii. Kudos Naija, tesiwaju.

column2:
LIONHEART: A Genevieve Nnaji's Love Letter To Nigeria.

She Took The Defunct Nigerian Home Movie Back Home To Enugu, Nigeria. That's BRAVE. It Paid off.
column3:
Lionheart: lẹ́tà  ìfẹ Genevieve Nnaji sí Nàìjíríà.
 
O mú ile-itage Nàìjíríà ti o ti di oku pada lọ sí ìlẹ̀ Enugu Nàìjíríà. O jẹ́ iṣẹ́ ìgboyà. O sí ní èrè
column4:
LIONHEART: Iwe Ife ti Genevieve Nnaji Si Nigeria.

O Mu Movie Nigerian Home Aile Pada si Enugu, Nigeria. BRAVE niyen. O ti san ni pipa.

column2: Lionheart is a lovely movie that used long shots to show of the scenery quite well. I heartily recommend.
column3: Òkàn kìnìú(Lion heart) jẹ fíìmù tí o dára, tí o sí fi gbogbo àyíká hàn dáadáa. Mo yan tókàn tókàn.
column4: Lionheart jẹ fiimu ẹlẹwa ti o lo awọn iyaworan gigun lati ṣafihan iwoye naa daradara. Mo ṣeduro tọkàntọkàn.

column2: Humbling, Heartwarming, Funny, & Empowering
column3: Fíìmù ìrẹ̀lẹ̀, apanilẹ́rin, ìdùnnú àti agbára.
column4: Irẹlẹ, Idunnu, Arinrin, & Agbara

column2:
Best Nollywood movie
Cinematography is great. The music score is nice. The casting was done brilliantly. Nothing over the top.
column3:
Fíìmù Nollywood tó dára jùlọ
Ìwà -àkọọlẹ tó yege,orin rẹ dára, ẹ̀dá rẹ jáfárá. Kò ju bí o ṣe yẹ lọ.
column4:
Ti o dara ju Nollywood movie
Cinematography jẹ nla. Iwọn orin dara. Simẹnti naa ni a ṣe daradara. Ko si ohun lori oke.

column2:
Brilliant movie

From the Ibo cultural point of view a masterpiece. Very different from the lot. I like that some plots differed from the usual African film expectations; where you can predict what will happen next. Kudos Genny!!
column3:
Fíìmù tó dára
 
Asetanse lati ipò àṣà ìgbò,o yatọ sí eré tó kù. Mo nifẹ sí wipe awọn ìpìlẹ̀ yàtọ sí òun tí a lérò lati ọwọ fíìmù Afirika, ní ibi tí a tí lè sọ  àsọtẹlẹ òun ti o ṣẹlẹ.Genny kú iṣẹ́.
column4:
fiimu ti o wuyi

Lati oju asa Ibo kan aṣetan. O yatọ pupọ si pupọ. Mo fẹran pe diẹ ninu awọn igbero yatọ si awọn ireti fiimu ti Afirika ti o ṣe deede; nibi ti o ti le asọtẹlẹ ohun ti yoo ṣẹlẹ tókàn. O ṣeun Genny !!

column2:
Adorable...

A very good plot, a mix of suspense and superstition, predictable until the end, with a good plot twist, good performances, in love with the works of Kunle Afolayan, who always acts in his films, in which he directs, writes and produces, multifunctional ... Adorable...
column3:
O jọnilójú
 
Ìpìlẹ tó dára tí a dá pọ pẹlú ìsíyèméjì ati ìgbàgbọ asán, o ṣe sọ tẹlẹ dè òpin pẹlu ìpìlẹ̀ lílò tí o dáa. Mo nifẹ iṣẹ Kunle Afoláyan, ẹni tí o má n kópa nínú iṣẹ tí o bá n kọ, darí tí o sí má n gbé jáde. O le ṣẹ̀ ọpọlọpọ iṣẹ́,èyí tí o jọnilójú
column4:
Ewa...

Idite ti o dara pupọ, adapọ ifura ati igbagbọ, asọtẹlẹ titi di opin, pẹlu itankalẹ ti o dara, awọn iṣẹ ṣiṣe ti o dara, ifẹ pẹlu awọn iṣẹ Kunle Afolayan, ti o n ṣiṣẹ nigbagbogbo ninu awọn fiimu rẹ, ninu eyiti o ṣe itọsọna, kọwe ati gbejade. , multifunctional ... Adorable...

column2: I would recommend this movie to anyone and everyone interested in Nigerian history and heritage.
column3: Mo yàn fíìmù yìí fún ẹnikẹ́ni tó bá nifẹ sí ìtàn àti orísun Nàìjíríà
column4: Emi yoo ṣeduro fiimu yii si ẹnikẹni ati gbogbo eniyan ti o nifẹ si itan-akọọlẹ ati ohun-ini Naijiria.

column2:
Great Film

I hesitated viewing the film before reading the novel. After seeing the film, I am more intrigued about the novel and the history behind it. This is a GREAT FILM, make no mistake about it.
column3:
Fíìmù tí o dára
 
Mo ṣìyèméjì bóyá kí n  wò fíìmù náà kí n to ka iwe rẹ̀, ṣugbọn lẹ́hìn ìgbà tí mo wò fíìmù náà,ara mi ya gágá nípa ìwé àti ìtàn rẹ. Fíìmù tí o dára ni,má ṣìyèméjì nípa rẹẹ
column4:
Fiimu nla

Mo ṣiyemeji wiwo fiimu naa ṣaaju kika iwe aramada naa. Lẹhin ti ri fiimu naa, Mo ni itara diẹ sii nipa aramada ati itan-akọọlẹ lẹhin rẹ. FIM NLA ni eyi, maṣe ṣe asise nipa rẹ.

column2:
It was Fantastic!! Ignore the negative reviews

Honestly. It was mindblowing! Didn't even believe it was shot in Nigeria, the production was special and the cast were A1. They all played thier parts well and made it fun!
column3:
O dara, e pa àtúnyẹwò òdì tí
 
Ní tòótọ,o ya ni lẹ́nu , mi kò gbàgbọ́ wípé Nàìjíríà ni wón ti ṣe, iṣẹ́ - lọ́pọ̀ rẹ jẹ́ pàtàkì, àwọn òṣeré rẹẹ ṣé mú yangàn. Gbogbo wọn ṣa ipá wọn dáa dáa,o sí dùn.
column4:
O je ikọja!! Foju odi agbeyewo

Nitootọ. O je mindblowing! Ko tile gbagbọ pe o ti shot ni Nigeria, iṣelọpọ jẹ pataki ati awọn oṣere jẹ A1. Gbogbo wọn dun awọn ẹya daradara ati jẹ ki o dun!

column2:
Brilliant!

Kemi, your work is outstanding. You just keep absolutely getting better. Can't wait for future productions. Was thoroughly entertained.💃👍
column3:
O jáfárá
 
Kémi iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ dàa yàtọ̀ gedegbe. O n dára sí ní gbogbo ìgbà, mí o lẹ dúró dè iṣẹ́ ọjọ́ iwájú. Ọpọlọpọ idaraya fún mi.
column4:
O wuyi!

Kemi, ise yin yato si. O kan n dara si ni kikun. Ko le duro fun awọn iṣelọpọ ọjọ iwaju. Ni ere idaraya daradara.💃👍

column2:
Nice movie for the holidays

A funny, spirited comedy that is thoroughly enjoyable to watch. Good acting, great use of settings, brings out the various dynamics of Nigerian family, friends, societal struggles and quests for love and money.
column3:
Fíìmù tó dára fún ìgbà ìsínmí 
 
O pa ni l'ẹrin pẹ̀lú àwàdà ti o ṣe gbádùn. Òṣèré ti o dára
column4:
Nice movie fun awọn isinmi

Apanilẹrin, awada ti o ni ẹmi ti o jẹ igbadun daradara lati wo. Iṣe iṣe ti o dara, lilo awọn eto nla, mu ọpọlọpọ awọn agbara ti idile Naijiria, awọn ọrẹ, awọn ijakadi awujọ ati awọn ibeere ifẹ ati owo jade.

column2:
A film that simply seeks to raise awareness.

Quality. Entertaining Baffling. Current. The script is interesting and smart. Told in two times where the present is in full screen and the past in cinema mode. A film that simply seeks to raise awareness. A powerful African drama.
column3:
Fíìmù tí o fé fi ìmọ́lẹ̀ hàn 
 
O dára,o sí jẹ́ òun tí o n ṣẹlẹ̀ lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́. Àkọsílẹ̀ dára ósí jáfárá . O so ìtàn ní ọ̀nà méjì, èyí tí o n ṣẹlẹ̀ bayii ni ìbòjú kíkún àti èyí tí o ti kọjá ní ipò ṣinimá. Eré Afirika ti o lágbára.
column4:
Fiimu kan ti o n wa lati ni imọ siwaju sii.

Didara. Idalaraya Baffling. Lọwọlọwọ. Awọn akosile ni awon ati ki o smati. Ti sọ ni igba meji nibiti lọwọlọwọ wa ni iboju kikun ati ti o ti kọja ni ipo sinima. A fiimu ti o nìkan ọtẹ lati ró imo. Ere-idaraya Afirika ti o lagbara.

column2:
NOT A FAN OF NIGERIAN MOVIES, BUT THIS ONE PLEASES

The cast director selected wisely, the actors impressively reincarnate the true events back to life. Overall, its a cinematic masterpiece, hence the Netflix distribution.
column3: N kò n ṣe olólùfẹ́ fíìmù Nàìjíríà, ṣugbọn eleyii tẹ́nilọ́rùn. Olùdarí Yan kasiti pẹlú ọgbọ́n, awọn òṣèré jí àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ẹ̀yìn òtítọ́ gbogbo. O jẹ́ asetanse ṣinimá èyí tí ì já sí kí Netflix ma kpin
column4:
KI ASE OLOLUFE FIMILE NAIJIRIA, SUGBON EYI LO DUN

Oludari simẹnti ti yan pẹlu ọgbọn, awọn oṣere n ṣe atunbi awọn iṣẹlẹ otitọ pada si igbesi aye. Lapapọ, o jẹ afọwọṣe cinima kan, nitorinaa pinpin Netflix.

column2:
Outstanding performance

Temi Otedola's performance was truly stunning. I thoroughly enjoyed the layers that the story had and the way that each key piece of information was revealed.
column3:
Iṣẹ́ tí ó tayọ 
 
Ìṣe Temi Otedola jẹ́ ìyàlẹ́nu gan-an ní tòótọ́ . Mo gbádùn àwọn ìpele tí ìtàn náà ní ní kíkún àti ọ̀nà tí wọ́n fi ṣàfihàn àlàyé pàtàkì.
column4:
Iṣẹ ti o tayọ

Iṣẹ́ Temi Otedola wúni lórí gan-an. Mo gbadun igbadun awọn ipele ti itan naa ni ati ọna ti alaye bọtini kọọkan ṣe ṣafihan.

column2:
If it were food I would say mouth watering

The film citation is a necessity, I do not see where it would ever run out of relevance. The actors were carefully picked and displayed such professionalism, the location were amazing never new had such good universities in Senegal , the arts and craft of our African leaders carved out the African identity.

The message this movie carries, how it was told is so special, insightful and artistic. The suspense is on another level, the melange of feelings it creates to us the viewers is something else.

Citation is a must watch go watch it on NETFLIX
column3:
Tí ó bá jẹ́ oúnjẹ ni máa ní ó bu omi rẹ ẹnu 
 
Àgbọdọ̀ wò ni fíìmù 'citation' jẹ́, mi ò ri bí ohun tó le kù tà. Wọ́n fi ara balẹ̀ yan àwọn Òṣèré náà wón sì fi àmì ògbóǹtagì hàn, àwọn ibi tí wón lò dára lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ mi ò sì mọ̀ pé àwọn ilé ìwé gíga tí ó dára wà ní Senegal, àwọn ọnà àwọn adarí wa ní Áfríkà gbé àmì ìdáni mọ̀ Áfríkà yọ. 
 
Ẹ̀kọ́ tí ó wà nínú eré yìí, bí wón ṣe sọ ìtàn naa jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí ó ṣe pàtàkì, tí ó ní òye àti iṣẹ́ ọnà tí ó peléke.  Ìdádúró náà wà ní ìpele mìíràn, ìdàpọ̀ ti àwọn ìkùnsínú tí ó dá sí àwa oluùwò jẹ́ ǹkan mìíràn. 
 
Citation jẹ́ ohun tí o gbọ̀dọ̀ wò lọ wòó lórí NETFLIX
column4:
Ti o ba jẹ ounjẹ Emi yoo sọ agbe ẹnu

Itọkasi fiimu jẹ iwulo, Emi ko rii ibiti yoo ti pari ni ibaramu. Awọn oṣere naa ni ifarabalẹ ti mu ati ṣafihan iru iṣẹ amọdaju, ipo naa jẹ iyalẹnu rara rara ni iru awọn ile-ẹkọ giga ti o dara ni Ilu Senegal, iṣẹ ọna ati iṣẹ ọna ti awọn oludari ile Afirika wa ti ṣe idanimọ idanimọ Afirika.

Ifiranṣẹ ti fiimu yii gbejade, bawo ni wọn ṣe sọ fun jẹ pataki, oye ati iṣẹ ọna. Ifura naa wa ni ipele miiran, melange ti awọn ikunsinu ti o ṣẹda si wa awọn oluwo jẹ nkan miiran.

Itọkasi jẹ dandan lati wo lọ wo lori NETFLIX

column2:
Spot On!!! 🔥🔥🔥
Definitely African movie of the year, enjoyed every minute of the 2hours 30minutes 😀👏👏👏🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥✔✌
column3:
Ó wà ní bẹ̀!!! 🔥🔥🔥
Dájúdájú ère Áfríkà tó gbayì nínú ọdún yìí, mo gbádùn gbogbo ìṣẹ́jú tó wà nínú wákàtí méjì àti ọgbọ̀n ìṣẹ́jú 😀👏👏👏🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥✔️✌️
column4:
Aami Lori !!! 🔥🔥🔥
Ni pato fiimu Afirika ti ọdun, gbadun ni iṣẹju kọọkan ti awọn wakati 2 30 iṣẹju 😀👏👏👏🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥✔✌

column2: Citation: Kunle Afolayan's Deceptively Simple Yet Incredibly Complex Movie

column2:
#LoveCitation
I should have rated this movie 100% but nothing can be 100% perfect even though the entirety of the movie is close to perfection. Mr kunle Afolayan has never disappointed us for once right from the day's of #irapada,it's always from one level of professionalism to another. Always amazing and giving the best.
column3:
#LoveCitation
Ó yẹ kí n tí ṣe ìwọ̀n fíìmù yí ní ọgọ́rùn-ún ṣùgbọ́n kò sí ohun tí ó le jẹ́ ọgọ́rùn-ún òṣùwọ̀n ní pípé  bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gbogbo fíìmù náà sún mọ́ pípé . Ọ́gbéni Kunle Afolayan kò dó jú tì wá rí fún ìgbà kan láti ọjọ́ fíìmù #ìràpadà, ó máa n jẹ́ láti ìpele kan tí ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n sí òmíràn. Nígbà gbogbo ló ń yani lẹ́nu ó sì ń fún wa ní àwọn tí ó dára jù.
column4:
#Iwa-ifẹ
Mo yẹ ki o ti ṣe iwọn fiimu yii ni 100% ṣugbọn ko si ohun ti o le jẹ pipe 100% botilẹjẹpe gbogbo fiimu naa sunmọ pipe. Mr kunle Afolayan ko tii da wa kuku loju fun igba kan lati ojo ti #irapada,o maa n wa lati ipele kan ti ogbon ise si omiran. Nigbagbogbo iyanu ati ki o fifun awọn ti o dara ju.

column2: Kunle afolayan master piece
column3: Kunle Afolayan àgbà ni
column4: Kunle afolayan master nkan

column2:
Accurate
This movie talks about Nigeria and her politicians or politheivecians as I call them. Who are all jokers and comedians in a different area of life who decided to go into politics and toil with people's lives as much as they want entertain you on campaigns and forget what they were elected for. Big ups to the producers, actors and actresses, directors and the rest of the crew, nice movie budget especially when comparing it in the nollywood. Everything was nice but we would have loved if the movie was concluded in a way it should have been and not in suspense or another part or sequel to be released later on. Good movie especially if you are Nigerian and not interested in party or favouritism from the leaders. Just shows you the people we elect as leaders in this country are comedians who lack idea on how to rule a country. Once again big ups to everyone.
column3:
Ó pé
Fímù yìí ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa Nàìjíríà àti àwọn olóṣèlú tàbí àwọn olè ń ṣèlú bí mo ṣe ń pè wọ́n. Tí gbogbo wọ́n jẹ́ aláwàdà àti apanilẹ́rìín ní agbègbè ìgbésí ayé tí ó yàtọ̀ tí wọ́n pinnu láti lọ sínú ìṣèlú láti fi ìgbésí ayé àwọn ènìyàn ṣeré bí wọ́n ṣe fẹ́ ṣe eré fún yín lórí ìpolongo tí Wọ́n sì gbàgbé ohun tí wọ́n yàn wọ́n fún . Mo gbọ́wọ́ sókè sí àwọn olùṣe, àwọn òṣèré lọ́'kùnrin àti ló' bìnrin , olùdarí àti àwọn iyokù òṣìṣẹ́, fíìmù tó dára ní ìsúná pàápàá nígbà tí a bá fi wé nollywood. Ohun gbogbo dára ṣùgbọ́n a ò bá nífẹ̀ẹ́ tí fíìmù náà bá parí ní ọ̀naà tí ó yẹ kí ó jẹ́ kìí ṣe ní ìfura tàbí apá kan mìíràn tàbí a àtẹ̀lé láti gbé jáde nígbà míì. Fíìmù rere pàápàá tí o bá jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tí kò nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ẹgbẹ́ tàbí ojú ṣàájú láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn aládarí. Ó kàn fihàn ọ́ pé àwọn ènìyàn tí a yàn gẹ́gẹ́bí aṣáájú ní orílẹ̀-èdè yí jẹ́ àwọn aláwàdà tí kò ní ìmọ̀ lórí bí a ṣe le ṣe ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè. Ní ẹ̀kan si mo gbọ́wọ́ sókè sí gbogbo yín.
column4:
Deede
Fíìmù yìí sọ̀rọ̀ nípa Nàìjíríà àti àwọn olóṣèlú tàbí àwọn olóṣèlú rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí mo ṣe pè wọ́n. Tani gbogbo wọn jẹ awada ati apanilẹrin ni agbegbe igbesi aye ti o yatọ ti wọn pinnu lati lọ sinu iṣelu ati ṣiṣẹ pẹlu igbesi aye eniyan bi wọn ṣe fẹ ṣe ere rẹ lori ipolongo ati gbagbe ohun ti wọn yan fun wọn. Nla soke si awọn ti onse, olukopa ati awọn oṣere, oludari ati awọn iyokù ti awọn atukọ, dara movie isuna paapa nigbati wé o ni nollywood. Ohun gbogbo dara ṣugbọn a yoo nifẹ ti fiimu naa ba pari ni ọna ti o yẹ ki o jẹ kii ṣe ni ifura tabi apakan miiran tabi atẹle lati tu silẹ nigbamii. Fiimu rere paapaa ti o ba jẹ orilẹ-ede Naijiria ti ko nifẹ si ẹgbẹ tabi ojuṣaju lati ọdọ awọn oludari. O kan fihan ọ awọn eniyan ti a yan gẹgẹbi aṣaaju ni orilẹ-ede yii jẹ awọn alawada ti ko ni imọran lori bi a ṣe le ṣe ijọba orilẹ-ede kan. Lekan si nla soke si gbogbo eniyan.

column2: It's a really nice movie..
column3: Eré tí ó dára gan-an ni
column4: O jẹ fiimu ti o dara gaan..

column2:
Funny Funny Funny

Oh mehn, this movie is super funny. if you are looking for a movie to lift your mood up then this is the right movie for you.
column3:
Ó pa ni lẹ́rìín ó pa ni lẹ́rìín 
 
Ó ga, fíìmù yí pa ni lẹ́rìín gan-an ni. tí ó bá ń wá fíìmù kan láti gbé ìṣe sí rẹ sókè lẹhinna èyí ni fíìmù tí ó tọ́ fún ọ.
column4:
Funny Funny

Oh mehn, fiimu yii jẹ ẹrin pupọ. ti o ba n wa fiimu kan lati gbe iṣesi rẹ soke lẹhinna eyi ni fiimu ti o tọ fun ọ.

column2: The timing of this film must be written in the stars. It is an original twist on a themes of family/ racism / fascism. Profound moments of child craving for a family and intimacy, alongside abusive grooming. It punches you in the stomach. Kudos to the writer/director who worked tirelessly to get the project on screen an the major U.K film funders stayed away from it. He also took the project to Creative England's iFeatures but didn't make the cut... In a way, it works to the writer/directors hand to have a told a bold British story based on a True Story with Hanway films. Watch & Support playing now!
column3: Ó dá mi lójú pé inú irawọ̀ ni wọ́n tí kọ àkókò .fíìmù yí. Ó jẹ́ lílọ́ atilẹba lórí àwọn àkòrí ti ìdílé / ẹlẹ́yaàmẹ̀yà. Àwọn àkókò tí ó jinlẹ̀ tí ìfẹ́ ọmọ fún ẹbí àti ìbáaraẹnisepọ̀, lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ olùtọ́jú -ara ti ìlòkulò. Ó lù ọ́ ní ikùn . Oríyìn fún òǹkọ̀wé/ olùdarí tí ó ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun láti gbé iṣẹ́ àkànṣe yìí sí orí amóhùnmáwòrán tí àwọn agbátẹrù fíìmù UK pàtàkì dúró kúrò níbẹ̀. Ó tún mú iṣẹ́ náà lọ sí Creative England's iFeatures ṣùgbọ́n kò yọrí ... Ní ọ̀nà kan, ó ṣiṣẹ́ sí ọwọ òǹkọ̀wé / àwọn olùdarí láti sọ ìtàn tí ó ní ìgboyà ti Ìlú Gẹ̀ẹ́sì tí ó dá lórí Ìtàn Òtítọ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn fíìmù Hanway. Wòó kí o sì ṣe àtìlẹyìn tí ń dún ní báyìí!
column4: Akoko ti fiimu yii gbọdọ kọ sinu awọn irawọ. O jẹ lilọ atilẹba lori awọn akori ti idile / ẹlẹyamẹya / fascism. Awọn akoko ti o jinlẹ ti ifẹ ọmọ fun ẹbi ati ibaraenisepo, lẹgbẹẹ olutọju-ara ti ilokulo. O lu ọ ni ikun. O ṣeun si onkọwe / oludari ti o ṣiṣẹ lainidi lati gba iṣẹ akanṣe loju iboju ti awọn agbateru fiimu UK pataki duro kuro lọdọ rẹ. O tun mu iṣẹ naa lọ si Creative England's iFeatures ṣugbọn ko ṣe gige naa ... Ni ọna kan, o ṣiṣẹ si ọwọ onkqwe / awọn oludari lati ni itan-itumọ ti o ni igboya ti Ilu Gẹẹsi ti o da lori Itan Otitọ pẹlu awọn fiimu Hanway. Wo & Atilẹyin ti ndun ni bayi!

column2:
Farming is a excellent film but my god is it a tough watch

This was by far one of the best movies I have seen this year. I do not know why the rating is so bad. This movie is by far better than some of the movies that have received Oscars including Moonlight.

Farming is an extremely tough movie to watch. Every scene comes down on you... Hard enough to either make you cry out in pain, anger or just good old plain frustration. I couldn't stop cursing!
column3:
Ọ̀gbìn jẹ́ fíìmù tí ó tayọ ṣùgbọ́n Ọlọ́run mi  ò  ó gba wíwò líle 
 
Èyí jẹ́ ọ̀kan nínú àwọn fíìmù tí ó dára jù lọ tí mo ti rí ní ọdún yìí. Èmi kò mọ ìdí tí ìwọ̀n rẹ̀ fi burú jáì. Fíìmù yìí dára púpọ̀ ju díẹ̀ nínú àwọn fíìmù tí ó ti gba Oscars pẹ̀lú Moonlight. 
 
Ọ̀gbìn jẹ́ fíìmù tí ó le púpọ̀ láti wò. Gbogbo ìpele ló tọ́ ni lọ́kàn... Líle tó láti bóyá mú ẹ sunkún ní ìrora, ìbínú tàbí ọ̀kan tí ó dára àtijọ́ itele ìbànújẹ́. Ńkọ́ lè dá ègún gégé dúró!
column4:
Ogbin jẹ fiimu ti o tayọ ṣugbọn ọlọrun mi jẹ iṣọ lile

Eyi jẹ ọkan ninu awọn fiimu ti o dara julọ ti Mo ti rii ni ọdun yii. Emi ko mo idi ti awọn Rating jẹ ki buburu. Fiimu yii dara julọ ju diẹ ninu awọn fiimu ti o ti gba Oscars pẹlu Moonlight.

Ogbin jẹ fiimu ti o nira pupọ lati wo. Gbogbo ipele ba wa ni isalẹ lori o ... Lile to lati boya ṣe awọn ti o kigbe ni irora, ibinu tabi o kan ti o dara atijọ itele ibanuje. Nko le da egun duro!

column2: Read movie! Don't understand why this got such a low rating!
column3: Ka fíìmù! ìdí tí èyí fi ní irú ìwọ̀n kékeré yìí ò yé mi!
column4: Ka fiimu! Maṣe loye idi ti eyi ni iru iwọn kekere bẹ!

column2:
Very disturbing but gripping

This was one of the most uncomfortable films I've watched and made me feel quite emotional. I was unfamiliar with 'farming' until this film and thank you to the writer and director for making it free to view during this time of the BLM stuggles 2020. The story drew me in and the characters were well acted and believable. The story was unrelentingly tense throughout. The ending gives no answers to the issues explored in the film but leaves the viewer to grapple with them. Very glad to have watched this and it will stay with me for a while
column3:
Ó yanilẹ́nu púpọ̀ ṣùgbọ́n ó mú ni lọ́kàn 
 
Èyí jẹ́ ọ̀kan nínú àwọn fíìmù tí kò ní ìtùnú jùlọ tí mo ti wò tí ó jẹ́ kí n ní ìmọ̀lára púpọ̀ . Èmi kò ní ìmọ̀ nípa 'ọ̀gbìn' títí di ìgbà tí mo wo fíìmù yí mo sì dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ òǹkọ̀wé àti olùdarí fún ṣí ṣeé ní ọ̀fẹ́ láti wòó lákòókò yìí ti BLM stuggles 2020. Ìtàn náà fà mí sínú àti pé àwọn òṣèré náà ṣe dáradára tí ó sì ṣeé gbàgbọ́ itan náà le jákèjádò. Ìparí náà kò fi àwọn ìdáhùn sí àwọn ọ̀ràn tí a ṣàwárí nínú fíìmù ṣùgbọ́n ó fi olùwò náà sílẹ̀ láti kojú wọn. Inú mí dùn púpọ̀ láti wo èyí àti pé yóò wà lọ́kàn mi fún ìgbà díẹ̀.
column4:
Pupọ idamu ṣugbọn dimu

Eleyi jẹ ọkan ninu awọn julọ korọrun fiimu Mo ti sọ ti wo ati ki o ṣe mi lero oyimbo imolara. Emi ko mọ pẹlu 'ogbin' titi fiimu yii ati pe o dupẹ lọwọ onkọwe ati oludari fun ṣiṣe ni ọfẹ lati wo lakoko yii ti BLM stuggles 2020. Itan naa fa mi sinu ati pe awọn oṣere naa ṣe daradara ati gbagbọ. Awọn itan wà unrelentingly ẹdọfu jakejado. Ipari naa ko fun awọn idahun si awọn ọran ti a ṣawari ninu fiimu ṣugbọn o fi oluwo naa silẹ lati koju wọn. Inu mi dun pupọ lati ti wo eyi ati pe yoo duro pẹlu mi fun igba diẹ

column2:
Sadly accurate, disturbing but incredibly engaging.

I grew up during this time period and sadly resonate with some of the issues which were brought up in this film. I have a close friend who also experienced "farming" and it still has repercussions in her and her family's life today. The film was sadly disturbing, but unfortunately accurate in a number of it's depictions of the era in the UK. I was shocked at the final revelation as to who Enitan is in real life, which definitely - as already explained by another reviewer - enhanced the emotional climax.

Excellent, albeit sad, but well worth watching if only for the historical context.
column3:
Ó jẹ́ déédéé pẹ̀lú ìbànújẹ́, ó dààmú ọkàn ṣùgbọ́n ó ní ìkópa tó yani lẹ́nu.
 
Mo dàgbà ní àsìkò yìí àti ní ìbànújẹ́  pẹ̀lú díẹ̀ nínú àwọn ọ̀ràn tí a gbé jáde nínú fíìmù yìí. Mo ní ọ̀rẹ́ tímọ́tímọ́ tí ó ní ìrírí “ọ̀gbìn” àti pé àwọn àbájáde rẹ̀ wà nínú ìgbésí ayé rẹ̀ àti ẹbí rẹ̀ lónìí. Fíìmù náà jẹ́ ìbànújẹ́, ṣùgbọ́n ó ṣe déédéé díẹ̀ nínú àwọn ìfihàn ti àkókò ní UK. Ó jẹ́ ìyàlẹ́nu fún mi ní ìfihàn ìkẹhìn nípa ẹni tí Enitan jẹ́ ni lójú ayé, èyí tí ó dájú bí a ti ṣàlàyé tẹ́lẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ olùyẹ́wò mìíràn tí mú ìlọsíwájú ẹ̀dùn pọ̀ si. 
 
Ó tayọ, ṣùgbọ́n ó ba ni nínú jẹ́, ṣùgbọ́n ó tọ́ láti wò bí ó bá tilẹ̀ jẹ́ fún ti ìtàn tó ní.
column4:
Ibanujẹ deede, idamu ṣugbọn iyalẹnu iyalẹnu.

Mo ti dagba soke ni akoko yi akoko ati ibanuje resonate pẹlu diẹ ninu awọn ti awon oran ti a mu soke ni yi fiimu. Mo ni ọrẹ timọtimọ ti o tun ni iriri ““ogbin” ati pe o tun ni awọn ipadabọ ninu igbesi aye oun ati ẹbi rẹ loni. Fiimu naa jẹ ibanujẹ ibanujẹ, ṣugbọn laanu jẹ deede ni nọmba kan ti awọn ifihan ti akoko ni UK. Mo jẹ iyalẹnu ni ifihan ikẹhin nipa tani Enitan wa ni igbesi aye gidi, eyiti o dajudaju - gẹgẹ bi alaye ti tẹlẹ nipasẹ oluyẹwo miiran - mu ilọsiwaju ẹdun dara si.

O tayọ, botilẹjẹpe ibanujẹ, ṣugbọn o tọ si wiwo ti o ba jẹ fun ipo itan nikan.

column2:
A fun-filled rollercoaster of emotions

If you're an open-minded, hopeless romantic, you'll definitely enjoy watching this movie. I thought that the lead characters had great chemistry and the supporting cast delivered fine performances as well. It was interesting to see the clash of cultures exposed and finally resolved amicably. There's plenty of humour, drama and tense moments to hold your interest. Certainly makes my favourite list.
column3:
Iṣẹ́ tó kún fún ìgbádùn nípa ìmọ̀lára 
 
Tí ó  bá jẹ́ ẹni tí ó ṣí ọkàn payá, àìní ìrètí ìfẹ́, ó dájú pé wàá gbádùn wíwò fíìmù yìí. Mo rò pé àwọn òṣèré aṣáájú ní kemistri ńlá àwon òṣèré tó kù  ṣe àwọn ipa wọn dáradára. Ó jẹ́ ohun tí ó dun ni nínú láti rí ìkọlù àwọn àṣà  àti bí wọ́n ṣe yanjú rẹ̀ ní àlàáfíà nikẹhin. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àrín  tàkìtì, eré àti àwọn àkókò a ìfọkànbalẹ̀ wà láti pé ọkàn rẹ. Dájúdájú ó wà nínú àwọn eré tí mo yàn fẹ́.
column4:
A fun-kún rollercoaster ti emotions

Ti o ba jẹ ọkan-ìmọ, ifẹ ifẹ ainireti, dajudaju iwọ yoo gbadun wiwo fiimu yii. Mo ro pe awọn ohun kikọ asiwaju ni kemistri nla ati simẹnti atilẹyin ti ṣe awọn iṣẹ ṣiṣe to dara daradara. O jẹ ohun ti o dun lati rii ikọlu ti awọn aṣa ti han ati nikẹhin pinnu ni alaafia. Opolopo arin takiti, eré ati awọn akoko aifọkanbalẹ wa lati di iwulo rẹ mu. Esan mu ki awọn ayanfẹ mi akojọ.

column2:
An unlikely love story well told

Love the message of the film, and there should be many more like it: We are all people so lets not look at our differences but what unites us. Loved the chemistry between the two main protagonists.
column3:
Itan ifẹ ti ko ṣeeṣe ti a sọ daradara 
 
Nifẹ ifiranṣẹ ti fiimu naa, ati pe ọpọlọpọ awọn miiran yẹ ki o wa: Gbogbo wa ni eniyan nitorinaa maṣe wo awọn iyatọ wa ṣugbọn ohun ti o so wa papọ. Ni ife kemistri laarin awọn òṣèré pàtàkì méjèèjì.
column4:
Itan ifẹ ti ko ṣeeṣe daradara

Nifẹ ifiranṣẹ ti fiimu naa, ati pe o yẹ ki ọpọlọpọ diẹ sii bii rẹ: Gbogbo wa ni eniyan nitorinaa jẹ ki a ma wo awọn iyatọ wa ṣugbọn ohun ti o so wa papọ. Ni ife kemistri laarin awọn meji akọkọ protagonists.

column2:
A must watch

The movie was amazing, its a must watch. If you want to pass time quickly watch this. I love the taxi scene, it is my favourite.
column3:
À gbọ́dọ̀ wò 
 
Ère náà yani lẹ́nu, ó jẹ́ a gbọ́dọ̀ wò. Tí o bá fẹ́ lo àkókò rẹ kíákíá wo èyí. Mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ abala òní takisí, òun ló wù mí jù.
column4:
A gbọdọ wo

Fiimu naa jẹ iyalẹnu, o gbọdọ wo. Ti o ba fẹ lati kọja akoko ni kiakia wo eyi. Mo nifẹ aaye takisi, o jẹ ayanfẹ mi.

column2:
Great Movie about relationship with God

I totally enjoyed watching this movie, it stirred up something in my spirit to be persistent with my walk with God and was a reminder that He is my father I can always talk to anytime. There is room for improvement for a better execution.
column3:
Fíìmù ńlá  nípa ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run 
 
Mo gbádùn wíwò fíìmù yìí pátápátá, ó ru ohun kan sókè nínú ẹ̀mí mi láti dúró pẹ̀lú ìrìn mi pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run àti pé ó jẹ́ ìrántí pé Òun ni bàbá mi tí mo lè bá sọ̀rọ̀ nígbà gbogbo nígbàkúùgbà . Àyè wà fún ìlọsíwájú fún iṣẹ́ tó dára jù lọ .
column4:
Nla Movie nipa ibasepo pelu Olorun

Mo gbadun wiwo fiimu yii patapata, o ru ohun kan soke ninu ẹmi mi lati duro ni itara pẹlu rin pẹlu Ọlọrun ati pe o jẹ olurannileti pe Oun ni baba mi Mo le nigbagbogbo sọrọ si nigbakugba. Yara wa fun ilọsiwaju fun ipaniyan to dara julọ.

column2:
God called me.......
As He is my witness, I was guided to view this awesome movie yesterday. Even though I was looking for a movie for distraction, I was compelled to watch this extraordinarily crafted movie yesterday. It fell in line perfectly with the personal spiritual search I've been on lately. During the time I watched, answer after answer to so many questions came to me. I'm still astounded.

Watch this, please, with an open mind.
column3:
Ọlọ́run ti pè mí .......
Bí òun ti jẹ́ ẹlẹ́rìí mi, mo ní ìdarí láti wo sinimá ńlá yìí lánàá. Pàápàá bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé mò ń wá fíìmù kan tí yóò sí ọkàn mi sí ibòmíràn, a fi agbára mú mi láti wo fíìmù aláìlégbẹ́ tí wọ́n fi ọ̀nà àrà ṣe ní àná. O bọ́ sí ilà ní pípé pẹ̀lú wíwá ti ara ẹni ti ẹ̀mí tí mo ti wà láìpẹ́. Ní àkókò tí mo wòó , ìdáhùn lẹ́hìn ìdáhùn sí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ìbéèrè wá sí mi. Mo sì wádìí nínú ìyàlẹ́nu .
 
Wo èyí, jọ̀wọ́ , pẹ̀lú ọkàn tí ó ṣí.
column4:
Olorun pe mi.......
Bi Oun ti jẹ ẹlẹri mi, a ṣe itọsọna mi lati wo fiimu oniyi ni ana. Paapaa botilẹjẹpe Mo n wa fiimu kan fun idalọwọduro, Mo ti fipa mu mi lati wo fiimu ti a ṣe iyalẹnu ni ana. O ṣubu ni ila ni pipe pẹlu wiwa ti ara ẹni ti ẹmi ti Mo ti wa laipẹ. Ni akoko ti Mo wo, idahun lẹhin idahun si ọpọlọpọ awọn ibeere wa si mi. Mo tun jẹ iyalẹnu.

Jowo, wo eyi pẹlu ọkan ti o ṣi silẹ.

column2: Gem of a documentary, educational, hilarious, heartfelt, basically an emotional rollercoaster.
column3: Iṣẹ́ ìtàn tí ó ṣọ̀wọ́n tí ó ní ẹ̀kọ́, ó pani lẹ́ẹ̀rín, ó tọ́ ni lọ́kàn, ó nííṣe pẹ̀lú ìmọ̀lára.
column4: Tiodaralopolopo ti iwe itan kan, ẹkọ, panilerin, ọkan-ọkan, ni ipilẹ rollercoaster ẹdun kan.

column2: The portrait of life that emerges organically from this understated, observant approach makes Eyimofe the rare social realist drama that conveys critique without didacticism and empathy without pity.
column3: Àwòrán ti ìgbésí ayé tí ó farahàn ní ti ara láti inú àìisọyí, ọ̀nà àkíyèsí yìí jẹ́ kí Èyímofẹ́ jẹ́ eré ìṣeré gidi ti àwùjọ tí ó ṣọ̀wọ́n tí ó ṣe alárìíwísí láìsí ìtara láìsí àánú
column4: Aworan ti igbesi aye ti o farahan ni ti ara lati inu aisọye, ọna akiyesi yii jẹ ki Eyimofe jẹ ere iṣere gidi ti awujọ ti o ṣọwọn ti o ṣe alariwisi laisi didacticism ati itara laisi aanu.

column2: Through an economy of exposition, Eyimofe, (translated as “This is My Desire”) delivers a timeless, universal portrait of human resilience while establishing Arie and Chuko as a welcome new addition to the filmmaking brood.
column3: Nípasẹ̀ ọrọ̀ -ajé ti ìṣà fihàn, Èyímofẹ́, (tí a túmọ̀ sí “Èyí ni Ìfẹ́ Mi”) ṣe àfihàn àílákókò, àwòrán àgbáyé ti ìfarabalẹ̀ ènìyàn lákòókò tí ó ṣe ìdásílẹ̀ Arie ati Chuko gẹ́gẹ́bí ọìtẹ́wẹ́gbà tuntun  sí ṣíṣe fíìmù.
column4: Nipasẹ ọrọ-aje ti iṣafihan, Eyimofe, (ti a tumọ si “Eyi ni Ifẹ Mi”) n funni ni ailakoko, aworan agbaye ti ifarabalẹ ti eniyan lakoko ti o ṣe idasile Arie ati Chuko gẹgẹbi itẹwọgba tuntun tuntun si ọmọ fiimu.

column2:
Colorful and detailing but thrilling isn't the word

column4:
Awọ ati alaye ṣugbọn iyanilẹnu kii ṣe ọrọ naa

column2: Simply relating the narrative of Andrew Dosunmu’s seductive immigrant drama Mother of George would do little to convey the film’s stark, poetic power, much less its extraordinary visual and sonic acumen.
column3: Nìkan jọmọ itan-akọọlẹ ti eré aṣikiri aṣikiri ti Andrew Dosunmu Iya ti George yoo ṣe diẹ sii lati ṣe afihan agbara fiimu naa, agbara ewi, o kere pupọ ni wiwo iyalẹnu.
column4: Nìkan jọmọ itan-akọọlẹ ti eré aṣikiri aṣikiri ti Andrew Dosunmu Iya ti George yoo ṣe diẹ sii lati ṣe afihan agbara fiimu naa, agbara ewi, o kere pupọ ni wiwo iyalẹnu ati acumen sonic.

column2: As Adenike, Gurira is wonderful: Her face is equally radiant whether she's channeling anguish or joy, and she captures the ways in which this woman, so old-country dutiful, also longs to join the modern world.
column3: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Adenike, Gurira jẹ́ ohun àgbàyanu: Bákan náà ni ojú rẹ̀ ń dán yálà ó ń ṣe àfihàn ìdààmú tàbí ayọ̀, ó sì mú àwọn ọ̀nà tí obìnrin yìí, tí ó jẹ́ arúgbó tí ń ṣe ojúṣe, tún fẹ́ darapọ̀ mọ́ ayé òde òní.
column4: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Adenike, Gurira jẹ́ ohun àgbàyanu: Bákan náà ni ojú rẹ̀ ń dán yálà ó ń ṣàánú ìdààmú tàbí ayọ̀, ó sì mú àwọn ọ̀nà tí obìnrin yìí, tí ó jẹ́ arúgbó ti ń ṣe ojúṣe, tún fẹ́ darapọ̀ mọ́ ayé òde òní.

column2: The most visually arresting drama of 2013, and certainly one of the year’s best films.
column3: Eré wíwò tí ó fani mọ́ra jùlọ ti 2013, àti dájúdájú ọkan ninu awọn fiimu ti o dara julọ ti ọdun.
column4: Ere imudani wiwo julọ ti 2013, ati dajudaju ọkan ninu awọn fiimu ti o dara julọ ti ọdun.

column2: This is not a fable of assimilation or alienation, but rather the keenly observed story of two people seeking guidance in painful and complicated circumstances.

column4: Eyi kii ṣe itan-itan ti isọpọ tabi iyasọtọ, ṣugbọn dipo itan-akọọlẹ ti a ṣe akiyesi ti eniyan meji ti n wa itọsọna ni awọn ipo irora ati idiju.

column2: I started the movie expecting it to be interestingly amateurish as have been some movies I have seen from that part of the world. But as the movie progressed, I realized it did not suffer in production values at all; in fact, it was superior in some ways to anything I have seen coming out of the West lately.
column3: Mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ fíìmù náà ní ìrètí pé yóò jẹ́ èyí tí kò gbéwọ̀n bí ó ti jẹ́ díẹ̀ nínú àwọn fíìmù tí mo ti rí láti apá kan yẹn ní àgbáyé. Ṣùgbọ́n bí fíìmù náà tí ń lọ síwájú, mo rii pé kò jìyà nínú àwọn iye ìgbé sini á jáde rárá; ní pàtó, ó peléke ní àwọn ọ̀nà sí ohunkóhun tí mo ti rí tó jáde láti  apá ìwọ̀-oòrùn láìpẹ́.
column4: Mo bẹrẹ fiimu naa ni ireti pe yoo jẹ amateurish ti o yanilenu bi o ti jẹ diẹ ninu awọn fiimu ti Mo ti rii lati apakan yẹn ni agbaye. Ṣugbọn bi fiimu naa ti nlọsiwaju, Mo rii pe ko jiya ninu awọn iye iṣelọpọ rara; ni pato, o je superior ni diẹ ninu awọn ọna si ohunkohun ti mo ti ri bọ jade ti awọn West laipẹ.

column2:
Expository Movie

This is a very good and distinct movie. Some people might not like it perhaps because they are used to the love or thriller story films or perhaps because they are not used to life with a vehicle. They movie truly shows how things really are in the life of mechanics, apprentices and customers. It also teachers parents and children a good lesson. It is a seemingly perfect expository movie.
column3:
Eré tó n ṣí ní lójú
 
Eré yi dára gan o sì tún dáa yàtọ.̀
Àwọn èlòmíràn léè má feran eré náà bóyá torí wọn ti má feran eré èfè àti eré ẹrù tàbí ayé pẹlú ọkọ kotii mọ́ wọn lára. Eré na fihàn bi ayé atún ọkọ̀ se, ọmọ ikọse àti àwọn oníbara. Ósì tún kọ́ àwọn òbí àti àwọn ọmọ ní èkó. O jẹ́ eré tí o máa ṣí ní lójú.
column4:
Fiimu Afihan

Eyi jẹ fiimu ti o dara pupọ ati pato. Diẹ ninu awọn eniyan le ma fẹran rẹ boya nitori pe wọn ti lo si ifẹ tabi fiimu itan-akọọlẹ tabi boya nitori wọn ko lo si igbesi aye pẹlu ọkọ. Wọn fiimu nitootọ fihan bi awọn nkan ṣe wa gaan ni igbesi aye awọn oye, awọn oṣiṣẹ ikẹkọ ati awọn alabara. O tun kọ awọn obi ati awọn ọmọ ẹkọ ti o dara. O jẹ fiimu ti o dabi ẹnipe pipe.

The story, although not phenomenal, is good enough to keep you glued to your seat while imparting a thing or two about the subject matter.
column3: Eré tí ó ní ètò ní ó jẹ́, ó sì kún fún àwọn òṣeré tí wọ́n mọ iṣẹ wọn ṣe. Wọ́n gbé eré yí jáde pẹ̀lú ìmọ tó dánkiá  nínú ètò ati ìdarí eré sinimá. Ìtàn inú eré, bó tí lẹ jẹ́ wípé kín ṣe pé ó dáa gán nà, sùgbón wọ́n gbìyànjú láti lè mú kí àwọn èèyàn jókòó tí eré náà.
column4: O jẹ fiimu ti o ni ilọsiwaju daradara, ti o kun pẹlu awọn ohun kikọ ẹran-ara daradara ti n ṣiṣẹ ni eto idite ti ko ṣubu yato si. Filimu na. ti wa ni mu o aye pẹlu kan yanilenu darapupo ati ki o masterful cinematography. Itan naa, botilẹjẹpe kii ṣe iyalẹnu, dara to lati jẹ ki o lẹ pọ si ijoko rẹ lakoko fifun ohun kan tabi meji nipa koko-ọrọ naa.

column2:
Good film

With a small budget this film deserve a very good critic.Finally a film with a gay theme without a tragedy. One moving story, with good actors.I recognize problems with edition, and other small Technics problems.But who care about this, when we see a film so full of truth and tenderness??? Sometimes I ask me why films about gay man are sad,dramatic? Why can we have a film with gay thematic without hope? Some scenes for me were really sublime. The story is very sensitive, principally because the plot is about black, gay and poor people. I would like to see more films like this: simple, direct, full of truth, one real story.This story can happen.
column3:
Eré yìí dára gan
 
Pẹlú owó diẹ eré yìí ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí ìgbéyàwó tó dára. Paríparí rẹ̀ eré orí ìtàgé tí kò ní ṣe pẹlú ìbànújẹ bi kò se fún ayọ àti ẹrín. Eré kan, pẹlu osere tó dára. Mo rí i pé àtúntò kúù díẹ̀ káàtó àti àwọn ìṣòro díẹ̀
Nígbà tí a bá eré tó kún fún òtítọ àti iṣootọ? Mo má n'bi ara mi pé kilode tí àwọn eré orí ìtàgé tó sọ nípa aláwọ̀ dúdú má kún fún ìbànújẹ. Kílódé tí a kò fín ní àwọn eré orí ìtàgé ti aláwò dúdú.
column4:
Fiimu to dara

Pẹlu isuna kekere kan fiimu yi yẹ alariwisi ti o dara pupọ. Nikẹhin fiimu kan pẹlu akori onibaje laisi ajalu kan. Ọkan itan gbigbe, pẹlu awọn oṣere ti o dara.Mo mọ awọn iṣoro pẹlu àtúnse, ati awọn iṣoro Technics kekere miiran.Ṣugbọn tani o bikita nipa eyi, nigba ti a ba rii fiimu kan ti o kun fun otitọ ati tutu ??? Nigba miiran Mo beere lọwọ mi idi ti awọn fiimu nipa ọkunrin onibaje jẹ ibanujẹ, iyalẹnu? Kini idi ti a le ni fiimu kan pẹlu akori onibaje laisi ireti? Diẹ ninu awọn oju iṣẹlẹ fun mi jẹ giga gaan. Itan naa jẹ ifarabalẹ pupọ, ni akọkọ nitori idite naa jẹ nipa dudu, onibaje ati eniyan talaka. Emi yoo fẹ lati wo awọn fiimu diẹ sii bi eleyi: rọrun, taara, ti o kun fun otitọ, itan-itan gidi kan.Itan yii le ṣẹlẹ.

column2:
On the 1st of August, a graduation party brings more than anyone expected.

The film is a suburban drama that examines how a family manages to survive its past, and how that past is inextricably entwined with their future. 

During a graduation party, the estranged father, Dipo, returns. Each family member deals with his return differently, and thus we see how they must have survived his initial departure. As we learn the reasons for his departure and the reasons for his return, our sympathies shift.

The film is well acted and the story unfolds itself smoothly and naturally, without resorting to exposition. It is refreshing to see a dramatic film about African Americans that veers from stereotypes.
column3:
Ní ọjọ́ kini oṣù kẹjọ, ayẹyẹ Ijade mú ká rí ọpọlọpọ àwọn ènìyàn ju ẹyẹ àwọn ẹni ta n'reti lọ.
 
Eré orí ìtàgé yìí jẹ eré tó sọ nípa bí àwọn ènìyàn tó ngbé ní àwọn ìlú tó lajú diẹ ṣe ngbiyanju láti lè bọ́ lọwọ ìgbé ayé wọn tí tẹlẹ àti bí gbé ayé wọn tẹlẹ ní ṣe pẹlu ọjọ ọla wọn.
 
Níbi ayẹyẹ Ijade ile ìwé, baba dipo padà. Gbogbo àwọn ará mọlẹbi nìí oníkálukú bí òun o ṣe dá sí ìpàdé bọ rẹ. Sugbon àwọn tó tí rí tẹlẹ gbọdọ tí borí ìgbà tó fí kọ́kọ́ kúrò àti ìdí tí ọ fi tún padà wá ikẹdun wà tí sún kúrò.
 
Àwọn òṣèré tó ya eré orí ìtàgé náà gbìyànjú àti pé ìtàn inú eré na kò tú sí ìta bikòṣe nipa ará rẹ. Òun tó nwụni lórí ní
column4:
Ni ọjọ 1st ti Oṣu Kẹjọ, ayẹyẹ ayẹyẹ ipari ẹkọ n mu diẹ sii ju ẹnikẹni ti o nireti lọ.

Fíìmù náà jẹ́ eré ìgbèríko kan tó ń ṣàyẹ̀wò bí ìdílé kan ṣe ń yè bọ́ sẹ́yìn rẹ̀, àti bí ìgbà tí wọ́n ti kọjá ṣe máa ń bá ọjọ́ ọ̀la wọn yọ.

Lakoko ayẹyẹ ayẹyẹ ipari ẹkọ kan, baba ti o yapa, Dipo, pada. Ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ni mẹ́ńbà ìdílé kọ̀ọ̀kan fi ń bá ìpadàbọ̀ rẹ̀ lò, nítorí náà a rí bí wọ́n ṣe lè la ìjádelọ rẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́ já. Bí a ti ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ àwọn ìdí tí ó fi lọ àti àwọn ìdí fún ìpadàbọ̀ rẹ̀, ìbákẹ́dùn wa yí padà.

Fiimu naa ṣe daradara ati pe itan naa ṣafihan funrararẹ laisiyonu ati nipa ti ara, laisi lilo si iṣafihan. O jẹ onitura lati wo fiimu iyalẹnu kan nipa awọn ọmọ Amẹrika Amẹrika ti o yapa kuro ninu awọn aiṣedeede.

column2:
Good movie

Both Okon and Bona are excited about the opportunities in London and are quickly shown the racist and selfish realities of living there. Though both are educated and came for educational enrichment, they are exploited and thrust into homelessness, even betrayed by fellow Nigerians living in London. Luckily Bona meets with some compassionate folks who help him and provide shelter, food and companionship. He is also able to help Okon when they happen upon each other in the city. Glad the ending had one of them going back with the goal of enriching and giving back to his homeland.
column3:
Eré tó yí dára
Okon pẹlú bona dùn inú fún afani ní ilé ọba asi fi ikorira ẹyà ati imotara ẹni nìkan tí ọ gbilẹ ní ilé ọba.
Bó tilẹ jẹ pé wọn jẹ ọmọiwé ati pẹlu pé wọn wá láti ilé ọmọwé. Wọn sọ wọn di aláìní lè lórí, awọn ará wọn láti Naijiria  tó wà ní ìlú ọba tún dàlè wọn. B'ọna pàdé àwọn alaanu ènìyàn tó ràn lọwọ tó sì pèsè oúnjẹ, ilé àti olubadamoran. O sii rán okon lọwọ na. Inú mí dùn pé òkan nínú wọn padà ló dá ìlú rè lọ́lá
column4:
fiimu ti o dara

Mejeeji Okon ati Bona ni inudidun nipa awọn aye ni Ilu Lọndọnu ati pe wọn yarayara han awọn ododo ẹlẹyamẹya ati amotaraeninikan ti gbigbe nibẹ. Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn méjèèjì ti kàwé tí wọ́n sì wá fún ìmúgbòòrò ẹ̀kọ́, wọ́n ń jẹ wọ́n níjà, tí wọ́n sì fi wọ́n sínú àìlégbé, kódà àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà ẹlẹgbẹ́ wọn tí wọ́n ń gbé ní Lọndọnu pàápàá ti dà wọ́n. Ni Oriire Bona pade pẹlu diẹ ninu awọn eniyan alaanu ti o ṣe iranlọwọ fun u ati pese ibi aabo, ounjẹ ati ajọṣepọ. O tun le ran Okon lọwọ nigbati wọn ba ṣẹlẹ si ara wọn ni ilu naa. Idunnu ipari ni ọkan ninu wọn pada pẹlu ibi-afẹde ti imudara ati fifunni pada si ilẹ-ile rẹ.

column3: Inú mi dùn lẹ́yìn tí mo wo fíìmù náà, ohun gbogbo lọ bó se yẹ kó lọ. àwọn Olùdarí àti atùkọ̀eré yí mú inú mí dùn gan. Olùdarí, Kémi Adétiba ṣe gudugudu méje yàyà mẹfà, inú mi dùn sí i. Mo ti gba àwọn èèyàn láti wo sinima yìí. Mo n'ireti láti wo àwọn sinima tí Kémi adétiba máa tún darí.
column4: Inu mi dun lẹhin wiwo fiimu naa, ohun gbogbo wa lori aaye. Mo ti wà paapa impressed pẹlu awọn didara ti awọn simẹnti ati atuko. Oludari, Kemi Adetiba ṣe iṣẹ nla kan, inu mi dun si i. Mo ti ṣeduro rẹ si ọpọlọpọ eniyan. Mo nireti lati wo diẹ sii ti iṣẹ rẹ.

column2: Great continuity throughout the movie... The writer and director is highly intelligent and creative. Thank you so much for this amazing movie
column3: Ìtèsíwájú eré nlá ní. Olùkòtàn àti Olùdarí eré yìí ní ọpọlọ. Ẹsé gan fún eré nlá yìí.
column4: Ilọsiwaju nla jakejado fiimu naa… Onkọwe ati oludari jẹ oye pupọ ati ẹda. O ṣeun pupọ fun fiimu iyanu yii

column2: All I can say is that this movie is my movie of the year!

column2: Hands down the best Nigerian movie I have ever seen..

column2:
Ms Adetibe assuaged a thirst I had always longed for: Nigeria in all its realness. Politics, religion, poverty, wealth, God-fatherism, entitlement mentality, corruption and then HOPE. Nollywood
It could be done and She did it! A  movie worthy of export!

This is Nigeria!!
column3:
Omidan Adétiba ṣe oun tí mo fẹràn tí mo ṣì n'tí ńpòǹgbe fún látọjọ́ pípé. Òṣèlú, ẹsìn, ìsẹ́, ọrọ̀, bàbá isalẹ, ìbàjẹ́ ati ìrètí. Ọ́ ṣée ṣe, ó sì ti sé. Eré tí a lè gbé r'okè òkun.
 
Orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà Nìyí
column4:
Arabinrin Adetibe ni idaniloju ongbẹ ti Mo ti nfẹ nigbagbogbo: Naijiria ni otitọ rẹ. Iselu, ẹsin, osi, ọrọ, Ọlọrun-baba, lakaye ẹtọ, ibajẹ ati lẹhinna IRETI. Nollywood
O le ṣee ṣe ati pe O ṣe! A movie yẹ ti okeere!

Nàìjíríà nìyí!!

column2: Oh my God!!! I had to pause KOB to write to this comment. You're such a wonderful writer. The movie is a mind blowing one and eye opener. Mo
column3: Ọlọ́rùn-un mi ò !!! Mo ní látí dá KOB dúró láti sọ nípa eré orí ìtàgé yí. Olùkọ ìtàn tó Mọ́ṣẹ ni ọ́. Eré náà wú ní lórí ósii sí ní lójú.
column4: Oluwa mi o!!! Mo ni lati da duro KOB lati kọ si asọye yii. O jẹ onkọwe iyanu bẹ. Fiimu jẹ ọkan fifun ọkan ati ṣiṣi oju. Mo

column2: Kemi Adetiba's King of Boys is exceptional. From the selection of cast to the well executed story line, this movie is nothing short of excellent. The thrill, plot twists, humor, unpredictability are unmatched.
column3: Kémi àdetibà King Of Boys kọjá àdému ròyìn. Lat'ori yíyan àwọn òṣeré títí tó fí dé ṣíṣe ìtàn inú eré orí ìtàgé yìí. Eré orí ìtàgé yìí dára gan ní gbogbo ètò bí wọn ṣe ṣẹ o múná dóko.
column4: Ọba ti Awọn ọmọkunrin Kemi Adetiba jẹ alailẹgbẹ. Lati yiyan ti simẹnti si awọn daradara executed itan laini, yi movie ni ohunkohun kukuru ti o tayọ. Idunnu naa, awọn iyipo idite, awada, airotẹlẹ ko ni ibamu.

column2: 100% on point. So accurate n so well played. Everyone was fantastic. Makes one proud ure Nigerian 👏👍😘
column3: Eré orí ìtàgé yìí dára gan-an. Kòsí àbàwọ́n kankan bóti wù kó mọ. Gbogbo ènìyàn tó lọ́wọ́ sì fíìmù yìí gbìyànjú gan. Wọ́n sì mú orí mí wú pé orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà tèsíwájú nínú eré oríìtàgé
column4: 100% lori aaye. Nitorina deede n bẹ daradara dun. Gbogbo eniyan je ikọja. Ṣe ọkan igberaga ure Nigerian 👏👍😘

column2: Every scene carried the viewer along seamlessly. As one who does understand any language besides English,I highly recommend this movie and best of all its a movie you can watch again and again.
column3: Ko sí ipele kan nínu eré orí ìtàgé tíì àwọn olùwo eré yìí kò b'áwọn lọ. Fún ẹni ti kò bá mọ ju èdè gẹ̀ẹ́sì lọ, e wo eré yìí, eré orí ìtàgé tí ẹ máa wò lẹ́ẹ̀kansi ni.
column4: Gbogbo ipele ti gbe oluwo naa lọ lainidi. Gẹgẹbi ọkan ti o loye eyikeyi ede ni afikun si Gẹẹsi, Mo ṣeduro fiimu yii gaan ati dara julọ ti gbogbo fiimu ti o le wo lẹẹkansi ati lẹẹkansi.

column2:
Great movie. Enjoyed every seconds of it
An interesting story line and a big kudos to all the cast and crew of king of boys, thank you for this awesome movie.
column3:
Fíìmù ńlá. Mo Gbádùn  gbogbo àkókò tí mo fi wo eré náà.
 ìtàn tí ọ ládùn ní àti pé mo gbóríyìn fún gbogbo àwọn òṣèré àti àwọn àtùkọ̀ tí ọ lọwọ sí King of boys, ẹ ṣe fún eré orí ìtàgé  yìí.
column4:
fiimu nla. Gbadun ni gbogbo iṣẹju-aaya ti rẹ
Laini itan ti o nifẹ ati kudos nla si gbogbo awọn oṣere ati awọn atukọ ti ọba awọn ọmọkunrin, o ṣeun fun fiimu oniyi yii.

column2:
Brilliant acting! Thrilling story
I have watched this movie 3 times now and was not bored for once. Storytelling couldn't be more apt. Acting was so professionally done. A political story told in an interesting way. Trust me on this, u will love it. A must watch by all means!
column3:
Iṣẹ́ tó pegedé ni àwọn òṣèré inú Eré ṣe! Itan náà làrinrin
Mo ti wo fíìmù yìí ní ìgbà mẹta báyìí  kò sì súnmi fún ẹ̀ẹ̀kan soso. Sísọ ìtàn kò le dáa jù báyìí lọ. Àwọn Òṣèré gbìyànjú gan-an. wọ́n sọ Ìtàn ní́pa àwọn olóṣèlú  ni ọnà tí yóò wuni lati tún wò. Mo fí dá ẹ lójú pé wàá fẹràn eré orí ìtàgé yìí. Àgbọdọ̀ wò ni gbogbo àwọn ọ̀nà ni eré orí ìtàgé yìí!
column4:
O wu osere! Itan alarinrin
Mo ti wo fiimu yii ni igba mẹta ni bayi ati pe ko sunmi fun ẹẹkan. Itan-akọọlẹ ko le ṣe deede diẹ sii. Oṣere ti a ṣe ni alamọdaju. Itan oloselu kan sọ ni ọna ti o nifẹ. Gbekele mi lori eyi, iwọ yoo nifẹ rẹ. A gbọdọ wo ni gbogbo awọn ọna!

column2: KOB is Number 1 Nollywood movie to me right now. The story is way different and genuine. Unveils what goes on in politics for real.
column3: KOB ni ó gbégbá orókè jù fún èmí laarin àwọn eré orí ìtàgé tó kù lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ yìí. Eré náà fí bí òṣèlú ṣe rí lójú ayé ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.
column4: KOB ni Nollywood movie Nollywood fun mi ni bayi. Itan naa yatọ ni ọna ati otitọ. Ṣiṣafihan ohun ti n lọ ninu iṣelu fun gidi.

column2:
The character is bold and over the top as she should be, but Ms. Adetiba knows how to operate with directorial constraint. Kudos!
I will recommend it highly to all whom I know.

column4:
Iwa naa jẹ igboya ati lori oke bi o ṣe yẹ, ṣugbọn Arabinrin Adetiba mọ bi o ṣe le ṣiṣẹ pẹlu idiwọ itọsọna. O ṣeun!
Emi yoo ṣeduro rẹ gaan si gbogbo awọn ti Mo mọ.
