column2:
A Major Step in taking back our narrative

This movie, has really showed a deep side of the struggles of the people we often ignore. Easy to see a person to judge, but when stories like these are told you start to look at everyone with a different lens. The ending, though abrupt keeps you in a limbo and holds you in a powerful suspense pondering on what you just witnessed.
column3:
Igbese tó lakaaki láti ṣe ipepada ìṣe àti ìtàn wá.
 
Sinima àgbéléwò yìí safihan kirakita àwọn ènìyàn tí a máa ń yìn nù. Ó rọrùn láti gbé sí orí ìwọ̀n àmọ́, nígbà tí irú ìtàn yìí bá jẹyọ ojú ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ni a fi máa wo oníkálukú. Looto, ní ìgbẹ̀yìn, aisedeede fi o hàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí alaimokan, yóò si gbé ọ gesin aáyán lórí ohun tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ṣojú rẹ
column4:
“Igbese pataki kan ni gbigbe itan-akọọlẹ wa pada

Fiimu yii, ti fihan gaan ni ẹgbẹ ti o jinlẹ ti awọn ija ti awọn eniyan ti a foju foju parẹ nigbagbogbo. Rọrun lati rii eniyan lati ṣe idajọ, ṣugbọn nigbati awọn itan bii iwọnyi ba sọ ọ bẹrẹ lati wo gbogbo eniyan pẹlu lẹnsi oriṣiriṣi. Ipari naa, botilẹjẹpe airotẹlẹ jẹ ki o wa ni limbo kan ati pe o mu ọ ni ifura ti o lagbara ni ironu lori ohun ti o ṣẹṣẹ jẹri.”

column2: A true story of Human trafficking. This is told just as it is. Wow. Why is this movie rated 5? It's a 10/10. This is excellent. Oluture is just perfect. Terrific! Awesome
column3: Ìtàn gidi lórí ifeniyan ṣòwò. Bí ó ṣe rí gan-an ni a ṣe sọ ọ. A dúpẹ́. Kí nìdí tí sinima àgbéléwò yìí ṣe gba ipò karùn-ún lórí osunwon? Mẹ́wàá lórí mẹ́wàá ló jẹ́. Èyí dára púpọ̀. Regi ni Oluture sáà ṣe. Ó lágbára! Ó níyì.
column4: Itan otitọ ti gbigbe kakiri eniyan. Eyi ni a sọ gẹgẹ bi o ti jẹ. Iro ohun. Kini idi ti fiimu yii jẹ 5? O jẹ ọjọ 10/10 kan. Eleyi jẹ o tayọ. Oluture ni o kan pipe. Ẹru! Oniyi

column2:
A true and daring eye to human trafficking

This is my 3rd Nollywood movie and I am shocked. Really true, disturbing, unsettling. Some people are writting comments about the ending the cinematography etc, what did you expect? These real life subjects do not have a happy ending and no script. If you wish to see something easy and comforting you should look somewhere else.....
column3:
Ojú òtítọ́ àti ìfọkànsìn sí ifeniyan ṣòwò 
 
Èyí ni sinima àgbéléwò eleeketa tí mo ṣe tí mo sì páyà ni aajo Nollywood. Òtítọ́ ni, ó nini lára, kò sí ìsinmi. Àwọn ènìyàn kan ń sọ̀rọ̀ sí ifopinba imo ṣíṣe sinima àgbéléwò àti bẹẹ bẹẹ lọ. Kí ni ohun tí o báà ṣẹlẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀? Àwọn àkòrí ibayemu wọ̀nyí kìí parí síbi tó dùn, wọn kò sì ń ní ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀dá ìtàn gidi. Bí ó bá fẹ́ rí ohun tí ó rọrùn tí ó sì ní ifayabale, ó yẹ kí o wáa sí ibòmíràn.
column4:
“Oju otitọ ati igboya si gbigbe kakiri eniyan

Eyi ni fiimu Nollywood mi 3, o jẹ iyalẹnu. Lootọ ni otitọ, idamu, aibalẹ. Diẹ ninu awọn eniyan n kọ awọn asọye nipa ipari sinimatography ati bẹbẹ lọ, kini o nireti? Awọn koko-ọrọ igbesi aye gidi wọnyi ko ni ipari idunnu ati pe ko si iwe afọwọkọ. Ti o ba fẹ lati rii nkan ti o rọrun ati itunu o yẹ ki o wo ibomiran……”

column2:
Much needed story on human trafficking

Oloture is an excellent movie that provides a much needed view into human trafficking in Nigeria. Its graphic point of view shots really put you in the seat of women being trafficked.
column3:
Òpò ìtàn tó wúlò lórí ifeniyan ṣòwò
 
Ogbontarigi sinima àgbéléwò to pèsè àfihàn tó loorin lórí ifeniyan ṣòwò ni ni orílẹ̀ èdè Nigeria ni Oloture. Ìwòye àwòrán rẹ gbé ẹ sí ipò obìnrin tí ó sagbako wàhálà ifeniyan ṣòwò
column4:
“Ọpọlọpọ itan ti o nilo lori gbigbe kakiri eniyan

Oloture jẹ fiimu ti o tayọ ti o pese wiwo ti o nilo pupọ si gbigbe kakiri eniyan ni Nigeria. Oju-iwo wiwo ayaworan rẹ gaan fi ọ si ijoko awọn obinrin ti wọn n tawo.”

column2:
Brilliant !

Oloture is raw and pure art ... excellent production excellent acting by the entire cast Sharon Ooja was simply amazing . Oloture is a must watch
column3:
Làákàyè!
 
Oloture jẹ imo ẹ̀dá ènìyàn àti àwùjọ tí kò labawon…. Igbejade àti ìṣeré tó tayọ tí gbogbo àwọn onsere Sharon Ooja pata ni wọn múnú ẹni dùn. Kò ṣeé má wò ní Oloture.
column4:
"O wuyi!

Oloture is raw and pure art ... excellent production excellent acting by the entire cast Sharon Ooja was simply amazing. Oloture is a must watch"

column2:
A Modern Nigerian Classic


Nollywood truly has a political/religious/tribal gem here for those who seek to broaden their perceptions of the whys of the major ills of the world & in this case a small community in Nigeria - r so pervasive today.

Soul comes to this physical reality for experiences & this film delivers a ton of them❤
column3:
Ọmọ Nigeria ìgbàlódé aláìlẹ́gbẹ́
 
Aájò oni sinima àgbéléwò ti Nollywood ni tòótọ́ ìwà òṣèlú, ẹṣin àti ẹ̀yà nigbonni yìí, fún àwọn tó bá fẹ́ fikún òye wọn nípa ìdí tí a fi ni àwọn òkè ńláńlá lagbaye. Nípa báyìí, àwọn ìletò kereje ni orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tí farahàn lónìí.
 
Ẹ̀mí ọkàn fara hàn nínú ojutaye nítorí orisirisi ìrírí, ìpín kan lára nǹkan wọ̀nyí ni sinima àgbéléwò yìí gbé síta.
column4:
“Ayebaye Nigerian Modern


Nollywood nitootọ ni olowoiyebiye iṣelu/ẹsin/ẹya kan nibi fun awọn ti o n wa lati mu awọn iwoye wọn gbooro si idi ti awọn aarun nla ti agbaye & ninu ọran yii agbegbe kekere kan ni Nigeria - ti o tan kaakiri loni.

Ọkàn wa si otitọ ti ara yii fun awọn iriri ati fiimu yii n pese pupọ ninu wọn❤"

column2:
Perfection

This is a must watch movie!. I can't even say more. I'm short of words.
column3:
Pípé
 
Kòṣemawo ni sinima àgbéléwò yìí!. N ò tiẹ̀ lè sọ púpọ̀. Ọ̀rọ̀ tán lẹ́nu.
column4:
"Pipe

Eleyi jẹ a gbọdọ wo movie!. Emi ko le paapaa sọ diẹ sii. Ọrọ kukuru ni mi."

column2:
A must watch for younger Nigerians and general lovers of a good film.
I will be looking out for more work by Kunle Afolayan. Well done!!!
column3:
Kòṣemawo ni fún àwọn ọdọ Nàìjíríà àti àwọn olólùfẹ́ sinima gidi
Maa fojú sọ́nà fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ isẹ mìíràn láti owó Kunle Afolayan. Ẹ kú iṣẹ́.
column4:
“A gbọdọ wo fun awọn ọdọ Naijiria ati awọn ololufẹ gbogbogbo ti fiimu to dara.
Emi yoo ma wa iṣẹ diẹ sii nipasẹ Kunle Afolayan. Kú isé!!!"

column2: Compelling and captivating! Beautiful colors and powerful performances. Camera angles invite you into every scene till the very end. Bravo for first shot!
column3: Ọranyan àti imunilara! Àwọn àwọ̀ tó rẹwà àti imura tó lágbára. Igun àwòrán pé o sí abala kọ̀ọ̀kan títí di ìparí. Ó kuomoose fún yíyà àkọ́kọ́!
column4: Apaniyan ati ki o captivating! Awọn awọ lẹwa ati awọn iṣẹ ṣiṣe ti o lagbara. Awọn igun kamẹra pe ọ sinu gbogbo iṣẹlẹ titi di opin pupọ. Bravo fun igba akọkọ shot!

column2:
One of the best nollywood movie

I really enjoyed the movie, i now know why it's is considered as the first ground breaking nollywood movie
column3:
ọkàn lára sinima àgbéléwò Nollywood tí ó dára jù.
 
Mo gbádùn sinima àgbéléwò náà púpọ̀, mo ti wá mọ ìdí tí a fi tọ́ka sí gẹ́gẹ́ bí sinima àgbéléwò Nollywood tó lamilaaka jùlọ.
column4:
"Ọkan ninu fiimu Nollywood ti o dara julọ

Mo gbadun fiimu naa gaan, Mo ti mọ idi ti wọn fi gba pe o jẹ ilẹ akọkọ ti o fọ fiimu nollywood”

column2:
Seminal Movie in Nigerian Cinematic History

Living in Bondage the film that marked the start of Nollywood. It is a story of love, betrayal, suffering and redemption. I walked out of the theater strong in faith. And faith in Nigeria is what I have now.
column3:
Ìpàdé sinima àgbéléwò nínú ìtàn gbígbé sinima jáde lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.
 
Living in Bondage’, sinima tó sàmì ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ aajo ṣíṣe sinima ti Nollywood. Ó jẹ́ ìtàn nípa ìfẹ́, ẹtan, ìnira, àti ìràpadà. Mo jáde nínú eré ìtàgé náà gẹ́gẹ́ bí onigbagbọ tó gbọn-gbọ́n. Ìgbàgbọ́ nínú Nàìjíríà sì ni ohun tí mo ní báyìí.
column4:
Fiimu Seminal ni Itan Cinematic Nigeria

Ngbe ni igbekun fiimu ti o samisi ibẹrẹ Nollywood. O ti wa ni a itan ti ife, betrayal, ijiya ati irapada. Mo ti jade kuro ni tiata ni agbara ni igbagbọ. Ati igbagbo ninu Nigeria ni ohun ti mo ni bayi.

column2:
Really Good Movie
This is probably the best Nigerian movie I've ever seen. Definitely a class above your usual light Nollywood stuff. Characters and plot were well developed and realistic. Noah and Dominic were really great in their acting.
column3:
Sinima tó dára tòótọ́.
 
Èyí gan-an ni sinima àgbéléwò aajo Nollywood tí ó dára jù tí mo ti wo. Ju gbogbo ẹ lọ, eka ijoba kan tó tayọ nǹkan Nollywood tẹ́lẹ̀. Àwọn onsere àti ààtò inú rẹ̀ rí idagbasoke àti òtítọ́. Noah àti Dominic ṣe dáadáa nínú ìṣeré wọn.
column4:
Fiimu ti o dara gaan
Boya eleyi ni fiimu Naijiria to dara julọ ti Mo ti rii tẹlẹ. Ni pato kilasi kan loke awọn nkan Nollywood ina rẹ deede. Awọn kikọ ati Idite ti ni idagbasoke daradara ati ojulowo. Noah ati Dominic jẹ nla gaan ni iṣe wọn. ”

column2:
Absolutely love it!

I'm usually not psyched about watching Nollywood films but this is definetly one of those you just can't afford to miss especially if you love love. The story was very crafted and the actors portrayed all the emotions in such a beautiful way. It's definitely one you will love to watch over and over again. Well done to everyone involved in the film making process. I was really impressed.
column3:
Mo ní ìfé ẹ pátápátá
Àti wo àwọn fíìmù noliwudu ke sábà yá sí mi lára ṣùgbọ́n eléyi je ọ̀kán pàtó tí èèyàn kò lé má wò àgàgà tí o bá féràn ìfẹ́. A to ìtàn náà dáradára, àwọn òṣèré náà ṣe dára dára. Eré eléyìí jẹ èyí tó ma wò ni ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbà. Mo  Orí yìn fún gbogbo àwọn tó kópa nínú eré yìí. Ó mo ri mi wu.
column4:
"Egba fẹràn rẹ!

Nigbagbogbo Emi ko ni ẹmi nipa wiwo awọn fiimu Nollywood ṣugbọn eyi jẹ asọye ni pato ọkan ninu awọn ti o kan ko ni anfani lati padanu paapaa ti o ba nifẹ ifẹ. Itan naa jẹ apẹrẹ pupọ ati pe awọn oṣere ṣe afihan gbogbo awọn ẹdun ni ọna ti o lẹwa. Dajudaju o jẹ ọkan ti iwọ yoo nifẹ lati wo leralera. O dara fun gbogbo eniyan ti o ni ipa ninu ilana ṣiṣe fiimu. Inú mi wú gan-an ni."

column2:
The movie had a very strong and compelling story line, with the lives and struggles of the characters touch so close the realities of many people in the audience.

The acting was very good and the choice of locations was perfect.
column3:
Eré náà jé èyí ti o ìtàn tó dá lé lórí dára púpò, ìgbésí ayé àwọn tó ń ṣe eré na lo pẹ̀lú àwọn ìdojúkọ tí àwọn olùwò na ń dojú kọ lójú ayé.
 
Bí ati ṣe eré náà dára, àti pé irúfé agbègbè tí a lò na dára.
column4:
“Fiimu naa ni laini itan ti o lagbara pupọ ati iwunilori, pẹlu awọn igbesi aye ati awọn ijakadi ti awọn kikọ fọwọkan nitorinaa sunmọ awọn otitọ ti ọpọlọpọ eniyan ninu awọn olugbo.

Iṣẹ iṣe dara pupọ ati pe yiyan awọn ipo jẹ pipe. ”

column2:
One of Nollywood's Best Movies Thus Far

And, unlike the typical Nollywood classics I dreaded so much, which ended in the climax, and offering no resolutions, "93 Days" has a really good resolution.
column3:
Oòkan lara àwọn eré noliwudu tó dára jù lọ
 
Kò dà bi àwọn eré noliwudu tí mo wò, tí kò lójú tù, tí ò sì parí sí ibi tó dára, “93 days” lójú tù, ó sì parí daada.
column4:
"Ọkan ninu awọn fiimu ti o dara julọ ti Nollywood Bayi jina

Ati pe, ko dabi awọn alailẹgbẹ Nollywood aṣoju Mo bẹru pupọ, eyiti o pari ni ipari, ti ko funni ni awọn ipinnu, ““ Awọn ọjọ 93” ni ipinnu to dara gaan.

column2:
New Pandemic that could happen again!

It's a a brilliant movie and very realistic about what really happened. It's better than the movie Contagion in my book. It really hit close to home for me. It's one of the first serious pandemic in my lifetime. I would really like to purchase this movie on DVD and I've been look in the US but to no avail. Can someone tell me how? Thanks
column3:
Àjàkálè àrùn tó ṣì tún le ṣẹlẹ̀
 
Ó jẹ́ eré tó tayọ, tó ṣì jẹ́ yọ pẹ̀lú ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ ni àyíká wa. Ó dára ju gbogbo àwọn eré tí mo ní lọ́kàn lọ. Eré na ṣàfihàn ohun tó pọ̀. Ó jẹ́ àjàkálè àrùn tó lágbára àkókó ni ìwàláàyè mi. Má nì fẹ́ láti ra kásẹ̀tì rẹ̀ ṣọ́wọ́, mo tí wá káàkiri US ṣùgbọ́n mí ó tí ríi. Ṣé amo bí tí mo tí lé e ri rà.
column4:
“Ajakaye tuntun ti o le ṣẹlẹ lẹẹkansi!

O jẹ fiimu ti o wuyi ati pe o daju pupọ nipa ohun ti o ṣẹlẹ gaan. O dara ju fiimu Contagion ninu iwe mi. O lu gan sunmo ile fun mi. O jẹ ọkan ninu ajakaye-arun to ṣe pataki akọkọ ni igbesi aye mi. Emi yoo fẹ gaan lati ra fiimu yii lori DVD ati pe Mo ti wo ni AMẸRIKA ṣugbọn laiṣe. Le ẹnikan so fun mi bawo? O ṣeun"

column2:
Absolutely Stunning

This movie is amazing. If you like the subject matter you will love this movie!
column3:
Ó gbegedé
Eré yii yani lénu. Tó bá féràn kókó-ọ̀rọ̀ eré na  wà gbádùn eré yìí.
column4:

Fiimu yii jẹ iyalẹnu. Ti o ba fẹran koko-ọrọ naa iwọ yoo nifẹ fiimu yii! ”

column2: I loved this

column4: Mo nifẹ eyi

Amazing show

This show is super amazing. It has 13 episodes and i was able to finish all episodes in 2 days.

Can't wait to see Season 2.

Everyone did very well, it is hard to pick my favorite.
column3:
Eré  tó ya ni lénu
Eré ya ni lénu gidigidi, ó ní ẹ́písòdù mẹ́tàlá, mo sì wò gbogbo ẹ́písòdù náà tán lọ́jọ́ méjì.
 
Mí ò le dúró kí sésìn kejì jáde
Gbogbo ènìyàn ló ṣe dáradára, mí ò lè sọ pé ẹni tí mo féràn jù lèyí.
column4:
"Ifihan iyanu

Ifihan yii jẹ iyalẹnu pupọ. O ni awọn iṣẹlẹ 13 ati pe Mo ni anfani lati pari gbogbo awọn iṣẹlẹ ni awọn ọjọ 2.

Ko le duro lati wo Akoko 2.

Gbogbo eniyan ṣe daradara, o ṣoro lati yan ayanfẹ mi. ”

column2:
Good series
I'm really impressed with this series. Its captivating and entertaining.
column3:
Ipele  eré tó dára
Orí mi wú si ipele eré yìí.  Eré aládùn tó tún mo ní mólè.

Mo ni itara pupọ pẹlu jara yii. Iyanilẹnu ati idanilaraya rẹ. ”

column2:
Good series
I really like this show. All the characters are great and I enjoy watching. Hope it stay around for more seasons. Looking forward to the next season!!!
column3:
Ipele eré tó dára
Mo gbádùn eré yìí. Gbogbo òṣèré ṣe dára dára mo ṣì gbádùn wíwò ẹ. Ó wù mí kó sésìn tó pọ̀. Mo ń dúró de sésìn tó kù.
column4:
"Ti o dara jara
Mo feran ifihan yii gaan. Gbogbo awọn ohun kikọ jẹ nla ati pe Mo gbadun wiwo. Ṣe ireti pe o wa ni ayika fun awọn akoko diẹ sii. Nduro siwaju si akoko ti nbọ !!! ”…

column2:
A Refreshing Nigerian Series

Such a refreshing Nigerian series to watch without the awful music playing throughout the movie. However. I don't like that Netflix just carried Season 1, got me piqued and their is no season 2 to be found.
column3:
Eré Naijiria oní pele sí ipele to ní ìtura
 
Eré ti Nàìjíríà tó  fún ni itura tó ṣì dùn wò, tí kò sì sí àwọn orin buburu tí a kọ níbè. Mí ò féràn pé sísìn kan péré ní netiflesi gbé níbè. Kò dùn mo mi pé mí ò lè rí sísìn kejì.
column4:
“Ẹya Onitura Naijiria

Iru jara onitura Naijiria lati wo laisi orin ti o buruju ti nṣire jakejado fiimu naa. Sibẹsibẹ. Emi ko fẹran pe Netflix kan gbe Akoko 1, jẹ ki mi dun ati pe wọn ko si akoko 2 lati rii. ”

column2:
AN EXCELLENT SERIES!!

This series had me just HOOKED within the first 20 mins. of the show! I just loved everything about it from beginning to end. Especially, the REAL-LIFE examples/reason the people needed lawyers. And, OMG! The laughter throughout this serious is non-stop.. I just hated for Season 1 to end.
column3:
Eré onípele  tó tayo
Eré yìí mú mi mólè fún ogún ìṣẹ́jú àkókó! Gbogbo ń kan ní mo fi ní ìfé eré yii láti ìbèrè dé dópin. Pàápàá àwọn atọ́ka lórí ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ tí àwọn ènìyàn fí nílò àwọn adájó. Àti pé ẹ̀rín ò dúró láti ìbèrè títí dópin eré yìí. Mí ò tí lè féràn pé sísìn 1 parí.
column4:
"ẸRỌ to gaju !!

jara yii jẹ ki mi kan MO laarin awọn iṣẹju 20 akọkọ. ti ifihan! Mo kan nifẹ ohun gbogbo nipa rẹ lati ibẹrẹ si opin. Paapa, awọn apẹẹrẹ GIDI-LIFE / idi ti awọn eniyan nilo awọn agbẹjọro. Ati, OMG! Ẹrin jakejado pataki yii kii ṣe iduro.. Mo kan korira fun Akoko 1 lati pari. ”

column2:
Fantastic Series from Nigeria

I love this series. Great scenery. Fantastic acting. Everybody was giving their A game. The jokes were natural and very relatable. It was educative as well.
column3:
Eré oní pele sí ipele tí Naijiria tó dára
 
Mo féràn eré yìí. Ó dùn wò. Eré ṣíṣe tó dára. Gbogbo ènìyàn fakọ yoo. Àwàdà inú eré na jojú. Ó ṣì kó èèyàn lọ́gbón.
column4:
“Ẹya ikọja lati Nigeria

Mo nifẹ jara yii. Iwoye nla. Ikọja osere. Gbogbo eniyan n fun wọn ni ere A. Awọn jokes wà adayeba ki o si gidigidi relatable. O tun jẹ ẹkọ.”

column2: Castle & Castle is a well written dramatic Nollywood series. The characters are multi-dimensional and realistic. As an American, I most enjoyed seeing the legal system in action against the backdrop of the uniqueness of Lagos.
column3:
Castle & castle je eré noliwudu oní pele sí ipele tá ko dáradára. Àwọn òṣèré na fakọ yọ.
Gégé bí ọmọ ìlú Amẹ́ríkà mo féràn láti má ri pé ètò òfin ṣíṣe lòdì sí aìse dédé ìpínlè ẹ̀kọ́.
column4: Castle & Castle jẹ jara Nollywood ti o kọ daradara. Awọn ohun kikọ naa jẹ onisẹpo pupọ ati otitọ. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà, inú mi dùn gan-an láti rí ètò òfin tí ń ṣiṣẹ́ lòdì sí ìpìlẹ̀ ẹ̀kọ́ tí ó yàtọ̀ sí ti Èkó.

column2:
Eagerly await season 2

I really love this show. Interesting characters, great storyline and writing.Can't wait for season 2.
column3:
Taratara ni mo fí ń dúró de sésìn kejì 
Mo féràn eré yìí gan-an. Àwọn òṣèré tó gbayì pẹ̀lú ìtàn tó dára. Mí ò lè dúró ki sísìn kejì náà jáde.
column4:
"Fi itara duro akoko 2

Mo nifẹ ifihan yii gaan. Awọn ohun kikọ ti o nifẹ si, itan itan nla ati kikọ. Ko le duro fun akoko 2."

column2:
Please let there be a Season 3
I truly enjoyed the accidental find! I wish I could purchase a poster from the opening title.
I truly, truly enjoy that the show portrays black Nigerian professionals at there best. Something sadly missing from American television.

I'd enjoy a season three.
column3:
Ẹjọ́ ẹ jẹ́ kí sísìn kẹta wà.
Mo gbádùn àṣírí airotele tó fara hàn. Erey Ó wù mí. Mo féràn bí eré na ti ṣàfihàn pé akésé mo sẹ̀ tí ìlú Nàìjíríà ló dára jù. Ó ṣe ní laanu pé à kí ń ri irú ẹ wò ni ẹ̀rọ àgbéléwò ti ìlú Amẹ́ríkà.
Ma gbádùn sísìn kẹta tó ń bọ̀.
column4:
"Jọwọ jẹ ki akoko 3 kan wa
Mo gbadun iwongba ti ri lairotẹlẹ! Mo fẹ pe MO le ra panini kan lati akọle ṣiṣi.
Mo ni iwongba ti, iwongba ti gbadun wipe awọn show afihan dudu Nigerian akosemose ni nibẹ dara ju. Nkankan ti o nsọnu lati inu tẹlifisiọnu Amẹrika.

Emi yoo gbadun akoko mẹta."

column2:
OMG How did I miss this show

I am so wrapped up in this series. Love every comedy line..Stella that's my girl right there...phenomenal actress.
column3:
Torí Ọlọ́run báwo ni mo ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ṣe ń wo eré yii.
 
Gbogbo ara mí wà nínú eré yìí. Mo féràn gbogbo ẹ̀fẹ̀ ẹ. Stella ará bìnrin nìyẹn… òṣèré obìnrin tó jágeree.
column4:
"OMG Bawo ni MO ṣe padanu ifihan yii

Mo wa ki a we soke ni yi jara. Nifẹ gbogbo laini awada..Stella iyẹn ni ọmọbirin mi nibẹ… oṣere iyalẹnu. ”

column2:
Excellent and well portrayed series about the Nigerian Legal system

Very informative about the Nigerian Legal System. It also portrays the challenges in family business and the compromises that follow.
column3:
Eré oní pele sí ipele tá ṣètò dáradára nípa ètò òfin orílè-èdè Naijiria.
Àpèjúwe tó kún lórí ètò òfin. Ó tún ṣàpèjúwe àwọn ẹwu tó wà nínú òwò ìdílé àti ìfihàn tó tẹ́lẹ.
column4:
“Awọn jara ti o dara julọ ti a ṣe afihan daradara nipa eto ofin Naijiria

Alaye pupọ nipa Eto ofin Naijiria. O tun ṣe afihan awọn italaya ni iṣowo idile ati awọn adehun ti o tẹle.”

column2:
Season 2 Please!

I watched "Fifty Series" and came upon Castle & Castle because of Tola face was familiar. I love this series and would love for a season 2 to come! I just hate that if left me hanging on the last episode, like a season 2 would be coming. So please give us a season 2!!
column3:
Sísìn ẹlẹ́kejì ejò ó!
Mo wo “Fifty Series “ mo tún wo Castle & Castle torí ojú Tola faramí. Mo féràn eré oní pele sí ipele yìí, ma sí ní ìfé pé kí sísìn kejì jáde. Mí ò féràn pé ẹ́písòdù tó kù ló kù mí kù. Ẹ jọ̀wọ́ ẹ fúnmi ni sísìn ẹlẹ́kejì oo!!
column4:
" Akoko 2 Jọwọ!

Mo ti wo "" Aadọta Series" o si wá lori Castle & Castle nitori ti Tola oju wà faramọ. Mo nifẹ jara yii ati pe yoo nifẹ fun akoko 2 lati wa! Mo ti o kan korira wipe ti o ba ti osi mi adiye lori awọn ti o kẹhin isele, bi a akoko 2 yoo wa ni bọ. Nitorinaa jọwọ fun wa ni akoko 2 kan !! ”

column2:
Actually Amazing
It has everything. Binge watched the entire season. Brilliant cast and has useful legal information for their target audience. Educational, suspense filled, funny and relatable characters. What more can you ask for? It literally ticks al the boxes.
column3:
Ódara lóòótọ́
Ó ní gbogbo nkan. Binge ti wo gbogbo sísìn eré na. Ó kún fún àwọn òshèré tó mọ ìṣe, ó sì tùn fi  ìmò òfin han àwọn olùwòran. Ó kún fún ẹ̀kọ́ pípé, ìfura, ẹ̀rín àti àwọn gbajúgbajà òsèré. Kí ni mò tú ń wá, eléyi tayọ.
column4:
“Nitootọ Iyalẹnu
O ni ohun gbogbo. Binge ti wo gbogbo akoko naa. Simẹnti didan ati pe o ni alaye ofin to wulo fun awọn olugbo ibi-afẹde wọn. Ẹkọ, ifura kun, funny ati awọn ohun kikọ ibatan. Kini diẹ sii ti o le beere fun? O jẹ ami gangan gbogbo awọn apoti."

column2:
Really looking forward to season 2

I'm really looking forward to season 2. I was happily surprised by the quality and depth of the stroy and characters!
column3:
Ojú wá ni sísìn kejì
 
Mo ń po ǹ gbẹ fún sísìn ẹlẹ́kejì. Inú mí dùn si ìlànà ìtàn àti àwọn òṣèré náà.
column4:
“Nitootọ nireti akoko 2

Mo n reti gaan si akoko 2. Mo ni inudidun nipasẹ didara ati ijinle ti stroy ati awọn kikọ!”

column2:
I love this show!
I had a great time binge-watching the show. Can't wait for season 2.!
column3:
Mo féràn eré yìí!!
Mo gbádùn láti wo eré na. Mí ò lè dúró láti wo sísìn ẹlẹ́kejì
column4:
"Mo nifẹ si ifihan yii!
Mo ni akoko nla binge-wiwo ifihan naa. Ko le duro fun akoko 2.!"

column2:
A film which captured a nation's hope for better cinema

One can only wish that other Nigerian filmmakers will build on this same ground for a much brighter Nigerian film future.
column3:
Fiimu tó ṣàfihàn ìrètí orílè-èdè kan fun àyípadà sinemá tó dára
 
Ìrètí ni pé àwọn alágbè jáde eré tí ń ṣe tii Naijiria náà le fọwọ́ ṣò wọ́pọ̀ torí ọjọ́ ọ̀la tó dára fún ilé-isé ìgbé fiimu jáde ti ìlú Nàìjíríà.
column4:
"Fiimu kan ti o gba ireti orilẹ-ede kan fun sinima to dara julọ

Eniyan le fẹ nikan pe awọn oṣere fiimu Naijiria yoo kọle lori ilẹ kanna fun ọjọ iwaju fiimu Naijiria ti o ni imọlẹ pupọ.

column2:
Authentic!

This movie had so many parts that were real!

People do borrow clothes and cars and pose with them, lie through their teeth to drum up business and people do learn from their mistakes and extend a helping hand.

It was a great comedy with some good lessons including- don't believe the glitter!
column3:
Ojúlówó!!!
Eré yii ní ìrírí ayé nínú ní àwọn apá kan!
Àwọn èèyàn máa ń yá aṣọ ati ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ láti bù ga, wón a pa irọ̀ lójú méjèèjì láti le sọ wípé wọn jẹ́ nkan. Àwọn ènìyàn máa ń fi àṣìṣe wọn kẹ́kọ̀ọ́, wọn yóò sì ràn wọ́n lówó.
 
Eré á panilérìn pẹ̀lú àwọn àwọn ẹ̀kọ́ tó dára bi pe gbogbo oun tó ń dán kó ni wúrà.!
column4:
"Ododo!

Yi movie ní ki ọpọlọpọ awọn ẹya ara ti o wà gidi!

Awọn eniyan ya awọn aṣọ ati awọn ọkọ ayọkẹlẹ ati duro pẹlu wọn, dubulẹ nipasẹ eyin wọn lati lu iṣowo ati awọn eniyan kọ ẹkọ lati awọn aṣiṣe wọn ati fa ọwọ iranlọwọ.

O jẹ awada nla kan pẹlu diẹ ninu awọn ẹkọ to dara pẹlu - maṣe gbagbọ didan naa! ”

column2:
Refreshingly good movie

I enjoyed the layers in the plot of the movie and the honest critique of Africa's wealthy politicians & affluent families.
column3:
Eré atunilára gidi
Mo gbádùn bí wọn ti to ìtàn eré na àti àríyànjiyàn tí ò rújú nípa ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn olóṣèlú aláwò dúdú àti àwọn ìdílé olówó.
column4:
Fiimu onitura dara

Mo gbadun awọn ipele ti o wa ninu ero fiimu naa ati atako otitọ ti awọn oloselu ọlọrọ ati awọn idile ọlọrọ ni Afirika. ”

column2:
Crazy,Lovely,Cool

My favorite Nigerian actress Adesua Etomi-wellington brought me to this tv series and I was not disappointed, it was a pleasant surprise to see good acting, really good writing on top of seeing her, all main characters had substance and were not over the top cliché characters, each episode could stand on it's own with plot twists and reveals, if anybody is looking for a good binge watch you couldn't go wrong with this Nigerian gem
column3: Òṣèré obìnrin tí mo féràn jù Adesua Etomi Wellington ló gbé mi débi eré onípele yii, mi ò sì kà bá mó rẹ̀. Ìdùnnú ló jẹ́ láti ri eré ṣíṣe tó dára, àti eré kíko pẹ̀lú rírí i, gbogbo àwọn òṣèré ṣe dára dára, ẹ́písòdù kò kan le dá dúró. Ti ẹni Kéni bá ń wá eré gidi láti wò, o le ṣàṣìṣe láti wo arábìnrin to yàtò ti Naijiria yìí.
column4:
"Crazy, ẹlẹwà, Itura

Oṣere oriṣere ori kọmputa ayanfẹ mi lorilẹede Naijiria Adesua Etomi-wellington ni o mu mi wa si ori ero TV yii, ko si dun mi, iyalenu loje lati ri iṣe ti o dara, kikọ daadaa gan-an lori bi a ti ri i, gbogbo awọn oṣere akọkọ ni o ni nkan ti wọn ko si ju oke lọ. cliché characters, kọọkan isele le duro lori ara rẹ pẹlu Idite yiyi ati fi han, ti o ba ti enikeni ti wa ni nwa kan ti o dara aago binge o ko ba le ṣe asise pẹlu yi Nigerian olowoiyebiye.

column2:
An Absolute fantastic storyline

This show is not it all what I thought it was going to be. It is 10 times better. The different issues by each of the students and how they collectively group together to work them out, excellent and very positive. I am hoping for a season two
column3:
Ìtàn tó dára dé lè
Ohun tí mo rò nípa eré yìí tẹ́lẹ̀ ko ní èyí. Ó dára ní ìlọ́po mẹwa. Ọ̀rọ̀ oríṣiríṣi tó ń kojú àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní ọ̀kò kan àti bí won ti jọ ṣíṣe papọ̀ láti ṣe àtúnṣe ọ́ tayo. Mo ń dúró de sísìn kejì.
column4:
“Itan itan ikọja pipe

Ifihan yii kii ṣe gbogbo ohun ti Mo ro pe yoo jẹ. O ti wa ni 10 igba dara. Awọn ọran ti o yatọ nipasẹ ọkọọkan awọn ọmọ ile-iwe ati bii wọn ṣe ṣajọpọ papọ lati ṣiṣẹ wọn jade, o tayọ ati rere pupọ. Mo nireti fun akoko meji"

column2:
where is season 2

I just watched season 1 and I really enjoyed it. Please do a season 2
column3:
Ibo ni sísìn kejì wà
Mo ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ wo sísìn àkókó tán, mo sì gbádùn rẹ. Ẹ jọ̀wọ́ ẹ gbé sísìn ẹlẹ́kejì jáde.
column4:
"Nibo ni akoko 2 wa

Mo kan wo akoko 1 ati pe Mo gbadun rẹ gaan. Jọwọ ṣe akoko kan 2"

column2:
excellent coming of age story.

I loved this show. I binged it and HOPE there is another season. I work in higher ed and the students depicted are true to form Great combination of comedy and drama. Wisdom made me laugh so hard. He was excellent. the blend of the story lines were great.
column3:
Ìtàn ọjọ́ íwajú tó tayọ
 
Mo féràn eré yìí. Ó taa, mo si rò pé sísìn méràn wàá.
column4:
"o tayọ Wiwa ti ọjọ ori itan.

Mo nifẹ ifihan yii. Mo binged o ati IRETI nibẹ ni miran akoko. Mo ṣiṣẹ ni ed ti o ga ati awọn ọmọ ile-iwe ti a fihan jẹ ooto lati ṣe akojọpọ Nla ti awada ati eré. Ọgbọn ṣe mi rẹrin pupọ. O tayọ. idapọ ti awọn laini itan jẹ nla. ”

column2:
A perfect story!

Amazingly realistic. It depicts the life and story of young Nigerian men living in Lagos.
column3:
Ìtàn tó dá pé
O ní ìrírí ayé. Ó jẹ́ ìtàn ìgbésí ayé àwọn odò ọkùnrin tó ń gbé ni Èkó.
column4:
"Itan pipe!

Iyalẹnu bojumu. Ó ṣàpẹẹrẹ ìgbésí ayé àti ìtàn àwọn ọ̀dọ́kùnrin Nàìjíríà tí wọ́n ń gbé ní Èkó.”

column2:
Amazing

The storyline is quiet interesting, the actors are amazing and it wasn't as predictable as I thought it would.. Picture quality is awesome, Molly wood has really grown.
column3:
Ìyàlẹ́nu
Bí ìtàn na ti lo lárindin, àwọn òṣèré náà ṣe dára dára àti pé  ìparí eré na ò ṣé mo láti ìbèrè. Àwòrán na jágeree. Ìdàgbàsókè tí bá eré noliwudu o
column4:
"Iyanu

Itan itan naa jẹ iyanilenu, awọn oṣere jẹ iyalẹnu ati pe ko ṣe asọtẹlẹ bi Mo ṣe ro pe yoo jẹ .. Didara aworan jẹ oniyi, Molly igi ti dagba gaan. ”

column2:
This movie will englighten you

As a Nigerian I know we have three major tribes: Hausa, Igbo and Yoruba. However, you don't hear the mention of Hausa in places like America. Hausa's are termed the poorest-illiterates in the country. You hardly see or hear them in entertainment so the world isn't aware they even exist. I wish they will make more movies like this. The Hausa tribe needs to be heard!
column3:
Eré yii a fún ẹ ló yẹ
Gégé bi ọmọ bibi ilé ea Naijiria, mo mòn pe ẹ̀yà mẹ́ta gbòógì lani: Haúsá, igbo àti Yorùbá. Sí bẹ̀ o le gbó nípa Haúsá ní bi Amẹ́ríkà, wón ri àwọn Haúsá gẹ́gẹ́ bi àwọn tálákà tí ò kàwé lórílẹ̀ – èdè. Ṣà dédé ni wa fi ri won nínú eré to rí nà gbogbo àgbáyé kò mò wón. Mo lé rò pé won yóò ṣe ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ fiimu bí èyí. Awọn ènìyàn ni láti mo nípa àwọn Haúsá dáradára.
column4:
"Fiimu yii yoo fun ọ ni oye

Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ Nàìjíríà, mo mọ̀ pé a ní ẹ̀yà pàtàkì mẹ́ta: Hausa, Igbo àti Yorùbá. Sibẹsibẹ, o ko gbọ ti a darukọ Hausa ni awọn aaye bii Amẹrika. Awon Hausa ni a pe ni alaimokiki julo ni orile-ede yii. O nira lati rii tabi gbọ wọn ni ere idaraya nitorinaa agbaye ko mọ pe wọn paapaa wa. Mo nireti pe wọn yoo ṣe awọn fiimu diẹ sii bii eyi. Ẹ̀yà Hausa gbọ́dọ̀ gbọ́!”

column2:
the best Nigerian Movie in decades

Honestly, this movie brought back great memories and gave me deep thoughts. This is the best movie out of Nigeria in more than a decade. This compares to old Nigerian movie classics. Kudos to Banky W, this man is pure class. I do not watch Nigerian movies because of the "garbage" most churn out, but this move right here deserves an Oscar.
column3:
Eré Naijiria tó dára jù láti bi ọdún mẹwa sẹ́yìn.
Ni lóòótọ́, eré yii mu àwọn ìrírí òun to ti ṣẹlẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ tó ti pé wá. Eléyìí jẹ́ eré tó tayọ to jáde wá láti Nàìjíríà lati bi ọdún mẹwa sẹ́yìn. Ó yàtò si eré àgbéléwò àwọn ọjọ́ tó ti pé. Banky W kú isé, o tayọ. Mi o kin wo eré ti Naijiria tẹ́lẹ̀ torí ìṣekúṣe tí won ma ń ṣe tẹ́lẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n eré eléyìí tó sí àwọ́dù Oscar.
column4:
"Fiimu Naijiria to dara julọ ni awọn ọdun mẹwa

Nitootọ, fiimu yii mu awọn iranti nla pada o si fun mi ni awọn ironu jinlẹ. Eyi ni fiimu ti o dara julọ lati orilẹ-ede Naijiria ni diẹ sii ju ọdun mẹwa lọ. Eyi ṣe afiwe si awọn alailẹgbẹ fiimu Naijiria atijọ. Kudos to Banky W, ọkunrin yi jẹ funfun kilasi. Emi ko wo awọn sinima Naijiria nitori "" idoti "" ti o jade julọ, ṣugbọn gbigbe yii nihin yẹ Oscar."

column2:
Let me quickly drop my thoughts

This movie relates to the current situation of most Nigerian youths, it doesn't matter how you make your money Just be successful that's all. Nice delivery from Gabriel, definitely one of our best actors!
column3:
Jẹ́ kí ń fi èrò mí hàn
Eré lo pẹ̀lú àwọn a dojú kọ ti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ Nàìjíríà dojú kọ, bó ti rí owó ọ̀ ṣe kókó ìwo ṣá ti ṣe orí rere. Ìṣe takuntakun lá to wó Gabriel, dájúdájú ó jẹ́ ìkan lára àwọn òṣèré wa tó dára jù.
column4:
"Jẹ ki n yara ju awọn ero mi silẹ

Fíìmù yìí kàn mọ́ ipò tí ọ̀pọ̀ jù lọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ Nàìjíríà ń lọ lọ́wọ́, kò ṣe pàtàkì bí o ṣe ń náwó rẹ̀ Kan ṣe àṣeyọrí nìyẹn. Ifijiṣẹ to wuyi lati ọdọ Gabrieli, dajudaju ọkan ninu awọn oṣere wa ti o dara julọ! ”

column2:
my number one nigeria sci fi best movie
I love the movie, it falls into my favorite type which i am satisfy off, looking forward for nigeria to bring more to screen.

And my advice for us Nigerian is to support this movie to encourage them to bring and produce more better movies of our choice for us to watch.
column3:
Àkókó nípò àwọn eré Nàìjíríà ti mo féràn jù.
Mo ni ìfé eré náà, ó bọ́ si ọ́kan lára eré tó má ń tèmi lọ́rùn.
 
Igbiyanju mi ni pé kí àwọn ará ìlú Nàìjíríà gbárúkùtì eré náà láti ri pé gbé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ re jáde láti wòó.
column4:
"Mi nomba mi nigeria sci fi ti o dara ju movie
Mo nifẹ fiimu naa, o ṣubu sinu iru ayanfẹ mi eyiti MO ni itẹlọrun ni pipa, nreti siwaju fun nigeria lati mu diẹ sii si iboju.

Ati imọran mi fun awa Naijiria ni lati ṣe atilẹyin fun fiimu yii lati gba wọn niyanju lati mu ati gbejade awọn fiimu ti o dara julọ ti o fẹ fun wa lati wo."

column2:
Better than days of our live

Well written, acted, directed. Awesome soap opera about big boys in Nigeria. This is among my favorite series or productions out of Nigeria. Well done and enjoy!
column3: Akọ́ dáradára, a ṣeré ati darí ẹ daada. Eré aládùn nípa àwọn ọ̀dọ́ tó dangajia ti ilé Naijiria. Eléyìí je ọ̀kan lára eré tí a ṣe ni Naijiria tí mo féràn. Ẹ kú ìṣe, ẹ kú ìgbádùn!!
column4:
"O dara ju awọn ọjọ ti igbesi aye wa lọ

Ti kọ daradara, ṣe iṣe, itọsọna. Oniyi opera ọṣẹ nipa awọn ọmọkunrin nla ni Nigeria. Eyi wa laarin jara ayanfẹ mi tabi awọn iṣelọpọ jade ni Nigeria. O dara ati gbadun! ”…

column2:
A Must See - Sons of the Caliphate

I watched Season 1 and 2 on Netflix in the USA. This TV series is excellent. It has everything a viewer could want from Suspense to Romance to Action. Love the actors, script, storyline, culture and location.
column3:
Eré tó gbkdọ̀ wò – Sons of the caliphate
Mo wo sísìn kìíní àti ìkejì lórí netiflesi nilu Amẹ́ríkà. Eré na tayọ. O ni gbogbo ń tí àwọn àwòrán ń wà láti susipensi sí eré ìfé si áṣòn. Mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ àwọn òṣèré, ìtàn, àṣà àti agbègbè ti a ti ya eré na.
column4:
"A gbọdọ Wo - Awọn ọmọ ti Caliphate

Mo wo Akoko 1 ati 2 lori Netflix ni AMẸRIKA. Eleyi TV jara jẹ o tayọ. O ni ohun gbogbo ti oluwo le fẹ lati Suspense si Fifehan si Iṣe. Nifẹ awọn oṣere, iwe afọwọkọ, itan itan, aṣa ati ipo. ”

column2:
This show should have 5 seasons!!!!

This show was so interesting and entertaining. If the real Caliphate has a problem with it. Change or abbreviate the name, abeg. Great cast!!! Great writing!!! Great visuals. :)
column3:
Ó ye kí eré yìí ni sísìn karùn-ún
 
Eré yii dára yà àti pé ó dùn gan. Ti àwọn cálífátì kò bá ní ìfé si. Èyí orúkọ náà padà tàbí ke yọ kúrò lára rẹ̀. Òṣèré ńlá, eré kíko ńlá!! Àwòrán ńlá.
column4:
"Ifihan yii yẹ ki o ni awọn akoko 5 !!!!

Yi show je ki awon ati ki o idanilaraya. Ti Caliphate gidi ba ni iṣoro pẹlu rẹ. Yi tabi kekuru orukọ, abeg. Simẹnti nla !!! kikọ nla !!! Awọn iwo nla. :)"

column2:
Captivating

Zainab was captivating in her role as Sylvia. It left me hoping for a sequel. Throughout the twist and turns of the movie I could not help but be glued to the tv. I found myself pulling for Sylvia. Her seductiveness and witty demeanor was only surpassed by her outstanding acting skills.
column3:
O mu ní mólè
Zainab ṣe dára dára gẹ́gẹ́ be Sylvia. O je kí ń ma pe òùngbẹ eré yìí si. Nínú gbogbo ká lọ ká bọ̀ ṣe ni mo le jù mọ ẹ̀rọ àgbéléwò yii. Níse ni mo ranjú mọ́ ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán mi mo sì ríi pé ọkàn mí fà sí Sylvia. Ìfanimọ́ra rẹ̀ pọ́ọ̀ jù, ṣùgbọ́n eré síse rè tayo jù béè lọ.
column4:
"Ti o wuni

Zainab ṣe iyanilẹnu ninu ipa rẹ bi Sylvia. O fi mi silẹ ni ireti fun atẹle kan. Ni gbogbo lilọ ati awọn iyipo ti fiimu naa Emi ko le ṣe iranlọwọ bikoṣe ki n rọ mọ tẹlifisiọnu naa. Mo ti ri ara mi nfa fun Sylvia. Ìwà ẹ̀tàn àti ìhùwàsí òmùgọ̀ rẹ̀ nìkan ni àwọn ọgbọ́n eré ìdárayá rẹ̀ tí ó tayọ jù lọ.”

column2: Nollywood blockbuster that turns out to be a sprawling, at times gloriously chaotic gangster epic about a woman who made it and who now rules the world by way of her facial expressions. So much energy.
column3: Nollywood náà ti ń gbòrò síi ṣùgbọ́n ó lè ní rògbòdìyàn díẹ̀ àmọ́ ọmọbìnrin náà gbà ìjọba taló ṣe ìjọba pẹ̀lú fífi ojú fani mọ́ra. Agbára pọ̀.
column4: Nollywood blockbuster ti o wa ni jade lati wa ni a kaakiri, ni igba ologo apọju rudurudu ti gangster apọju nipa obinrin kan ti o ṣe o ati awọn ti o ni bayi jọba aye nipa ọna rẹ oju. Agbara to po.

column2: nollywood going up YEsSIR. this is a new bar set dude and i love that its written and directed by a woman

column4: nollywood goke YsSIR. Eyi jẹ arakunrin ti o ṣeto igi tuntun ati pe Mo nifẹ pe kikọ ati itọsọna nipasẹ obinrin kan

column2: Guess this may be the apex of nollywood cinema in many ways but as a beginner viewer it’s enjoyable nonetheless. Captured the chaotic nature and length of nollywood films with a novel storyline and a characteristic touch of Nigerian political culture
column3: olè ròpé ẹ̀yí lè jẹ́ ibi gíga eré nollywood ní ọ̀nà púpọ́ sùgbón  gégé bí alákóbẹ̀rẹ̀ olùwòran síbẹ̀ asì gbádùn ẹ̀. ófi hàn nínú rè gbobo rògbòdìhàn àti bí eré nollywood se gùn sí pẹ̀lú ìtàn tuntun tí wọ́n tẹ̀lé àti ìwà orílèdé àsà òsèlù Nigeria
column4: Gboju pe eyi le jẹ apex ti sinima nollywood ni ọpọlọpọ awọn ọna ṣugbọn bi oluwo olubere o jẹ igbadun sibẹsibẹ. Mu iru rudurudu ati gigun ti awọn fiimu nollywood pẹlu itan itan aramada ati ifọwọkan ihuwasi ti aṣa iṣelu Naijiria

column2: A concrete jungle, criss-crossed by the endless mesh of electrical wiring - Lagos is brought to life.
column3: igbó dídí, tólójúpọ̀ pèlú okùn iná tí ò lópin- amú èkó wá sí ayé
column4: Igbo ti o nipon, criss-rekoja nipasẹ awọn ailopin apapo ti itanna wiring - Lagos ti wa ni mu si aye.

column2: Finally a great Nigerian film. For years I’ve been hoping that Nigeria would produce a really great film, and that’s where the Esiri brothers come in.
column3: Níparí eré orílèdè Nigeria tó lágbára, fún òpọ̀lopọ̀ mò ún nírètí pé orílèdè  Ngeria ma pèsè eré tó lágbára, àti ibè ni àwon arákùnrin Esiri tí má wolé
column4: Níkẹyìn a nla Nigerian film. Fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ni mo ti ń retí pé Nàìjíríà yóò gbé fíìmù tó ga gan-an jáde, ibẹ̀ sì ni àwọn ará Esiri ti wọlé.

column2:
Love this Film
I will enjoy watching it for many years to come and the conversations that it will spark. 
The acting is very natural without melodrama and it feels very believable. Overall, the film was riveting and kept me really engaged.
column3:
moféràn eré yí 
mà á gbádùn kin ma wó fún ọ̀pọ̀lopọ̀ odún tí ó nbò àti òrò àbásọ tí ó ma ń  múwá
Eré ṣíṣe lo létò láìsí orin aládùn, ó ṣe gbàgbó. Ju gbogbo ẹ lo, eré na dára, ó gba àsìkò mi.
column4:
"Nifẹ fiimu yii
Emi yoo gbadun wiwo rẹ fun ọpọlọpọ ọdun ti mbọ ati awọn ibaraẹnisọrọ ti yoo tan.
Iṣe naa jẹ adayeba pupọ laisi melodrama ati pe o kan lara igbagbọ pupọ. Lapapọ, fiimu naa n tako ati pe o jẹ ki n ṣe ajọṣepọ gaan. ”

column2: In spite of the less than satisfactory parts of Ayinla, the movie, it is an excellent work of art, and Lateef Adedimeji’s less than brilliant performance did not take away from the overall satisfaction derivable.
column3: Bótilẹ̀jẹ́pé kò sí ǹkan tó tèni lọ́rùn, lára eré Àyìnlá, eré náà dára púpọ̀ àti pé ṣíṣe latifu tó kú díẹ̀ káà tó, ìyẹn kò sọ wípé eré náà kò dára.
column4: Laibikita awọn ẹya ti o kere ju ti Ayinla ti o ni itẹlọrun lọ, fiimu naa, iṣẹ ọna ti o dara julọ ni, ati pe Lateef Adedimeji ti o kere ju iṣẹ ṣiṣe ti o wuyi ko mu kuro ni itẹlọrun gbogbogbo.

column2: It is interesting that For Maria is a 2020 movie and is now available on Netflix in 2022. This is an overall excellent Nollywood production, and deserves to be seen by everyone.
column3: Ó jẹ́ ohun idunu pé Màríà tí a gbé jáde lọ́dún 2020 tí wá lórí netiflesi nj 2022. Eré noliwudu tó dára lè yìí, ó ṣì yẹ ki gbogbo ènìyàn wò ó.
column4: O jẹ iyanilenu pe Fun Maria jẹ fiimu 2020 ati pe o wa bayi lori Netflix ni ọdun 2022. Eyi jẹ iṣelọpọ Nollywood ti o tayọ lapapọ, ati pe o yẹ lati rii nipasẹ gbogbo eniyan.

column2: A Naija Christmas takes us from the idyllic Ikoyi, where everything is calm and high-class, to the bubbling Mushin, where you can be obtained if you don’t stand well. You see the beauty of Lagos at night, when it is well lit. You feel the real Naija Christmas spirit, and you want to share it with others.
column3: Ìgbà sìn sìn Kérésìmesì ní Naijiria á si mó wa lati ipò to da bi ìkòyí, tí ó dá tó si je ibi ti àwọn olówó ń gbé dàbí Mushin tó ń wó sọ̀sọ̀, tó si ti le se àgbákò tó ba dúró dáadáa. Alẹ́ ni wa tí rí ẹwà Èkó. Wà riírìrí Kérésìmesì tí Naijiria gangan, wa si fẹ ló pẹ̀lú àwọn elòmíràn.
column4: Keresimesi Naija kan mu wa lati Ikoyi alaimọ, nibiti ohun gbogbo wa ni idakẹjẹ ati giga, si Mushin ti nyọ, nibiti o le gba ti o ko ba duro dada. Ewa Eko lale ni e n ri, ti o ba tan daradara. O lero ẹmi Keresimesi Naija gidi, ati pe o fẹ lati pin pẹlu awọn miiran.

column2: It is beautiful to see Sam Dede on our screens again, and to see he is still a master of his craft, giving us a stellar performance. Where there is Stella Damasus, you can be sure to see some genuine tears, with emotional scenes, and she seems ageless.
column3: Ohun ìdùnnú ni láti rí sam dédè lójú pátákó ìṣeré àti lasi tún tí rí pé ó ṣì meré ṣe ibi kí bi to bá tí ri Stella Damascus, ó dá mi lójú pé omi ẹkún ma jáde lójú ẹ. Ko ti ẹ jọ pé ó ń dàgbà.
column4: O jẹ lẹwa lati ri Sam Dede loju iboju wa lẹẹkansi, ati lati rii pe o tun jẹ oga ti iṣẹ ọwọ rẹ, ti o fun wa ni iṣẹ alarinrin. Nibiti Stella Damasus wa, o le rii daju pe o rii diẹ ninu awọn omije gidi, pẹlu awọn iwoye ẹdun, ati pe o dabi ẹni pe ko ni ọjọ-ori.

column2: this movie is a good offering in the genre.
column3: Eré yìí dára
column4: fiimu yii jẹ ẹbun ti o dara ni oriṣi.

column2: This return of the king is glorious.
column3: Ìpadàbọ̀ ọba náà dáa
column4: Ipadabọ ọba yii jẹ ologo.

column2: The use of proverbs, innuendos, and play on words, provides so many memorable one liners and quotes that will remain on our tongues for a long time. We will quote the lines and recall the pleasure of watching this series.
column3: Àwọn akọ̀nlọ̀ èdè tí wọ́n lò ma jẹ́ ọ̀rọ̀ lẹ́nu wa fún ọjọ́ pípé. A má má sọ́ láti rántí eré na taa wò.
column4: Lílo òwe, ọ̀rọ̀ àfojúdi, àti eré orí ọ̀rọ̀, ń pèsè ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ àsọyé àti ọ̀rọ̀ àsọyé tí yóò wà lórí ahọ́n wa fún ìgbà pípẹ́. A yoo sọ awọn ila ati ranti idunnu ti wiwo jara yii.

column2:
The costume designers understood the assignment and brought all to the table. 
It is the kind of synergy and excellence we have clamoured for in Nollywood.
column3: Àwọn a múra fún òṣèré mo isé, wón ṣe iṣẹ́ won dára dára. Àwọn ìwà takuntakun tá tí ń gbàdúrà fun lọ́jọ́ tó ti pé rẹ.
column4:
"Awọn apẹẹrẹ aṣọ loye iṣẹ iyansilẹ wọn si mu gbogbo wọn wá si tabili.
O jẹ iru amuṣiṣẹpọ ati didara julọ ti a ti kigbe fun ni Nollywood. ”

column2: The casting of KOB 2 gives the most appropriate roles to the people who would leave all on the screen, and they give stellar performances, including those who had non-speaking roles and cameo appearances. The acting is on point, so much that even facial expressions spoke volumes.
column3: Mímú àwọn òsèré KOB 2 fi àwọn ipá tó tọ́ mo àwọn òṣèré tí yóò ṣe é dáradára. Wọ́n sì ṣe bẹbẹ nínú síse eré náà, papọ̀ mó àwọn tí kò sọ̀rọ̀ àti àwọn tó kàn farahàn lásán. Eré síse náà dára púpọ̀ kódà fífi ojú sọ̀rọ̀ wọn gaan sọ tóó
column4: Simẹnti ti KOB 2 n fun awọn ipa ti o yẹ julọ fun awọn eniyan ti yoo fi gbogbo rẹ silẹ loju iboju, wọn si fun awọn iṣẹ alarinrin, pẹlu awọn ti o ni awọn ipa ti kii ṣe sisọ ati awọn ifarahan cameo. Iṣe naa wa ni aaye, pupọ pe paapaa awọn oju oju sọ awọn ipele.

column2: 76 is an excellent piece of artwork. The quality of the work shows the effect of military consultation that was done, and it demonstrates how Nollywood stands to benefit from consulting professionals in portraying their fields and activities, to give the audience the right type of authentic experience.
column3: 76 jé iṣé sinemá tó tayọ. Dídáiṣé náà ṣe àfihàn wípé wọ́n sèwádìí lọ́dọ̀ àwọn Ológun, ósì ṣe àfihàn bí Nollywood ṣe le jẹàǹfàní láti òdo àwọn onímọ̀nípa isé bí wọn ti le fi àwọn iṣéwọn hàn, kí ó le ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́láti fún àwọn ònwòran ní ìrírító dára jùlọ
column4: 76 jẹ iṣẹ ọna ti o dara julọ. Didara iṣẹ naa ṣe afihan ipa ti ijumọsọrọ ologun ti o ṣe, ati pe o ṣe afihan bi Nollywood ṣe duro lati ni anfani lati ọdọ awọn alamọdaju lati ṣe afihan awọn aaye ati awọn iṣẹ wọn, lati fun awọn olugbo ni iru iru iriri tootọ.

column2: The onscreen chemistry between Ramsey and Rita is a testament to their skills and legendary status in Nollywood. It is also lovely to see Chidi Mokeme, who we think has been away for too long.
column3: Ǹkan tó ṣẹlẹ̀ láàrín-in Ramsey àti Rita jẹ́ ìjérìí sí ìmọ́se wọn àti ipò Pàtàkì wọn ní Nollywood. Ósì dára pẹ̀lú láti rí Chidi Mokeme, tí a rò wípé ó ti lọ fún ìgbàpípẹ́
column4: Kemistri loju iboju laarin Ramsey ati Rita jẹ ẹri si ọgbọn wọn ati ipo arosọ ni Nollywood. O tun dun lati ri Chidi Mokeme, ẹniti a ro pe ko ti lọ fun igba pipẹ.

column2: The movie authentically gives us the feel of the eighties, up to how parties were organized, the talk about bleaching, the clothes, and the generous use of damask and adire.
column3: Eré náà láìsí àníàní fún wa níbí ǹkan ti rí ní ìgbà àwọn bàbáa wa, títí dé ibi ayẹyẹ ṣíṣẹ, ọ̀rọ̀lóríi bíbóra, àwọn aṣọ̀, àti bí wọ́n ti lo àwọn aṣọ àdìrẹ àti damask
column4: Fiimu naa ni otitọ fun wa ni imọlara ti awọn ọgọrin ọdun, titi de bi a ṣe ṣeto awọn ayẹyẹ, ọrọ sisọ nipa bleaching, awọn aṣọ, ati lilo oninurere ti damask ati adire.

column2: The post script scene will have you laughing out of the cinema hall, and you will find yourself breaking out in a grin each time you recall flashes of the movie.
column3: Ìpele tó parí yóò pa ó lẹ̀rín débi pé wàá rẹ̀rín jáde nínú ilé sinimá. Wà á sì tún máa rérìn-ín músẹ́ ní gbogbo ìgbà tí o bá rántí àwọn àwòrán kọ̀ọ̀kán nínú eré náà.
column4: Ipele iwe afọwọkọ ifiweranṣẹ yoo jẹ ki o rẹrin lati inu gbongan sinima, ati pe iwọ yoo rii ara rẹ ti o ya jade ni ẹrin ni gbogbo igba ti o ba ranti awọn filasi ti fiimu naa.

column2: My Village People is a movie that will have you losing your home training while watching it. But it is a pathfinder of sorts. Nollywood generally has not done a good job of making the supernatural sexy and appealing. My Village People achieves it effortlessly, and deserves copious amount of praise.
column3: Fíìmù My Village People jẹ́ èyí tí ó jẹ́ pé á mú ẹ sọ ẹ̀kọ́ ìwà dídára rẹ̀ ẹ nù. Ṣùgbọ́n ó jẹ́ bíi olùtọ́pa ọ̀nà ni bákàn. Lápàapọ̀, Nollywood ò kìí ṣe àwọn ipa oní agbára ìbílẹ̀ dáradára. My Village People ṣe é yàtọ̀ ní ọ̀nà tó dára, ó sì yẹ fún ìgbóríyìn.
column4: Awọn eniyan Abule mi jẹ fiimu kan ti yoo jẹ ki o padanu ikẹkọ ile rẹ lakoko wiwo rẹ. Sugbon o jẹ a ona ti ona. Nollywood ni gbogbogbo ko ti ṣe iṣẹ to dara lati jẹ ki ibalopọ eleri ati iwunilori. Awọn eniyan Abule mi ṣaṣeyọri rẹ lainidi, ati pe o yẹ iye iyin lọpọlọpọ.

column2: This movie, My Village People, gives us a very interesting plot twist that has us laughing and giving an applause, and the conflict resolution is well done, in terms of the script and the acting.
column3: Eré yìí, My Village People jẹ́ èyí tí ó ní ìtàn tí ìyípo ìtàn rẹ̀ pá wá lérìn-ín débi pé a pàtéwọ́. Bí wọ́n ti ṣe ń dájọ́ èdèàiyèdè náà dára, tó bá jẹ́ fún ìtàn kíkọ àti eré ṣíṣe
column4: Fiimu yii, Awọn eniyan Abule mi, fun wa ni lilọ idite ti o nifẹ pupọ ti o ni ki a rẹrin ati fifun ni iyìn, ati ipinnu rogbodiyan ti ṣe daradara, ni awọn ofin ti iwe afọwọkọ ati iṣe.

column2: My Village People delivered fantastic special effects, and they are not over the top. One of my favourite special effects is the rain. The technical crew deserves special recognition for their skills in this movie
column3: My Village People ni àwọn isé sinimá tó dára kan tí wọn kò sì ní àṣejù. Ara àwọn isé yìí ni òjò  náà. Àwọn onímọ̀ ẹ̀rọ náà yẹ fún ìgbóríyìn fún iṣé takuntakun tí wọ́n ṣe.
column4: Awọn eniyan abule mi jiṣẹ awọn ipa pataki ikọja, ati pe wọn ko kọja oke. Ọkan ninu awọn ayanfẹ mi pataki ipa ni ojo. Awọn atukọ imọ-ẹrọ yẹ idanimọ pataki fun awọn ọgbọn wọn ni fiimu yii

column2: it is a great movie from someone whom we know to be a great storyteller. Gold Statue may not be one of Tade Ogidan’s best works, but it ranks high up there
column3: Eré ńlá ni eré náà fún ẹni tí a mọ̀ sí olùsọ̀tàn àgbà. Gold Statue lè má jèé ọ̀kan lára àwọn eré Tádé Ògìdán tó dára jù o, ṣùgbọ́n iṣé ńlá ni iṣé náà.
column4: o jẹ fiimu nla lati ọdọ ẹnikan ti a mọ pe o jẹ itan-akọọlẹ nla. Gold Statue le ma jẹ ọkan ninu awọn iṣẹ ti o dara julọ Tade Ogidan, ṣugbọn o ni ipo giga sibẹ

column2: Gabriel Afolayan is in a class of his own as an actor; he always understands the task.
column3: Gabriel Afolayan tún jẹ́ òṣèré tó yàtọ̀ láàyè tirè. Òye iṣẹ́ máa ń yé e ni sáá.
column4: Gabriel Afolayan wa ninu kilasi tirẹ gẹgẹbi oṣere; nigbagbogbo loye iṣẹ naa.

column2: The drama is fast-paced and well apportioned; the comedy is natural and connects well with the viewers.
column3: Eré náà dára, pípín rẹ̀ náà sì dara. Àwàdà náà jẹ́ tòótọ́, tí àwọn ònwòran síì ní òye rẹ̀.
column4: Awọn eré ti wa ni sare-rìn ati daradara pin; awọn awada jẹ adayeba ki o si sopọ daradara pẹlu awọn oluwo.

column2: The picture quality of this movie is great, and the director did a good job.
column3: Àwòrán eré yìí dára púpọ̀. Olùdarí náa ṣe iṣẹ́ tó dára.
column4: Didara aworan ti fiimu yii jẹ nla, ati pe oludari ṣe iṣẹ to dara.

column2: I enjoyed the relationship crafted between Mr. Tayo (Bimbo Manuel) and Ejiro (RMD),
column3: Mo gbádùn ìbáṣepọ̀ tó wà láàrín-in Mr. Tayo (Bimbo Manuel) àti Ejiro (RMD)
column4: Mo gbadun ibatan ti a ṣe laarin Ọgbẹni Tayo (Bimbo Manuel) ati Ejiro (RMD),

column2: Seeing Richard Mofe-Damijo (RMD) as Ejiro, a retired thug for hire and crime lord, is a complete departure from his usual role of the wealthy father, he kills it.
column3: Àti rí̀ Richard Mofe-Damijo (RMD) tó kó ipa Ejiro, ọmọ ìta tó ti fèyìntì fún ọ̀gá ọ̀daràn yàtọ̀ sí ipa tó máa ń kó tẹ́lẹ̀ bíi bàbá olówó. Ó sì ṣe dáadáa.
column4: Ri Richard Mofe-Damijo (RMD) gege bi Ejiro, onijagidijagan ti o ti feyinti fun ọya ati ilufin oluwa, jẹ pipe kuro ni ipa ti baba olowo ti o ṣe deede, o pa a.

column2: It is lovely to see Kolade handle the car so well.  Daddy Showkey is the don and major bad guy, and he wears the role well. His acting needs some work, but he did not disappoint.
column3: Ó dára láti rí bí Kọ́ládé ti ṣe wa mótò. Daddy Showkey ni ọ̀daràn àti alátàḱo, ó sì kó ipa náà dáadáa. Eré ṣíṣe rẹ̀ kúù díẹ̀ káàtó, ṣùgbọ́n kò jánikulẹ̀
column4: O jẹ ẹlẹwà lati rii Kolade ti o mu ọkọ ayọkẹlẹ naa daradara. Daddy Showkey ni ẹbun ati eniyan buburu pataki, ati pe o wọ ipa naa daradara. Iṣe iṣe rẹ nilo iṣẹ diẹ, ṣugbọn ko dun.

column2: Seven reminds me of an American Movie, the Ultimate Gift, with a Nigerian twist, and it achieved its aim.
column3: Seven ránmíléti fíìmù òyìnbó kan The Ultimate Gift ṣùgbọ́n tí ó wá jẹ́ ti Nàìjíríà, ó sì tayọ nínú gbígbé àfojúsùn rẹ̀ jáde.
column4: Meje leti mi ti fiimu Amẹrika kan, Ẹbun Gbẹhin, pẹlu lilọ Naijiria kan, o si ṣaṣeyọri ete rẹ.

column2: Technically, the sound is very good, and camera angles and techniques are unusual and interesting. The fight scenes are well choreographed.
column3: Nípa ti ìmọ̀ ẹ̀ro, ohùn náà dára púpò, béè sì ni àwòrán yíyà yáàtọ̀ sí ti àtẹ̀yìnwá tí ó sì dára. Wọ́n ṣe àwọn ìran ìjà náà dáradára.
column4: Ni imọ-ẹrọ, ohun naa dara pupọ, ati awọn igun kamẹra ati awọn ilana jẹ dani ati iwunilori. Awọn ipele ija ti wa ni choreographed daradara.

column2: The comedy is of a wide spectrum; you will laugh at the events in the movie
column3: Àwàdà náà tún jẹ́ àrà ọ̀tọ̀. Wà á rérìn-ín tí o bá ń wo àwọn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ eré ná̀à.
column4: Awọn awada jẹ ti kan jakejado julọ.Oniranran; iwọ yoo rẹrin awọn iṣẹlẹ ni fiimu naa

column2: The movie drags you to the edge of your seat and demands that you pay full attention.
column3: Eré náà yóò mú ọ mólè, yóò si jẹ́ kí o fi ọkàn síi bí eré náà ti ń lọ dáradára.
column4: Fiimu naa fa ọ si eti ijoko rẹ ati pe o nilo akiyesi ni kikun.

column2: The actors in Mama Drama gave a great performance, so much so that you would believe they are experiencing all the pain, joy, and every emotion in the movie.
column3: Àwọn òṣèré e Mama Drama ṣe takuntakun tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tí ó jẹ́ pé wà á rò wípé wọ ń jèrora, yọ̀, tàbí ní àwọn ẹ̀dun ara náà gidi ni.
column4: Awọn oṣere ninu Mama Drama ṣe ere nla kan, tobẹẹ ti o le gbagbọ pe wọn ni iriri gbogbo irora, ayọ, ati gbogbo ẹdun ninu fiimu naa.

column2: The movie is well paced and has good, short scenes that pass across the message succinctly.
column3: Eré náà lọ dáradára, ó sì ní àwọn ìpín kúkurú tí wọn gbé ẹ̀kọ́ náà jáde dáradára.
column4: Fiimu naa ti lọ daradara ati pe o ni dara, awọn iwoye kukuru ti o kọja kọja ifiranṣẹ naa ni ṣoki.

column2: The storyline of Mama Drama is like a refreshing glass of rare wine, something different and unusual. It pushes the envelope.
column3: Ìtan-an Mama Drama náà tu ni lára, ó jẹ́ àrà ọ̀tọ̀. Ó tayọ.
column4: Itan itan ti Mama Drama dabi gilasi onitura ti ọti-waini toje, nkan ti o yatọ ati dani. O titari apoowe naa.

column2: The locations add to the appeal of the movie The Lady Called Life and makes the movie relatable. It is beautifully and artfully done, and leaves a good feeling.
column3: Àwọn agbègbè tí wọ́n ló jẹ́ kí eré e The Movie Called Life tún yé ni síi. Wọ́n ṣe é dáradára, ò sì múyàn gbádùn rẹ̀ è.
column4: Awọn ipo ṣe afikun si ifamọra ti fiimu The Lady Called Life ati pe o jẹ ki fiimu naa jẹ ibatan. O ti wa ni ẹwa ati ki o artfully ṣe, ati ki o fi oju kan ti o dara inú.

column2: One of the first things that strike you in This Lady Called Life are the vivid colours, they give the movie such a great quality.
column3: Oun kàn tí ó lè wù yàn jù nínú eré obìnrin tí à ń pè ní èémí ni àwọn àwọ̀ tó yanrantí, wọ́n fún eré náà ní ìtẹ̀jáde tí ó gbáyì.
column4: Ọkan ninu awọn ohun akọkọ ti o kọlu ọ ni Iyaafin ti a pe ni Igbesi aye jẹ awọn awọ ti o han gedegbe, wọn fun fiimu naa ni didara nla kan.

column2: This Lady Called Life is a gentle and sweet romantic comedy woven around the issues of childhood parental abuse and of generational curses.
column3: Obìnrin tí à ń pè ní èémí ní ìwà ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ àti eré ìfẹ́ papọ̀ mọ́ àwọn wàhálà tó jẹ mọ́ àìní ìtọ́jú òbí àti èpè àtìdílé wá.
column4: Arabinrin yii ti a pe ni Life jẹ onirẹlẹ ati awada aladun aladun ti a hun ni ayika awọn ọran ti ilokulo obi ti ọmọde ati ti awọn eegun iran.

column2: The chemistry between Efa Iwara and Bisola Ayeola is so lovely, and when Efa switches to his comedic role is actually hilarious.
column3: Àwọn eré ìfẹ́ tí ó wà láàrín-ín Éfà Ìwàrà àti Bísọ́lá Ayéọlá wuni púpọ̀, àtipé nígbàtí Éfà gbé àwọ̀ ti ẹ̀fẹ̀ wọ̀ ó pani lẹ́ẹ̀rín ní tòótọ́.
column4: Kemistri laarin Efa Iwara ati Bisola Ayeola jẹ ẹlẹwà pupọ, ati pe nigba ti Efa ba yipada si ipa alawada rẹ jẹ panilerin gidi.

column2: Breaded Life is a true Nigerian romantic comedy that will tug at your heartstrings, and you will want to see it again and again.
column3: Eré e Brẹ́dẹ́d laìfù jẹ́ eré ìfẹ́ ti ẹ̀fẹ̀ tí wàá fẹ́ràn láti wò nígbà gbogbo.
column4: Breaded Life jẹ awada ifẹ alafẹfẹ Naijiria gidi kan ti yoo fa awọn okun ọkan rẹ, ati pe iwọ yoo fẹ lati rii lẹẹkansi ati lẹẹkansi.

column2: Every single character in the movie did an excellent job.
column3: Gbogbo àwọn òṣèré inú eré yìí ni wọ́n ṣe isẹ́ takuntakun.
column4: Gbogbo ohun kikọ kan ninu fiimu naa ṣe iṣẹ ti o dara julọ.

column2: The locations are perfect for the movie, giving us such a rich viewing experience, moving us from the affluent neighbourhoods to the almost destitute areas where people have to work for daily wages.
column3: Ibi tí wọ́n ti ya eré yìí jẹ mọ́ ibi tí ó bá eré náà mu, èyí tí ó fún wa ní ìwòrán tó dára jù, ó gbé wá lọ kúrò ní ibi tí ǹkan ti rọrùn dé ibi tí àwọn èyàn ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ gbowó kí wọ́n tó lè jẹ.
column4: Awọn ipo jẹ pipe fun fiimu naa, fun wa ni iru iriri wiwo ọlọrọ, gbigbe wa lati awọn agbegbe ti o ni imọran si awọn agbegbe ti o fẹrẹẹgbẹ ti awọn eniyan ni lati ṣiṣẹ fun owo-iṣẹ ojoojumọ.

column2: The story draws you in so much that you find a bit of yourself in all the characters.
column3: Eré yìí ń fà ọ́ mọ́ra débi wípé, ó máa rí ara rẹ̀ẹ bí ara àwọn òṣèré inú rẹẹ̀.
column4: Itan naa fa ọ sinu pupọ ti o rii diẹ ninu ara rẹ ni gbogbo awọn kikọ.

column2: If you are looking for a tight plot, excellent acting, unusual reveals, and situational comedy, with a touch of home-grown romance, this is the movie for you.
column3: Tí o bá ń fẹ́ ìtàn tí ó dára, ìseré ti ó gbáyì, àwọn eré tí ò kọ́mọn, pẹ̀lú eré ìfẹ́ tilé fẹ́ẹ́rẹ́fẹ́, eré yìí ni fún ọ.
column4: Ti o ba n wa idite ti o muna, iṣe adaṣe ti o dara julọ, awọn ifihan dani, ati awada ipo, pẹlu ifọwọkan ti ifẹ ti ile, eyi ni fiimu naa fun ọ.

column2: This movie feels like a mish mash of under-developed ideas with a half hearted romance thrown in. It is not sure if it wants to be a comedy or a satire.
column3: Eré yìí dàbíi wípé ó jẹ àgbápọ̀ àwọn àbọ̀ odidi eré tí wọ́n tún fi eré ìfẹ́ sí. Kò jọ pé eré ẹ̀fẹ̀ lásán tàbí eré ẹ̀fẹ̀ àti sẹ ǹkan nínú ayé.
column4: Yi movie kan lara bi a mish mash ti labẹ-idagbasoke ero pẹlu kan idaji ọkàn romance sọ sinu. O ti wa ni ko daju ti o ba ti o fe lati wa ni a awada tabi a satire.

column2: The production quality of La Femme Anjola is very good. It is hard to believe it is not Rita Dominic singing directly, which speaks of very good directing and editing.
column3: Ìtẹ̀jáde fíìmù u La Femme Àńjọlá dára gidigidi. Ó le láti gbàgbọ́ pé Rita Dómínìkì kọ́ ló ń kọrin, èyí túnmàsípé olùdari àti olùsẹ̀tò eré yìí sịṣẹ́ wọn níṣẹ́.
column4: Didara iṣelọpọ ti La Femme Anjola dara pupọ. O nira lati gbagbọ pe kii ṣe Rita Dominic kọrin taara, eyiti o sọrọ ti itọsọna ti o dara pupọ ati ṣiṣatunṣe.

column2: I enjoyed seeing very good parts of Lagos, both on the mainland and the island, used, unlike other movies that stay in one location. Lagos is a beautiful place to shoot a movie, especially if the diversity of the state is put to use, as seen here. Accident scenes are usually tricky for Nollywood to portray, but it was a pleasant surprise to see a very believable one here.
column3: Mo gbàdún pé mo rí àwọn mélaǹdì àti áilàndì tí wọ́n lò, èyí yàtọ̀ sí àwọn eré mìíràn. Èkó jẹ́ ibi tí ó rẹwà láti ya fíìmù, pàápàá tí ó bá jẹ́ wípé àwọn èyàn aláràmbàrà ni wón lé lò gẹ́gẹ́ bi aṣe rí i nínú eré yìí. Àwọn apá ìjàm̀bá máa ń jẹ́ ìdàmù fún Nollywood láti ṣe, sùgbọ́n ìyàlẹ́nu ló jẹ́ pé wọ́n rí i ṣe níbí
column4: Mo gbádùn rírí àwọn apá ibi tó dáa gan-an nílùú Èkó, ní orí ilẹ̀ àti erékùṣù, tí wọ́n ń lò, yàtọ̀ sí àwọn fíìmù míì tó dúró síbi kan. Ilu Eko jẹ ibi ti o lẹwa lati ya fiimu kan, paapaa ti o ba jẹ pe awọn oniruuru ipinlẹ ni wọn lo, bi a ti rii nibi. Awọn iwoye ijamba nigbagbogbo jẹ ẹtan fun Nollywood lati ṣe afihan, ṣugbọn o jẹ iyalẹnu idunnu lati rii ọkan ti o gbagbọ pupọ nibi.

column2: La Femme Anjola is a well packaged Crime-thriller that deserves every award coming its way. I look forward to more beautiful storytelling like this. Movies of this overall outstanding quality may cost a bit more, but they are totally worth it. Nobody can tell our stories like us, and we need to tell them in ways that are unique to us.
column3: La femme Anjola jẹ́ eré tí ó kúnfún isé ìjàmbá tí saragágá gbogbo èbùn tí ó sín gbà sí ye. mò ún retí ìtàn síso tó  dùn bí eléyì. ìtàn dara osí  da yàtò
column4: La Femme Anjola jẹ apaniyan Crime-thriller ti o ṣajọpọ daradara ti o yẹ fun gbogbo ẹbun ti n bọ ni ọna rẹ. Mo nireti si itan-akọọlẹ ẹlẹwa diẹ sii bii eyi. Awọn fiimu ti didara to dayato ni gbogbogbo le jẹ diẹ diẹ sii, ṣugbọn wọn tọsi rẹ patapata. Ko si ẹnikan ti o le sọ awọn itan wa bi awa, ati pe a nilo lati sọ wọn ni awọn ọna ti o jẹ alailẹgbẹ si wa.

column2: The quality of the script cannot be faulted. It shows a well researched storyline that flows naturally and has no stilted parts. You would keep wondering, thinking you had solved the crime, only for you to later realise the script is several steps ahead of you. The movie is two and half hours in length, but there is no dull moment.
column3: akọ̀ lerí  ẹ̀bì nínú àkosílẹ̀ ojúlówó ìtan nàà.ó fi hàn pé ìwádi àkosílẹ̀ eré kò lábáwọ́n. ó ma jé ìyalénu fún e wá dè ma ró pé kí o ti ségun èsè náá,léyin ná lowá mòpé àkosílè ìtàn jù bose rò le. wákàtí méjì àbò ní eré ná sùgbón wón fi falẹ̀  rárá
column4: Didara iwe afọwọkọ ko le ṣe aṣiṣe. O ṣe afihan laini itan-akọọlẹ ti iwadii daradara ti o nṣàn nipa ti ara ati pe ko ni awọn ẹya ti o duro. Iwọ yoo ma ṣe iyalẹnu, ni ero pe o ti yanju irufin naa, nikan fun ọ lati rii nigbamii pe iwe afọwọkọ naa ni awọn igbesẹ pupọ siwaju rẹ. Fiimu naa jẹ wakati meji ati idaji ni gigun, ṣugbọn ko si akoko ṣigọgọ.

column2:
Not Recommended. Such a dumb movie. Hated every single solitary second of it. Horrendous rubbish!

Doesn't help that the only meaningful part comes at the very end & the soundtrack includes a nod to Great Fela Anikulapo Kuti 🇳🇬

That aside.

Ultimately, 2021's 'The Harder They Fall' is a plainly stupid movie. And it doesn't finish - Part 2 is coming. Íráánu 🤮
column3:
Kò s̩e é fo̩wó̩sò̩yà rárá pé ó dára. Eré tí kò nítumò̩ ni. Gbogbo è̩hun rè̩ kò̩ò̩kan ni kò wúlò. Ìranù pátápátá gbáà ni!
 
Kò sí àǹfààní Kankan pé è̩yìn pátápátá ni èyí tó dára díè̩ nínú eré wà ati pé lára orin inú rè̩ ni ti Fela Anikulapo Kuti NG 
 
Ìye̩n ò̩tò̩.
Paríparí gbogbo re̩, eré tí kò wúlò ni “The Harder Fall” tó jáde ló̩dún 2021. Kò tán síbè̩ o,- Apá kejì ń bò̩. Ìranù
column4:

Ko ṣe iranlọwọ pe apakan ti o ni itumọ nikan wa ni opin pupọ & ohun orin pẹlu ẹbun kan si Nla Fela Anikulapo Kuti 🇳🇬

Iyẹn ni apakan.

Ni ipari, ọdun 2021 'The Harder They Fall' jẹ fiimu aṣiwere ti o han gbangba. Ati pe ko pari - Apakan 2 n bọ. Íráánu 🤮

column2: Mofe ni Mofe' is a typical Yoruba movie made for African Magic Yoruba or even more appropriately; YouTube. It has no business in cinema.
column3: "Mofe ni mofe" jé̩ àkànṣe ère àgbéléwò tí a ṣe fún African Magic Yoruba tàbí fun YouTube. Kò ní nǹkan ṣe pe̩lu sinimá.
column4: Mofe ni Mofe' is a typical Yoruba movie made for African Magic Yoruba or even more appropriately; YouTube. Ko ni iṣowo ni sinima.

column2: Small Chops' is an awesomely stupid movie that is not worth paying premium for. In all fairness this movie should have been gently released on Iroko TV; definitely not in cinema. Following the now well established formula often used by counterfeit movie makers where they employ a flood of "beloved" comedians to mask the retardation of their movie and their own complete lack of talent, 'Small Chops' proves for all intents and purposes, to be two movies in one:
column3: "Small Chop" je̩ èré àgbéléwò tí kò tó̩ láti kówólé. Ní tilè̩ ni t'O̩lo̩run, orí Ìrókò TV ló yẹ̩ kí wọn tí ṣe eré yìí, kì í ṣe sinimá rárá. Nípa lílo ìlànà tí ayédèrú tí àwọ̩n eléré tí máa ń lo ò̩pò̩lo̩pò̩ a̩wo̩n aláwàdà láti lè fi de eré wọ̩n mọ́lẹ̀ bí ó tilè jé̩ pé eré náà kò ní àfihàn ẹ̀bùn kankan, "Small Chop" jé̩ eré méjì tó papọ̀ sójú kan.
column4: Kekere Chops' jẹ fiimu aṣiwere ti o wuyi ti ko tọ lati san owo-ori fun. Ni gbogbo ododo, fiimu yii yẹ ki o jẹ itusilẹ rọra lori TV Iroko; pato ko si ni sinima. Awọn wọnyi ni bayi daradara mulẹ agbekalẹ igba lo nipa counterfeit movie onisegun ibi ti nwọn bẹ kan ikun omi ti "olufẹ" comedians lati boju awọn retardation ti won movie ati awọn ara wọn pipe aini ti Talent, 'Small Chops' ododo fun gbogbo intents ati awọn idi, lati wa ni. fiimu meji ni ọkan:

column2: Special Jollof' is yet another cold turkey from Nollywood in Diaspora. And as usual; it is highlighted by a yéyé story and a plethora of half hearted acting performances. There's nothing to see here. It's a total waste of money and time.
column3: "Special Jollof" tún jé̩ eré mìíràn tí àwọn òs̩èré Nollywood tó wà ní Turkey ṣe ṣùgbọ́n tí kò gbádùn rárá. Eré yeye ni a fi ṣe bẹ̩́ẹ̩̀ ni ó kún fún onírúurú àwọn iṣé tí kò kún ojú òṣùwọ̀n. Kò sí ń kankan nínú eré yìí. Ìfàkókò àtowó ṣòfò lásán ni.
column4: Special Jollof' tun jẹ Tọki tutu miiran lati Nollywood ni Diaspora. Ati bi igbagbogbo; o jẹ afihan nipasẹ itan-akọọlẹ yéyé ati plethora ti awọn iṣe iṣere idaji ọkan. Ko si nkankan lati ri nibi. O ni a lapapọ egbin ti owo ati akoko.

column2: As far as comedy goes, 'Your Excellency' is a corpse. A freshly deceased corpse, it has only a few spasms of laughs to offer - A quip here and a giggle there, for most part however, it rendered the hall; Graveyard Silent. Its, was a story of gigantic failures; misfire after misfire, scene after scene closed to the tune of hissy echoes rather than "LOLs".
column3: Gé̩gé̩ bí ìlànà eré aje̩mé̩rìn-ín, òkú ní pátápátá gbáà ni "Your Excellency" Abala péréte ló wà níbè̩ tó lè pá ènìyàn lé̩rìn-ín. Àfàtamó̩ mó̩ àtamò̩ ni gbogbo àwàdà náà. S̩e ni gbogbo gbò̩ngàn dàbí ité̩ òkú. Àwàdà yìí gan án ni à bá máa pè ní àṣìṣe ńlá. Àṣìṣe ńlá gidigidi ni
column4: Bi awada se n lo, ‘Kabiyesi’ ni oku. A titun okú oku, o ni o ni nikan kan diẹ spasms ti ẹrín lati pese - A quip nibi ati ki o kan giggle nibẹ, fun julọ apakan sibẹsibẹ, o jigbe awọn alabagbepo; Ibojì ipalọlọ. Awọn oniwe-, je kan itan ti gigantic ikuna; misfire lẹhin misfire, iṣẹlẹ lẹhin ti awọn iṣẹlẹ pipade si tune ti hissy iwoyi kuku ju "LOLs".

column2: The Enemy I know' is an extremely lazy concoction. Everything about it is below par - even the "police woman" shows the back of her I.D card whilst effecting an arrest - whereas; this is 2019 and "Aki & Paw Paw" mistakes such as this are untenable in cinema. Ridiculous!
column3: Àtòpò̩ ìṣé̩ ọ̀lẹ àti ìmé̩lé ni "The Enemy I Know". Kò sí nǹkankan nípa rè̩ tó kún ojú òṣùwọ̀n. Kódà, ọlọ́pàá gan-an kò ṣe ìtó̩jú káàdì ìdánimò̩ rẹ̩̀ dáadáa nígbà tó lọ mú ènìyàn. O̩dún 2019 nìyí, kò yẹ kí a máa rí irú àṣìṣe aki àti pawpaw  báyìí lásìkò yìí. Eléyìí bu ènìyàn kú!
column4: Ota ti mo mọ' jẹ ẹya lalailopinpin ọlẹ concoction. Ohun gbogbo nipa rẹ wa ni isalẹ par - paapaa “obinrin ọlọpaa” ṣe afihan ẹhin kaadi ID rẹ lakoko ti o n mu imuni mu - lakoko; Eyi jẹ ọdun 2019 ati awọn aṣiṣe “Aki & Paw Paw” bii eyi ko ṣee ṣe ni sinima. yeye!

column2: Social Media 101' is lazily unoriginal. This is the handiwork of an ideas pirate; someone who plagiarizes the creative ideas of others, makes them his own and seeks to profit from same. Plagiarism! That is the stuff 'Social Media 101' is made of. The producers put not an iota of creativity into making this a movie.
column3: Àhunpò̩ ìṣé̩ ìmé̩lé̩ tí kí í ṣe ojúlówó ni "Social Media 101". Isẹ́ ọwọ́ àwọn tó ń ṣ̩e àgbélè̩ro̩ sinima ni èyí. Àwọn ló ń sọ isẹ́ onísé̩ di tiwọn. Àpẹrẹ sísọ ìṣe onísé̩ di tẹni ni "Social Media 101" jé̩. Kò sí àfihàn ọgbọ́n àtinúdá kankan ní́bè̩.
column4: Media Awujọ 101' jẹ aibikita lasily. Eyi ni iṣẹ ọwọ ti Pirate ero; ẹnikan ti o plagiarizes awọn Creative ero ti awọn miran, ṣe wọn ti ara rẹ ati ki o nwá a ere lati kanna. Pipajẹ! Iyẹn ni nkan naa 'Social Media 101' ti ṣe. Awọn olupilẹṣẹ ko fi iota ti ẹda sinu ṣiṣe fiimu yii.

column2: They just sewed together different jokes, memes and videos of little known comics that have gone viral on Nigerian social media, called it their own movie and brought it to cinema. If you are Big on social media, you will have seen many of them, many times before. And you are not likely to find them to be very funny here as the producers even fail to excel at plagiarism, leaving 'Social Media 101' plagued by bottom of the barrel acting, very boring dialogue and particularly horrible scene lighting. This is all round ridiculous!
column3: Wó̩n kàn s̩e àtòpò̩ ò̩kan-ò-jò̩kan ẹ̀fẹ̀, àwọn àwòrán apanilérìn-in tó ti wà lórí ìtàkùn abánidó̩rè̩é̩ lásán ni. Wọ́n tó gbogbo rẹ papọ̀ wọn sì pè é ní eré tiwọn. Tí ó bá jẹ́ ẹni tó wà lórí ìtàkùn abánidó̩rè̩é̩ ni, wà á ti ṣe àkíyèsí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ won bẹ́ẹ̀ni kò sì dájú pé wo̩n yóò pa ọ́ lé̩rìnín. Ìkùnà pátápátá ni "Social Media 101". Ìdójútì ńlá ni!
column4: Won kan ran orisiirisii awada, memes ati fidio awon alawada kekere kan ti won ti gbo kiri lori ero ayelujara Nàìjíríà, ti won n pe ni sinima tiwon ti won si gbe e wa si sinima. Ti o ba jẹ Big lori media media, iwọ yoo ti rii ọpọlọpọ ninu wọn, ni ọpọlọpọ igba ṣaaju iṣaaju. Ati pe o ko ṣee ṣe lati rii wọn lati jẹ ẹrin pupọ nibi bi awọn olupilẹṣẹ paapaa kuna lati tayọ ni plagiarism, nlọ 'Social Media 101' ti o ni iyọnu nipasẹ isalẹ ti iṣe agba, ijiroro alaidun pupọ ati paapaa ina iṣẹlẹ ibanilẹru. Eleyi jẹ gbogbo yika yeye!

column2: Utterly not recommended. 'My London Slave' is complete hogwash. A total waste of money. There's no way you go in to see this and come out happy. Because, everything about this sham of a movie is calculated to irritate you. And it will. Please, don't pay for misery.
column3: "My London Slave" kò tilè̩ yẹ̩ fún wíwò rárá. Ìfowójóná ni. Kò sí ẹnì tí yóò wọ ere yìí tí inú rẹ kò ní bàjé̩ pé òun fowó jóná torí pé wọn ṣe àgbékalè̩ gbogbo nǹkan tó wà nínú eré náà ni lati bà ọ́ nínú jẹ. Lóòótọ́ ni. Nítorí náà, mo bẹ ọ kí ó má sún owó rẹ níná.
column4: Ko ṣe iṣeduro patapata. 'Ẹrú London mi' jẹ pipe hogwash. A lapapọ egbin ti owo. Ko si ọna ti o wọle lati wo eyi ki o jade ni idunnu. Nitoripe, ohun gbogbo nipa ẹtan ti fiimu kan jẹ iṣiro lati bi ọ ninu. Ati pe yoo. Jọwọ, maṣe sanwo fun ipọnju.

column2: Father of Today' is just too basic to be in cinema. It's not horrible as to be completely unwatchable. It's just too basic. Literally, everything in 'Father of Today' is skin and bones, bear minimum, ground floor basic. The acting is leisurely. Production feels home made. And the story-telling is very amateurish.
column3: "Father of Today" tí lọ tààrà jù láti wá sí sinima. Kì Í ṣe pé kò dára láti wò, ṣùgbọ́n ó ti lọ tààrà jù. Gbogbo ohun tó wà nínú "Father of Today" jé̩ gbèdéke kékeré tí eré yẹ̩ kí o ní. Eré naa fihan pé àwo̩n tó ṣe é kí í ṣe akós̩é̩mo̩sé̩ òs̩èré.
column4: Baba ti Loni' jẹ ipilẹ pupọ lati wa ni sinima. O ni ko oburewa bi lati wa ni patapata unwatchable. O kan ju ipilẹ. Ni itumọ ọrọ gangan, ohun gbogbo ti o wa ninu 'Baba ti Loni' jẹ awọ ati egungun, agbateru o kere ju, ipilẹ ilẹ-ilẹ. Iṣẹ iṣe jẹ fàájì. Production kan lara ile ṣe. Ati awọn itan-sọ jẹ gidigidi amateurish.

column2: Not recommended for anybody. Not even children. Very irritating movie, 'Another Father's Day' will leave you with a migraine. With terrible acting and an outstandingly imbecilic story-line, this ridiculous low grade Disney wannabe excuse of a comedy will make anyone and everyone lose interest in Nollywood forever. Such a sham. And a terrible waste, this is what comes of writing stories and producing movies with the sole intention of advertising an amusement park, but people shouldn't have to pay to watch long-form adverts. We strongly suggest you stay far away from this filth if you value your time and energy.
column3: Eré yìí kò dára rárá fún ẹnikẹ́ni títí kan àwọn ọmọdé. Eré tó ń run ènìyàn ninu ni eré "Another Father's Day". Eré tó lè ru ìbínú sókè nínú ènìyàn ni eré yìí. Ò̩nà eré sís̩e yii kò gbé iṣé̩ o̩po̩lo̩ jáde rárá. Eré tó lè mú kí ènìyàn má nífẹ̀é̩ sí Nollywood ni eré yìí jé̩. Ìfowó àtàkókò àti agbára ṣòfò ni. Àtúbọ̀tán ère o̩ló̩mo̩kúùyà nìyí. A rọ̩ àwọ̩n olólùfẹ́ ère àgbéléwò láti má fi àkókò wọn ṣòfò lórí irú ère yìí.
column4: Ko ṣe iṣeduro fun ẹnikẹni. Ko paapaa awọn ọmọde. Fiimu ibinu pupọ, 'Ọjọ Baba miiran' yoo fi ọ silẹ pẹlu migraine. Pẹlu iṣere ti o buruju ati laini itan-itan aibikita ti iyalẹnu, ẹgan kekere ite Disney wannabe ikewo ti awada kan yoo jẹ ki ẹnikẹni ati gbogbo eniyan padanu ifẹ si Nollywood lailai. Iru ẹtan bẹẹ. Ati pe o jẹ egbin ẹru, eyi ni ohun ti o wa ti kikọ awọn itan ati ṣiṣe awọn fiimu pẹlu aniyan nikan ti ipolowo ọgba iṣere kan, ṣugbọn eniyan ko yẹ ki o sanwo lati wo awọn ipolowo fọọmu gigun. A daba pe ki o jinna si idoti yii ti o ba ni iye akoko ati agbara rẹ.

column2: Made in Heaven' is a stupid movie. It is so stupid, it will irritate you to the point you will start laughing out of sheer frustration. You will grow so weary seeing it, you will suddenly find yourself feeling as though you just might be enjoying the foolishness of this foolish movie. Very ridiculous movie. Complete rubbish!
column3: Ere àwọn òpònú tí kò mú ọpọlọ lọ́wọ́ rárá ní eré "Made in Heaven" jẹ́. Ẹni tó bá wo ère yìí kò ni í mọ ìgbà tí òun yóò máa ré̩rìn in látàrí ìbínú tí ere náà lè fà. Ère tó lè fà ìrẹ̀wẹ̀sì ọkàn ni. Réderède tó kún inú ère náà tó láti pá ènìyàn lẹrin-in. Òsì pátápátá gbáà ni ère yìí.
column4: Ṣe ni Ọrun' ni a Karachi movie. Omugọ ni, yoo binu ọ si aaye ti iwọ yoo bẹrẹ sii rẹrin nitori ibanujẹ lasan. Iwọ yoo rẹrẹ pupọ lati rii i, iwọ yoo rii ararẹ lojiji ni rilara bi ẹni pe o kan le gbadun iwa aṣiwere ti fiimu aṣiwere yii. fiimu ẹlẹgàn pupọ. Idoti pipe!

column2: Such a shame really. We saw this earlier today, with a small audience of ladies and guys; couples and individuals alike- The irritation in the hall was uniform. So it was that; as we trooped out of the hall, unusually, standing at the door was a lady, we suspect she works for the cinema. She asked everyone together: "What did you think about the movie?" And as if rehearsed, the phrases "Rubbish movie" and "Very stupid" immediately rent the air, echoing from one person to the next. We were not surprised. Because you see, the biggest shame here is that we predicted this would happen.
column3: Eré yìí tí ènìyàn lójú púpọ̀. Àárọ̀ yìí là rí èyí pèlú àwọn òǹwòran lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin àti àwọn ló̩ko̩láya. Bákan náà ni ìsesí àwọ̩n ènìyàn nípa ère yìí. A dúró lẹ́nu ò̩nà gbò̩ngàn sinimá bí àwọn ènìyàn ṣe ń tú jáde. Kò pé tí a rí obìnrin kan tí a fura sí pé ó ń ṣiṣé̩ ni ilé sinimá. Ó bi gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn lápapò̩ pé kí ni wọ́n rí sí ère yìí? Àfi bí ìgbà pé gbogbo ènìyàn tí ń retí ìbéèrè yìí. "ìranù"  "ìfowósòfò" àti bẹ́ẹ̀bé̩è̩̀ lọ ní àwọn ènìyàn fi dáhùn. Ṣùgbọ́n èyí kò yà wá lẹ́nu rárá torí pé a ti mọ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀ pé réderède ní í gbè̩yìn eré òṣùpá
column4: Iru itiju gan. A ri yi sẹyìn loni, pẹlu kan kekere jepe ti tara ati awọn enia buruku; awọn tọkọtaya ati awọn ẹni-kọọkan bakanna- Awọn irritation ni alabagbepo wà aṣọ. Nitorina o jẹ pe; bi a ti jade kuro ni gbongan, ni aiṣedeede, duro ni ẹnu-ọna jẹ iyaafin kan, a fura pe o ṣiṣẹ fun sinima naa. O beere lọwọ gbogbo eniyan papọ: "Kini o ro nipa fiimu naa?" Ati pe bi ẹnipe a tun ṣe atunṣe, awọn gbolohun ọrọ "fiimu idọti" ati "aṣiwere pupọ" yalo afẹfẹ lẹsẹkẹsẹ, ti n ṣe atunṣe lati ọdọ eniyan kan si ekeji. Kò yà wá lẹ́nu. Nitoripe o rii, itiju nla julọ nibi ni pe a sọ asọtẹlẹ eyi yoo ṣẹlẹ.

column2: Unwatchable
column3: Kò ṣe é wo.
column4: Aibojumu

column2:
Absolute rubbish

I'm always on the hunt for a good Rom Com to watch with my wife. This had a review score over 6, so we gave it a crack. We literally stopped watching it after 10 minutes. Rubbish acting, like cringe worthy acting. I don't know who reviewed this with high scores in the past, but it's not worth the watch. The acting was just "that bad". Plus the story, as far as we watched was just terrible, b-grade stuff.
column3:
Ìranù pátápátá. 
 
Mo fẹ́ràn láti máa wò ère tó jẹ́ ti olólùfẹ́ tó sì panile̩rin láti máa wò pẹ̀lú ìyàwó mi. Ìpele kẹfà ní wón fi ère yìí sí. Kò pé̩ rárá tí a bẹ̀rẹ̀ àgbéyè̩wò eré yìí ni a rí í pé ere tí kò wúlò ni. Ń ko mọ ẹni tó ṣe àgbéyè̩wò ère yìí tó sì gbé e sí ìpele kẹfà. Ere yìí kò gbádùn rárá. Fún ìwò̩nba tí a wò pẹ̀lú ìtàn rẹ̩̀, kò wúni lórí rárá.
column4:
Idoti pipe

Mo wa nigbagbogbo fun Rom Com to dara lati wo pẹlu iyawo mi. Eleyi ní a awotẹlẹ Dimegilio lori 6, ki a fun o kan kiraki. A duro gangan wiwo rẹ lẹhin iṣẹju mẹwa 10. Iṣe idọti, bii iṣere ti o yẹ. Emi ko mọ ẹniti o ṣe atunyẹwo eyi pẹlu awọn ikun giga ni iṣaaju, ṣugbọn ko tọsi aago naa. Iṣe naa jẹ " buburu yẹn . Ni afikun itan naa, niwọn bi a ti nwo jẹ ẹru nikan, nkan ipele-b.”

column2: RHH Review
column3: Àgbéyè̩wò RHH
column4: RHH Review

column2:
One-way traffic plot, average movie at best.

Lionheart was a movie that generated a lot of buzz in the Nollywood industry. Considering the international support it got from Netflix, I was particularly excited to see how this movie went.

From the get go the movie wears an indigenous look with local scenery and an instant banter in local language.

However, it was one way traffic from there onwards, as the movie progressed.

The plot is totally bare and overly predictable, and I'm still reeling from the shock of this being a comedy film.

However, I still applaud the production quality of this film as it was great and a large chunk of the headline cast delivered on their script-save for Peter Okoye who was highly disappointing.

For a directorial debut, one can only applaud the courage of Genevieve in pulling off this movie.

On a final note, you are not guaranteed to have a good time watching this, and do not expect any fireworks.
column3:
È̩hun olópòó kan ni, ó dára bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀.
"Lionheart" jé̩ eré tó fa ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ awuyewuye ni ilé-is̩é̩ Nollywood. Wó irú atile̩yin ilè̩ òkèèrè tó rí gbà ló̩wó̩ Netflix, inú èmi pàápàá dùn láti rí bí èrè yìí ṣe lọ. 
Láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹpẹ ni ère yìí tí sàfihàn pé tíwantiwa ni, kò sì pé̩ rárá tí a fi rí ìsò̩rò̩ǹgbèsì lédè Yorùbá. 
 
 
 
Ṣùgbọ́n ère náà fihàn pe olópòó kan ni bí ó ṣe n tẹ̀ síwájú. 
 
 
È̩hun rẹ̀ kò ní ipa kankan, ketekete ni ènìyàn lè sọ nǹkan tó kàn nínú eré náà. Ìyàlẹ́nu ni èyí jẹ́. 
 
Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, mo sì gbóríyìn fún ìgbèjàde ère náà nítorí pé ó gbámús̩é àti pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ẹ̀dá ìtàn ni wọ́n kó ipa wọn bí ó ṣe tọ́ àti bí ó ṣe yẹ̩ àyàfi Peter Okoye tó já wá kule. 
 
 
Fún tí ìdarí, àfi kí ènìyàn gbóríyìn fún ìgboyà Genevieve fun ìṣe takuntakun to ṣe. 
 
Lákòótán, kò sí ìdánilójú pé wà á gbádùn ẹ̀fẹ̀ yìí bí ó ṣe lérò
column4:
“Idite ijabọ ọna kan, fiimu apapọ ni o dara julọ.

Lionheart jẹ fiimu ti o ṣe agbejade ọpọlọpọ ariwo ni ile-iṣẹ Nollywood. Ṣiyesi atilẹyin agbaye ti o gba lati Netflix, Mo ni itara pupọ lati rii bii fiimu yii ṣe lọ.

Lati ijade lọ fiimu naa wọ iwo ara abinibi pẹlu iwoye agbegbe ati banter lẹsẹkẹsẹ ni ede agbegbe.

Sibẹsibẹ, o jẹ ọna kan ijabọ lati ibẹ siwaju, bi fiimu naa ti nlọsiwaju.

Idite naa jẹ igboro patapata ati asọtẹlẹ aṣeju, ati pe Mo tun n ṣan silẹ lati iyalẹnu ti eyi jẹ fiimu awada.

Sibẹsibẹ, Mo tun ṣe iyìn fun didara iṣelọpọ ti fiimu yii bi o ti jẹ nla ati pe o tobi pupọ ti simẹnti akọle ti a fi jiṣẹ lori iwe afọwọkọ wọn-fipamọ fun Peter Okoye ti o jẹ itiniloju pupọ.

Fun Uncomfortable director, ọkan le kan yìn ìgboyà ti Genevieve ni a fa si pa yi movie.

Ni akọsilẹ ipari, o ko ni iṣeduro lati ni akoko ti o dara wiwo eyi, ati pe ko nireti eyikeyi iṣẹ ina. ”
